page.title: List of serial killers by country

revision.text:
{{short description|Wikipedia list article}} {{pp-semi-indef}} {{Use dmy dates|date=November 2019}} This is a list of '''notable [[serial killer]]s, by the country''' where most of the killings occurred. {{TOC right}}
==Convicted serial killers by country== ===Afghanistan=== *[[Abdullah Shah]]: killed at least twenty travelers on the road from [[Kabul]] to [[Jalalabad]] serving under [[Zardad Khan]]; also killed his wife; executed on 20 April 2004.<ref name="BBC">{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/south_asia/3662935.stm |title=Former Afghan commander executed |date=27 April 2004 |website=[[BBC News Online|BBC News]] |accessdate=20 August 2009}}</ref>
===Antigua and Barbuda=== *[[John Baughman]]: former American police officer who pushed his second wife from the roof of the Royal Antiguan Hotel in 1995; suspected of killing a close friend and first wife back in the USA; committed suicide in 2000.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.chicagotribune.com/news/ct-xpm-2000-06-02-0006020165-story.html |title=Family's Built-Up Pain Eased By Hanging In Antigua |first1=Marla |last1=Donato |first2=David |last2=Heinzmann |date=June 2, 2000 |newspaper=[[Chicago Tribune]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===Argentina=== *[[Marcelo Antelo]]: also known as "The [[San La Muerte]] Killer"; drug addict who killed at least four people between February and August 2010, allegedly in the name of a pagan saint; sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.clarin.com/crimenes/largo-prontuario-Marcelo-Antelo_0_SyXXJx2DXg.html |title=El largo prontuario de Marcelo Antelo |trans-title=The long record of Marcelo Antelo |first1=Horacio |last1=Ezcurra |first2=Rodrigo |last2=Ezcurra |first3=Marcelo |last3=Antelo |lastauthoramp=yes |date=September 9, 2012 |newspaper=[[Clarín (Argentine newspaper)|Clarín]] |language=es |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.today/20190910080104/https://www.clarin.com/crimenes/largo-prontuario-Marcelo-Antelo_0_SyXXJx2DXg.html |archivedate=September 10, 2019}}</ref> *[[Florencio Fernández]]: also known as "The Argentine Vampire"; killed fifteen women in his hometown of [[Monteros]] during the 1950s. *[[Cayetano Santos Godino]]: also known as "Petiso Orejudo" ("Big Eared Midget"); at 16, killed four children in 1912; died in prison in 1944.<ref name=CA>{{cite web |url=http://www.casoabierto.com/reportajes/cronica-negra/cayetano-santos-godino-la-historia-del-petiso-orejudo.html |title=Cayetano Santos Godino, la historia del Petiso Orejudo |last=Cabezas López |first=Carlos |date=2007-09-16 |website=Caso Abierto |language=es |url-status=dead |accessdate=2008-09-12 |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080801214210/http://www.casoabierto.com/reportajes/cronica-negra/cayetano-santos-godino-la-historia-del-petiso-orejudo.html |archivedate=2008-08-01}}</ref> *[[Cayetano Domingo Grossi]]: the first serial killer in Argentine history; Italian immigrant who murdered five of his newborn children between 1896 and 1898; executed 1900.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.acciontv.com.ar/soca/polis/enero13/grosi.htm |title=El fusilamiento de Cayetano Grossi (1900) |trans-title=The execution of Cayetano Grossi (1900) |website=AcciónTV |language=es |access-date=12 November 2015}}</ref> *[[Francisco Antonio Laureana]]: also known as "The Satyr of [[San Isidro, Buenos Aires|San Isidro]]"; murdered fifteen women from 1974 to 1975, raping thirteen of them; killed in a shootout with the police in 1975.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.diariopopular.com.ar/notas/182535-francisco-laureana-el-serial-san-isidro |title=Francisco Laureana, el serial de San Isidro |last=Kablan |first=Pablo |date=February 2, 2014 |newspaper=[[Diario Popular]] |language=es |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Yiya Murano]]: also known as "The Poisoner of [[Monserrat, Buenos Aires|Monserrat]]", poisoned three women in [[Buenos Aires]] in 1979. *[[Robledo Puch]]: also known as "The Death Angel" and "The Black Angel"; killed eleven people before his arrest in 1972; sentenced to [[life imprisonment]] in 1980.<ref name="lanacion">{{cite news |url=https://www.lanacion.com.ar/lifestyle/robledo-puch-el-angel-negro-nid785598 |title=Robledo Puch: The Black Angel |first=Alvaro |last=Abós |date=5 March 2006 |newspaper=[[La Nación]] |accessdate=7 April 2014}}</ref>
===Australia=== *[[John Balaban (serial killer)|John Balaban]]: also known as the "Romanian Maniac"; Romanian emigrant who murdered at least five people in France and Australia from 1948 to 1953, including his wife and her family; executed 1953.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article49262393 |title=Murder Confession Alleged |date=4 May 1953 |newspaper=[[The Barrier Miner]] |volume=LXVI |issue=17445 |location=[[Broken Hill]], New South Wales |accessdate=12 November 2019 |page=1 |via=National Library of Australia}}</ref> *[[David and Catherine Birnie]]: responsible for the "Moorhouse Murders"; couple from the [[Perth]] suburb of [[Willagee, Western Australia|Willagee]] who raped and murdered four women in 1986.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.trutv.com/library/crime/serial_killers/partners/birnie/1_index.html |title=The Birnies - 2. A Serial Killer in Perth |last=Kidd |first=Paul B. |date=12 February 2007 |website=CourtTV CrimeLibrary |publisher=Courtroom Television Network, LLC. |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20081123125648/http://www.trutv.com/library/crime/serial_killers/partners/birnie/2.html |archivedate=23 November 2008}}</ref> *[[Gregory Brazel]]: [[Victoria (Australia)|Victoria]] man who shot a woman to death in a 1982 armed robbery, and murdered two prostitutes in 1990.<ref name=killerpayout>{{cite news |url=http://www.theaustralian.news.com.au/story/0,20867,20409851-5006785,00.html |title=Killer gets compensation payout |first=Mark |last=Butler |date=14 September 2006 |newspaper=[[The Australian]] |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20060915121802/http://www.theaustralian.news.com.au/story/0,20867,20409851-5006785,00.html |archive-date=2006-09-15}}</ref><ref name=killerlist>{{cite news |url=http://www.news.com.au/heraldsun/story/0,21985,20673356-661,00.html |title=Killer caught with jail list |first=Mark |last=Butler |date=31 October 2006 |newspaper=[[Herald Sun|Sunday Herald Sun]] |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110615104135/http://www.heraldsun.com.au/news/victoria/killer-caught-with-jail-list/story-e6frf7kx-1111112443202 |archive-date=15 June 2011}}</ref> *[[John Bunting (serial killer)|John Bunting]], [[Robert Wagner (serial killer)|Robert Wagner]] and [[James Vlassakis]]: also known as the "Bodies in the Barrels Murders"; convicted of the [[Snowtown murders]] of twelve people between 1992 and 1999.<ref name="haydon trial">{{cite news |url=http://www.smh.com.au/news/National/Bodiesinbarrels-trial-not-over/2004/12/19/1103391631199.html |title=Bodies-in-barrels trial not over |agency=[[Australian Associated Press|AAP]] |date=19 December 2004 |newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |accessdate=11 January 2014}}</ref> *[[Robert Francis Burns]]: confessed to eight killings; hanged in [[Ararat, Victoria|Ararat]] in 1883.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article198269401 |title=Burns's Confession Sustained |newspaper=[[Mount Alexander Mail]] |issue=7696 |location=[[Castlemaine, Victoria]] |date=3 December 1883 |access-date=24 November 2019 |page=3 |via=National Library of Australia}}</ref> *[[Clarke brothers|Thomas and John Clarke]]: [[bushranger]] brothers who robbed railroad stations; killed five police officers; the Felons Apprehension Act of 1886, which allowed bushrangers to be killed on sight, was created because of them; both hanged 1867.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.anzlhsejournal.auckland.ac.nz/pdfs_2005/Eburn.pdf |title=Outlawry in Colonial Australia: The Felons Apprehension Acts 1865 –1899 |last=Eburn |first=Michael |date=2005 |website=Australian and New Zealand Law and History Society E-Journal |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110411043023/http://www.anzlhsejournal.auckland.ac.nz/pdfs_2005/Eburn.pdf |archive-date=April 11, 2011}}</ref> *[[Eric Edgar Cooke]]: also known as the "Night Caller"; killed at least eight people and attempted to kill many more in and around Perth between 1959 and 1963; last person to be hanged in [[Western Australia]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.postnewspapers.com.au/20030201/news/002.shtml |title=Police decoy used in killer hunt sting |last=Christian |first=Bret |date=February 1, 2003 |newspaper=[[Post Newspapers]] |location=[[Subiaco, Western Australia]] |accessdate=2006-09-21 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20030202114507/http://www.postnewspapers.com.au/20030201/news/002.shtml |url-status=dead |archive-date=2 February 2003}}</ref> *[[John Leslie Coombes]]: killed two men in 1984 and one woman in 2009 around the Victoria area.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.theage.com.au/victoria/triple-killer-to-die-in-jail-for-murder-that-ought-never-have-happened-20110826-1jddd.html |title=Triple killer to die in jail for murder that 'ought never have happened' |first1=Paul |last1=Millar |first2=Andrea |last2=Petrie |date=2011-08-26 |newspaper=[[The Age]] |location=[[Melbourne]] |access-date=2017-09-03}}</ref> *[[Bandali Debs]]: convicted of murdering two police officers and two prostitutes in the 1990s.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.abc.net.au/news/2010-11-09/man-charged-15-years-after-prostitutes-murder/2330196 |title=Man charged 15 years after prostitute's murder |date=November 9, 2010 |website=[[ABC News (Australia)|ABC News]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Paul Denyer]]: also known as the "Frankston Killer"; murdered three women in 1993 in the [[Melbourne]] suburb of [[Frankston, Victoria|Frankston]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.adelaidenow.com.au/news/national/killers-family-dont-let-him-out/news-story/59e38892e8170309ccd633d1da3ffca4?sv=c839876f55e2e282e956202a2e18d4b5 |title=Family of Paul Denyer tell of killer's death threat |last=Deery |first=Shannon |date=July 21, 2011 |newspaper=[[Herald Sun]] |location=Melbourne |access-date=2018-01-28}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=http://aussiecriminals.com.au/high-profile-criminals/paul-charles-denyer-the-frankston-serial-killer/ |title=Paul Charles Denyer -The Frankston Serial Killer |author=Robbo |date=2012-04-20 |website=Aussie Criminals and Crooks |access-date=2018-01-28 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120709001907/http://aussiecriminals.com.au/high-profile-criminals/paul-charles-denyer-the-frankston-serial-killer/ |archive-date=July 9, 2012}}</ref> *[[Peter Dupas]]: serving three life sentences for multiple murder and rape charges in Victoria.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.theage.com.au/articles/2004/08/12/1092102597125.html?from=storylhs |title=Call for second life term for murderer Dupas |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=13 August 2004 |newspaper=The Age |location=Melbourne |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Kathleen Folbigg]]: murdered four of her infants between 1991 and 1999.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.theage.com.au/articles/2003/08/29/1062050669977.html |title=Killing them softly |first1=Julie |last1=Szego |first2=Stephen |last2=Cauchi |date=30 August 2003 |newspaper=The Age |location=Melbourne |accessdate=14 September 2008}}</ref> *[[Leonard Fraser]]: also known as the "Rockhampton Rapist"; convicted of killing four women in [[Rockhampton, Queensland]].<ref>{{cite journal |url=http://www.pansw.org.au/PolNews/Nov38-52.pdf |title=From Sexual Predator to Murderer |last=Bassingthwaighte |first=Ted |date=November 2006 |journal=Police News |publisher=[[Police Association of New South Wales]] |accessdate=2 January 2007 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20050615215035/http://pansw.org.au/PolNews/Nov38-52.pdf |archivedate=15 June 2005}}</ref> *[[John Wayne Glover]]: also known as the "Granny Killer"; killed six elderly women on Sydney's [[North Shore (Sydney)|North Shore]]; committed suicide in 2005.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.smh.com.au/news/national/granny-killer-found-dead-in-cell/2005/09/09/1125772681493.html |title=Granny killer found dead in cell |last1=Gibson |first1=Jano |date=9 September 2005 |newspaper=[[The Sydney Morning Herald]] |accessdate=9 October 2015}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.smh.com.au/news/national/mystery-woman-pays-for-killers-funeral/2005/09/17/1126750168519.html |title=Mystery woman pays for killer's funeral |last1=O'Dwyer |first1=Erin |date=18 September 2005 |newspaper=The Sydney Morning Herald |accessdate=9 October 2015}}</ref> *[[Caroline Grills]]: also known as "Auntie Thally"; a serial [[Poison#Uses of poison|poisoner]] of five family members in [[New South Wales]] between 1947 and 1953.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.smh.com.au/news/National/Murder-tried-and-true/2005/02/10/1107890341655.html |title=Murder, tried and true |date=11 February 2003 |newspaper=The Sydney Morning Herald |accessdate=2008-01-16}}</ref> *[[Paul Steven Haigh]]: sentenced to life imprisonment without parole for the murders of seven people in Victoria in the late 1970s.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.smh.com.au/national/serial-killer-wins-right-to-seek-parole-20110419-1dml5.html |title=Serial killer wins right to seek parole |first=Belinda |last=Merhab |date=April 19, 2011 |newspaper=The Sydney Morning Herald |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Matthew James Harris]]: strangled a friend's brother, a female friend, and a male neighbor to death over five weeks in 1998 in [[Wagga Wagga]].<ref>{{cite AustLII|NSWSC|285|2000|litigants=R v Matthew James Harris|date=7 April 2000 |courtname=auto}}</ref> *[[Thomas Jeffries]]: Tasmanian [[penal colony]] escapee responsible for the murders of five people; executed in 1826.<ref>Thomas Jeffries convict No. 3634, conduct record, State Archives of Tasmania.</ref> *[[Frances Knorr]]: also known as the "Baby Farming Murderess"; English-born baby farmer who killed three infants; executed 1894.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cv.vic.gov.au/stories/felon-families-/9300/felon-families-/ |title=Felon families: Stories of women prisoners and their families |last=Gardiner |first=Diane |date=2016 |website=National Trust of Australia (Victoria) |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Eddie Leonski]]: also known as the "Brownout Strangler"; United States Army soldier who killed three women in [[Melbourne]]; executed in 1942.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article231786070 |title=Melbourne Police Hunt "Brownout" Strangler |newspaper=[[The Sun (Sydney)|The Sun]] |issue=10100 |location=Sydney, New South Wales |date=20 May 1942 |accessdate=16 March 2017 |page=3 |via=National Library of Australia}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article168972547 |title=Leonski, Enigma In Life And In Death, Carries His Secret To Grave |newspaper=[[Truth (Sydney newspaper)|Truth]] |issue=2758 |location=Sydney, New South Wales |date=15 November 1942 |accessdate=16 March 2017 |page=14 |via=National Library of Australia}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article75783558 |title=Killed To Show His Strength |newspaper=[[The Mirror (Western Australia)|The Mirror]] |volume=29 |issue=1612 |location=Perth, Western Australia |date=19 April 1952 |accessdate=16 March 2017 |page=8 |via=National Library of Australia}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.heraldsun.com.au/news/law-order/macabre-and-detailed-hangmans-journal-reproduced-in-detail-for-true-crime-scene/news-story/a98b17a1bc653a9f2e034ac32873781b?sv=c73ce64e6658e0bf838435a046bd3579 |title=Macabre and detailed hangman's journal reproduced in detail for True Crime Scene |last1=Robinson |first1=Russell |date=2012-06-03 |newspaper=[[Herald Sun]] |location=Melbourne |accessdate=26 December 2017}}</ref> *[[John Lynch (serial killer)|John Lynch]]: also known as the "[[Berrima, New South Wales|Berrima]] Axe Murderer"; killed ten people from 1835 to 1841.<ref>{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com.au/books?id=nVJD6V0XAtwC&pg=PT32&lpg=PT32&dq=john+lynch+murderer#v=onepage&q=john%20lynch%20murderer |title=Australia's Serial Killers |last=Kidd |first=Paul B. |date=1 August 2011 |publisher=[[Pan Macmillan Australia]] |isbn=978-1-74262-798-4 |page=32}}</ref> *[[William MacDonald (serial killer)|William MacDonald]]: also known as the "Mutilator"; English immigrant who killed at least five men between June 1961 and April 1963 throughout Sydney.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.trutv.com/library/crime/serial_killers/weird/macdonald/monster_2.html |title=William "The Mutilator" Macdonald: The Making of a Monster |last=Kidd |first=Paul B. |accessdate=28 October 2010 |website=Turner Entertainment Networks |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110811041741/http://www.trutv.com/library/crime/serial_killers/weird/macdonald/monster_2.html |archive-date=2011-08-11}}</ref> *[[John and Sarah Makin]]: late 19th century [[baby farming|baby farmers]] who killed and buried twelve children at a succession of their homes.<ref>{{cite dictionary |url=http://adbonline.anu.edu.au/biogs/AS10317b.htm |title=Makin, John (1845–1893) |first=Heather |last=Radi |date=2005 |dictionary=[[Australian Dictionary of Biography]] |publisher=National Centre of Biography, Australian National University |accessdate=20 December 2010}}</ref> *[[Malachi Martin (murderer)|Malachi Martin]]: convicted of killing [[Jane Macmanamin]] and suspected of murdering four additional people as well as being implicated in the suspicious death of his mother; hanged at the [[Adelaide Gaol]] in 1862.<ref>Martin's marriage certificate shows this spelling, while on that certificate he signed his name "Malacky" (1858 marriage certificate indexed by Births, Deaths and Marriages South Australia at Book 317, Page 541). On his petition to the Governor in December 1862 Martin signed his name "Malaky Martin" (Malachy Martin's petition to the Governor & Executive Council of South Australia, GRG 24/6/1862/1215). In oral tradition the name is pronounced in a way that indicates it should be spelt "Malachy" rather than the Biblical "Malachi". John Bowyer Bull, who had met Malachy, mentions him in his memoirs, and although he spells the name several ways, they are all closer to "Malachy" than to "Malachi" (J.B. Bull, unpublished manuscript ''The Life of John Bowyer Bull, The Australian Bushman & Explorer, 1838 –1894'', PGR 507/3, pp 62-65).</ref> *[[Backpacker Murders|Ivan Milat]]: killed at least seven tourists in [[Belanglo State Forest]], [[New South Wales]] between 1989 and 1993, which became known as the "Backpacker Murders"; suspected in similar disappearances in [[City of Newcastle|Newcastle]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.dailytelegraph.com.au/news/nsw/twenty-five-years-ago-the-first-victims-of-backpacker-killer-ivan-milat-were-found-in-belanglo-forest-twenty-five-years-ago-the-first-victims-of-backpacker-killer-ivan-milat-were-found-in-belanglo-forest/news-story/f4a31abad223faa68d8d73ca054d297e |title=Twenty five years ago the first victims of Backpacker Killer Ivan Milat were found in Belanglo Forest |last1=Lennon |first1=Troy |date=19 September 2017 |newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph (Sydney)|The Daily Telegraph]] |location=Sydney |accessdate=26 January 2018 |url-access=subscription}}</ref> *[[Dan Morgan (bushranger)|Dan Morgan]]: also known as "Mad Dog"; violent bushranger who killed three people from 1864 to 1865; killed during a standoff with the Victoria police.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article80953125 |title=Bloodthirsty Morgan |newspaper=[[The Singleton Argus]] |location=Singleton, New South Wales |date=14 June 1924 |accessdate=16 April 2012 |page=3 |via=National Library of Australia}}</ref> *[[Martha Needle]]: also known as the "Black Widow of [[Richmond, Victoria|Richmond]]," [[Poison#Uses of poison|poisoner]] of four family members and her boyfriend's brother; executed in 1894.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://newdiogenesmelbourne.wordpress.com/2016/04/17/martha-needles-headstone |title=Martha Needle headstone found |last=Hartley |first=M. George |date=2018-03-14 |website=New Diogenes Melbourne |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Alexander Pearce]]: Irish convict who escaped with seven other convicts from imprisonment; five of them were killed and cannibalised, leaving Pearce the only one left; hanged 1824.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.australianhistory.org/other-bushrangers.php |title=Other Bushrangers: Alexander Pierce |date=2006 |website=Australian History.org |access-date=2010-01-27 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101209021729/http://australianhistory.org/other-bushrangers.php |archive-date=9 December 2010}}</ref> *[[Derek Percy]]: murdered a child in 1969, but also linked to the deaths of eight other children in the 60s; died in prison from [[lung cancer]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2013-07-24/derek-percy-linked-to-deaths-of-9-children/4840556 |title=Child killer Derek Percy was linked to deaths of nine children |date=30 October 2014 |website=ABC News |accessdate=19 October 2016}}</ref> *[[Martha Rendell]]: killed three stepchildren with [[hydrochloric acid]] in 1907-08; last woman to be hanged in Western Australia.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://policewahistory.org.au/HTML_Pages/Child_Murders.html |title=Martha Rendell Child Murders - 1909 |last=Skehan |first=Peter |website=Western Australia Police Historical Society |accessdate=13 December 2012}}</ref> *[[Lindsey Robert Rose]]: New South Wales serial and [[contract killer]] who murdered five people between 1984 and 1994.<ref>{{cite AustLII|NSWCCA|327|1999|litigants=R v Rose|date=11 October 1999 |courtname=auto}}</ref> *[[Murchison Murders|'Snowy' Rowles]]: also known as the "[[Murchison (Western Australia)|Murchison]] Murders"; stockman who murdered three people using a method from a then unpublished book of author [[Arthur Upfield]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://thewest.com.au/news/wa/heritage-nod-for-site-of-grisly-outback-murders-ng-b88765025z |title=Heritage nod for site of grisly outback murders |last=Acott |first=Kent |date=6 March 2018 |newspaper=[[The West Australian]] |location=Perth |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Albert Schmidt (serial killer)|Albert Schmidt]]: also known as "The Wagga Murderer"; German immigrant who murdered at least three travelling companions from 1888 to 1890; executed for one murder in 1890.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article101894490 |title=The Late Wagga Murder |newspaper=[[The Wagga Wagga Advertiser]] |volume=XX |issue=2165 |location=Wagga Wagga, New South Wales |date=15 May 1890 |access-date=24 November 2019 |page=2 |via=National Library of Australia}}</ref> *[[Arnold Sodeman]]: also known as the "School-girl Strangler"; killed four children in Melbourne in the 1930s.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://nla.gov.au/nla.news-article1408956 |title=Sent To Reformatory |newspaper=[[The Argus (Melbourne)|The Argus]] |issue=22,491 |location=Melbourne |date=30 August 1918 |accessdate=2013-10-07 |page=3 |via=National Library of Australia}}</ref> *[[John "Rocky" Whelan]]: [[Tasmania]]n [[penal colony]] escapee responsible for the murders of five people; executed in 1855.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.convictrecords.com.au/convicts/whelan/john/111127 |title=John Whelan |website=Convict Records |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Truro murders|Christopher Worrell and James Miller]]: also known as the "[[Truro, South Australia|Truro]] Murderers"; were convicted of killing seven people in 1976–1977.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.trutv.com/library/crime/serial_killers/predators/worrell/discover_2.html |title=The Truro Serial Murders: The Horrifying Discoveries |last=Kidd |first=Paul B. |date=2012 |website=[[TruTV]] |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120927182522/http://www.trutv.com/library/crime/serial_killers/predators/worrell/discover_2.html |archive-date=2012-09-27}}</ref>
===Austria=== *[[Elfriede Blauensteiner]]: also known as the "Black Widow"; poisoner of three individuals; died in prison in 2003.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/austria/1316893/The-Black-Widow-is-guilty-of-two-more-murders.html |title=The Black Widow is guilty of two more murders |first=Michael |last=Leidig |date=2001-04-20 |newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |location=London, UK |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Max Gufler]]: poisoned and drowned women; convicted of four murders and two attempted murders, but believed to have committed 18; died 1996. *[[Dariusz Kotwica]]: also known as the "Euro Ripper"; Polish vagrant who murdered at least three pensioners in Austria and [[Sweden]] in 2015; suspected of more murders in the [[Netherlands]], [[Czech Republic]] and the [[United Kingdom]]; sentenced to involuntary commitment.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.express.co.uk/news/world/623011/Euro-Ripper-Dariusz-Pawel-Kotwica-Britain-UK-detectives-DNA-pensioner-rapes-deaths |title=Did Euro Ripper strike in Britain? UK detectives trawl DNA over pensioner rapes and deaths |first=Anil |last=Dawar |date=30 November 2015 |newspaper=[[Daily Express]] |location=London, UK |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Martha Marek]]: poisoned three family members and a lodger in her house with [[thallium]] between 1932 and 1937; executed 1938.<ref>{{cite journal |url=http://www.bmi.gv.at/cms/BMI_OeffentlicheSicherheit/2007/05_06/files/Giftmorde.pdf |title=Ein fast perfekter Mord |trans-title=An almost perfect murder |last=Sabitzer |first=Werner |edition=May–June |date=2007 |pages=47–54 |journal=Öffentliche Sicherheit |publisher==[[Directorate General for the Public Security]] |language=de |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131211084043/http://www.bmi.gv.at/cms/BMI_OeffentlicheSicherheit/2007/05_06/files/Giftmorde.pdf |archive-date=December 11, 2013}}</ref> *[[Wolfgang Ott]]: sex offender and suspected serial killer who kidnapped several women in 1995, killing two of them; sentenced to life imprisonment in 1996.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://noe.orf.at/news/stories/2839558/ |title=Doppelmörder nach Überdosis im Spital |trans-title=Double murderer in hospital after overdose |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=2017-04-27 |website=[[ORF (broadcaster)|ORF]] |language=de |access-date=2018-01-29}}</ref> *[[Harald Sassak]]: [[gasworks]] employee who between 1971 and 1972 killed six people for the purpose of robbery; died from an undisclosed illness in 2013.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.noen.at/lokales/noe-uebersicht/gmuend/aktuell/Gaskassier-Sassak-starb-in-Weitra;art2511,480360 |title="Gaskassier" Sassak starb in Weitra |trans-title="Gasman" Sassak dies in Weitra |last=Lohninger |first=Markus |date=28 August 2013 |website=NÖN.at |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Hugo Schenk]]: also known as the "Viennese Housemaids Killer"; swindler who killed four maids in 1883 with his accomplice Karl Schlossarek; suspected of more murders; executed 1884.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://serialkillercalendar.com/Hugo%20SCHENK.php |title=Hugo Schenk aka "The Viennese Housemaids Killer" |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |website=Serial Killer Calendar.com |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Jack Unterweger]]: author and [[Sadomasochism|sexual sadist]]; convicted of ten murders; believed to have killed twelve women; committed suicide in prison in 1994.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://articles.latimes.com/1994-06-30/local/me-10223_1_los-angeles |title=Austrian Slayer of L.A. Prostitutes Kills Self |last=Malnic |first=Eric |date=June 30, 1994 |newspaper=[[Los Angeles Times]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Lainz Angels of Death|Maria Gruber, Irene Leidolf, Stephanija Mayer and Waltraud Wagner]]: also known as the "Lainz Angels of Death"; nurses at the Lainz General Hospital in [[Vienna]] who admitted to murdering 49 patients between 1983 and 1989.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1989/04/18/world/killing-of-49-patients-by-4-nurse-s-aides-stuns-the-austrians.html |title=Killing of 49 Patients By 4 Nurse's Aides Stuns the Austrians |last=Protzman |first=Ferdinand |date=April 18, 1989 |newspaper=[[The New York Times]] |accessdate=June 24, 2013}}</ref> *[[Guido Zingerle]]: also known as the "Monster of Tyrol"; Italian who brutally raped women in Italy and Austria between 1946 and 1950, killing at least two by burying them under a pile of stones; died in prison from [[liver cancer]] in 1962.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.stol.it/Artikel/Kultur-im-Ueberblick/Literatur/Brav-sein-sonst-holt-dich-der-Zingerle-Die-Geschichte-des-Ungeheuers-von-Tirol |title="Brav sein, sonst holt dich der Zingerle" - Die Geschichte des "Ungeheuers von Tirol" |trans-title=Be good, otherwise Zingerle will get you - The story of the "Monster of Tyrol" |date=October 27, 2009 |website=Stol.it |language=de |accessdate=August 14, 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140718201116/http://www.stol.it/Artikel/Kultur-im-Ueberblick/Literatur/Brav-sein-sonst-holt-dich-der-Zingerle-Die-Geschichte-des-Ungeheuers-von-Tirol |archive-date=July 18, 2014}}</ref>
===The Bahamas=== *[[Cordell Farrington]]: killed four children and his homosexual lover from 2002 to 2003; sentenced to death and later commuted to life imprisonment.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2003/nov/10/richardluscombe |title=Serial murder police find remains |first=Richard |last=Luscombe |date=10 November 2003 |newspaper=[[The Guardian]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Michaiah Shobek]]: also known as "The Angels of Lucifer Killer"; American emigrant who murdered three fellow US tourists from 1973 to 1974; executed 1976.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1976/10/19/archives/bahamas-to-execute-an-american-today-for-murder-of-3-tourists.html |title=Bahamas to Execute an American Today for Murder of 3 Tourists |date=19 October 1976 |agency=Associated Press |newspaper=The New York Times |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===Bangladesh=== *[[Roshu Kha]]: enraged over rejection by his lover, Roshu killed at least eleven garment workers in [[Chandpur District]]. He pretended to love them, later killing them brutally.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://guardian.ng/news/confessed-serial-killer-sentenced-to-hang-in-bangladesh/ |title=Confessed serial killer sentenced to hang in Bangladesh |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=23 April 2015 |newspaper=[[The Guardian (Nigeria)|The Guardian]] |location=Lagos, Nigeria |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Ershad Sikder]]: career criminal and corrupt politician responsible for the torture-murders of numerous people in the 1990s; convicted on seven counts of murder and executed in 2004.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.news24.com/World/News/Bangladesh-killer-hanged-20040511 |title=Bangladesh killer hanged |date=2004-05-11 |website=[[News24]] |access-date=10 December 2015}}</ref>
===Belarus=== *[[Ivan Kulesh]]: drunkard who killed three saleswomen between 2013 and 2014 in the [[Grodno Region]]; executed 2016.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://naviny.by/article/20161128/1480339538-ispolnen-ocherednoy-smertnyy-prigovor-rasstrelyan-ubiyca-lidskih |title=Исполнен очередной смертный приговор. Расстрелян убийца лидских продавщиц |trans-title=Another death sentence has been executed. The killer of Lida saleswomen was shot |first=Alexey |last=Alexandrov |date=November 28, 2016 |website=[[naviny.by]] |language=ru |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Eduard Lykov]]: Russian immigrant who killed five people in drunken quarrels from 2002 to 2011; executed 2014.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://news.tut.by/society/395123.html |title=Лыков назвал себя "нехристем" и попросил лишения свободы. Суд оставил смертный приговор в силе (обновлено) |trans-title=Lykov called himself a "non-christian" and asked for imprisonment. The court upheld the death sentence (updated) |first=Katherine |last=Sinyuk |date=April 15, 2014 |website=[[Tut.By]] |language=ru |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Gennady Mikhasevich]]: [[Voluntary People's Druzhina|police volunteer]] who investigated his own mission-oriented murders of 36 women between 1971 and 1985; executed in 1987.<ref name="Newton_177">{{cite book |last=Newton |first=Michael |title=The Encyclopedia of Serial Killers |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=DwNVbOcTncwC&pg=PA177 |date=February 2006 |publisher=Infobase Publishing |isbn=978-0-8160-6987-3 |page=177}}</ref> *[[Igor Mirenkov]]: known as "the [[Svietlahorsk]] Nightmare"; child killer who murdered six boys from 1990 to 1993; executed in 1996.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.detektiv.by/svetlogorsk?page=9%2C2 |title=Светлогорский кошмар |trans-title=Svetlogorsk nightmare |date=December 14, 2007 |website=Detectiv.by |language=ru |accessdate=2010-09-28 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://www.webcitation.org/68ZZxfQVK?url=http://www.detektiv.by/svetlogorsk?page=9,2 |archivedate=20 June 2012 }}</ref> *[[The Polotsk Four|Sergey Pugachev and Alexander Burdenko]]: leaders of the "[[Polotsk]] Four"; criminals responsible for killing two girls and two car enthusiasts from 2001 to 2002, as well as numerous robberies with two other accomplices; Pugachev was executed in 2005 and Burdenko was sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.sb.by/articles/bandity-poluchili-svoe.html |title=Бандиты получили свое |trans-title=Bandits got theirs |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=July 12, 2005 |newspaper=[[Sovetskaya Belorussiya – Belarus' Segodnya]] |language=ru |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Alexander Sergeychik]]: killed six people from 2000 to 2006 in the [[Shchuchyn District|Shchuchyn]] and [[Grodno District]]s; confessed to twelve murders; executed 2007.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.sb.by/articles/rasplata-vysshey-meroy.html |title=Расплата высшей мерой |trans-title=Reckoning with capital punishment |last=Charovskaya |first=Katerina |date=23 May 2007 |newspaper=Sovetskaya Belorussiya – Belarus' Segodnya |language=ru |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===Belgium=== *[[Marie Alexandrine Becker]]: poisoned at least eleven people with [[Digitalis]]; sentenced to life imprisonment; died 1938. *[[Jan Caubergh]]: strangled his pregnant neighbour, his girlfriend and their child in 1979; sentenced to death but it was converted to life imprisonment; was the longest-serving prisoner in the country until his death in 2013.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.gva.be/regio-antwerpen-noord/schoten/moordenaar-heeft-34-jaar-aan-mijn-hart-gevreten.aspx |title=Moordenaar heeft 34 jaar aan mijn hart gevreten |trans-title=Murder has eaten at my heart for 34 years |first=Kristin |last=Matthyssen |date=5 December 2013 |newspaper=[[Gazet van Antwerpen]] |language=nl |access-date=5 December 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.nieuwsblad.be/article/detail.aspx?articleid=GMU2QVK4K |title=77-jarige meervoudige moordenaar staat weer terecht |trans-title=77-year-old multiple murderer is on trial again |first=Steven |last=De Bock |date=2 June 2010 |newspaper=[[Het Nieuwsblad]] |language=nl |access-date=2 June 2010}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.standaard.be/cnt/dmf20131202_00868438 |title=Oudste gevangene van ons land overleden |trans-title=Oldest prisoner in our country dies |date=3 December 2013 |newspaper=[[De Standaard]] |language=nl |access-date=3 December 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.nieuwsblad.be/article/detail.aspx?articleid=dmf20131202_00868413 |title=Oudste Belgische moordenaar sterft in de cel |trans-title=The oldest Belgian serial killer dies in a cell |first=Pieter |last=Huyberechts |date=3 December 2013 |newspaper=Het Nieuwsblad |language=nl |access-date=3 December 2013}}</ref> *[[Étienne Dedroog]]: known as the "Lodgers' Killer"; killed a [[Bed and breakfast|B&B]] owner in France and a couple in Belgium from October to November 2011; also suspected of a murder in Spain; sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.nieuwsblad.be/cnt/dmf20170505_02867412 |title=B&B-moordenaar veroordeeld tot 25 jaar cel in Frankrijk |trans-title=B&B Murderer sentenced to 25 years imprisonment in France |date=5 May 2017 |newspaper=[[Het Nieuwsblad]] |language=nl |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Marc Dutroux]]: convicted of having kidnapped, tortured and sexually abused six girls ranging in age from 8 to 19, during 1995 and 1996. Four of his victims were murdered; the final two were rescued.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2002/jan/25/worlddispatch.dutroux |title=Belgium still haunted by paedophile scandal |first=Andrew |last=Osborn |date=25 January 2002 |newspaper=[[The Guardian]] |accessdate=12 July 2015}}</ref> *[[Staf Van Eyken]]: also known as the "Vampire of Muizen"; raped and strangled three women from 1971 to 1972 in [[Muizen]] and [[Bonheiden]]; sentenced to death, commuted to life imprisonment.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.standaard.be/cnt/dmf20160216_02130945 |title=Vampier van Muizen wil zieke priester bezoeken |trans-title=Vampire van Muizen wants to visit a sick priest |first=Sarah |last=Vankersschaever |date=16 February 2016 |newspaper=[[De Standaard]] |language=nl |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Renaud Hardy]]: also known as the "Parkinson's Murderer"; murdered between two and three women in the [[Flemish Community]] from 2009 to 2015; sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.hln.be/nieuws/binnenland/-topdokter-van-der-linden-quot-hardy-wordt-pas-seriemoordenaar-op-moment-dat-hij-parkinsonmedicatie-neemt-quot~ac84fd03/ |title='Topdokter' Van der Linden: "Hardy wordt pas seriemoordenaar op moment dat hij parkinsonmedicatie neemt" |trans-title='Top doctor' Van der Linden: "Hardy only becomes a serial killer when he takes Parkinson's medication" |first=Veronique |last=Coopmans |date=27 February 2018 |newspaper=[[Het Laatste Nieuws]] |language=nl |access-date=2018-03-08}}</ref> *[[Ronald Janssen]]: killed a woman in 2007 and later his neighbour and her boyfriend in 2010 in [[Flemish Brabant]]; admitted to five rapes committed in 1993, but is suspected of 20; sentenced to life imprisonment in 2011.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.dhnet.be/actu/faits/ronald-janssen-les-aveux-du-tueur-en-serie-51b778f6e4b0de6db97d5cb4 |title=Ronald Janssen: les aveux du tueur en série |trans-title=Ronald Janssen: the confessions of a serial killer |first=Gilbert |last=Dupont |date=17 September 2011 |newspaper=[[La Dernière Heure]] |language=fr |access-date=20 March 2018}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.7sur7.be/7s7/fr/1724/Meurtre-d-Annick/article/detail/1323107/2011/09/23/Ronald-Janssen-portrait-d-un-tueur-de-la-nuit.dhtml |title=Ronald Janssen, portrait d'un tueur de la nuit |trans-title=Ronald Janssen, portrait of a killer in the night |first=Michaël |last=Bouche |date=23 October 2011 |website=7SUR7.be |language=fr |access-date=20 March 2018}}</ref> *[[Marie-Thérèse Joniaux]]: poisoned three of her family members between 1894 and 1895; sentenced to death in 1895, but was commuted to life imprisonment; died in [[Antwerp]] in 1923.<ref>{{cite book |url=http://catalogue.bnf.fr/ark:/12148/cb31272691k |last=de Ryckère |first=Raymond |date=1895 |title=L'affaire Joniaux, triple empoisonnement... |location=[[Lyon]] |publisher=A. Storck |via=[[Bibliothèque nationale de France|BnF]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[András Pándy]]: also known as "Vader Blauwbaard" (Father Bluebeard); Hungarian immigrant convicted of the murder and rape of his two wives and four children in [[Brussels]] between 1986 and 1990 with the aid of his daughter, Ágnes Pándy; died in prison in 2013.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://asp.gva.be/dossiers/-p/pandy/dossier.asp |title=De zaak Pandy: Chronologie van een familiedrama en een onderzoek |trans-title=The Pandy case: Chronology of a family drama and an investigation |website=De zaak Pandy |language=nl |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131228203527/http://asp.gva.be/dossiers/-p/pandy/dossier.asp |archive-date=28 December 2013}}</ref> *[[Nestor Pirotte]]: also known as the "Crazy Killer"; considered one of the worst Belgian criminals, responsible for the murders of up to seven people from 1954 to 1981, including his great-aunt; died from a heart attack in 2000.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.franceinfo.fr/faits-divers/histoires-criminelles/nestor-pirotte-le-faux-aristocrate-belge-qui-a-echappe-a-la-peine-capitale-691335-201 |title=Nestor Pirotte, le faux aristocrate belge qui a échappé à la peine capitale...deux fois! |trans-title=Nestor Pirotte, the false Belgian aristocrat who escaped the death penalty...twice! |last=Expert |first=Jacques |date=July 30, 2012 |website=[[France Info (radio network)|France Info]] |language=fr |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120731012437/http://www.franceinfo.fr/faits-divers/histoires-criminelles/nestor-pirotte-le-faux-aristocrate-belge-qui-a-echappe-a-la-peine-capitale-691335-201 |archive-date=July 31, 2012}}</ref>
===Bolivia=== *[[Ramiro Artieda]]: killed his brother in the early 1920s for monetary purposes; emigrated to the United States but later returned and killed seven women until 1938; was arrested in 1939, confessed and was executed by firing squad.<ref>{{cite book |first1=Amanda |last1=Howard |first2=Martin |last2=Smith |date=2004 |title=River of Blood: Serial Killers and Their Victims |publisher=Universal Publishers |page=27 |isbn=978-1-58112-518-4}}</ref>
===Brazil=== *[[José Augusto do Amaral]]: also known as "Preto Amaral"; first documented Brazilian serial killer; suspected of murdering and then raping the corpses of three young men in [[São Paulo]] in 1926; died from [[tuberculosis]] while imprisoned before he could be put on trial.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.diarioinsano.com.br/2009/12/preto-amaral-o-1-serial-killer.html |title=Preto Amaral - O 1º serial killer brasileiro |trans-title=Preto Amaral - The 1st Brazilian serial killer |first=Karina |last=Ninni |date=1 December 2009 |website=Diário Insano |language=pt |accessdate=22 February 2010 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160222055627/http://www.diarioinsano.com.br/2009/12/preto-amaral-o-1-serial-killer.html |archive-date=2016-02-22}}</ref> *[[Marcelo Costa de Andrade]]: also known as "The Vampire of [[Niterói]]"; raped and killed fourteen children. *[[Marcelo de Jesus Silva]]: also known as "Chucky"; [[Dwarfism|dwarf]] man convicted of twenty counts of murder, robbery, drug trafficking and death squad. *[[José Paz Bezerra]]: also known as "The Morumbi Monster"; sexually violated, tortured and murdered more than twenty women in São Paulo and [[Pará]] during the 1960s and 1970s; sentenced to 30 years imprisonment and released in 2001.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://oaprendizverde.com.br/2018/03/19/reportagem-retro-jose-paz-bezerra-o-monstro-estrangulador/ |title=Reportagem Retrô: José Paz Bezerra, o monstro estrangulador |trans-title=Retro Report: José Paz Bezerra, the strangling monster |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=19 March 2018 |website=O Aprendiz Verde |language=pt |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Febrônio Índio do Brasil]]: delusional religious maniac and habitual criminal who murdered at least six people from 1925 to 1927, mostly young boys and teens; acquitted by reason of insanity and sent to a mental institution, in which he died in 1989 from [[chronic obstructive pulmonary disease]].<ref>{{Cite journal |url=https://jus.com.br/artigos/1013/os-casos-de-pierre-riviere-e-febronio-indio-do-brasil-como-exemplos-de-uma-violencia-institucionalizada |title=Os casos de Piérre Rivière e Febrônio Índio do Brasil como exemplos de uma violência institucionalizada |trans-title=The cases of Piérre Rivière and Febrônio Índio do Brasil as examples of institutionalized violence |last=Wunderlich |first=Alexandre |date=1 July 2000 |volume=5 |number=43 |journal=Jus Navigandi |location=[[Teresina]] |language=pt |issn=1518-4862 |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Abraão José Bueno]]: [[Rio de Janeiro]] nurse who killed four child patients; sentenced to 110 years imprisonment in 2005.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://ultimosegundo.ig.com.br/brasil/2008/05/16/ex_enfermeiro_que_matou_criancas_em_hospital_do_rio_e_condenado_a_110_anos_1315150.html |title=Ex-enfermeiro que matou crianças em hospital do Rio é condenado a 110 anos |trans-title=Former nurse who killed children in Rio hospital is sentenced to 110 years |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=16 May 2008 |website=Último Segundo |language=pt |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080619095227/http://ultimosegundo.ig.com.br/brasil/2008/05/16/ex_enfermeiro_que_matou_criancas_em_hospital_do_rio_e_condenado_a_110_anos_1315150.html |archive-date=June 19, 2008}}</ref> *[[Francisco das Chagas Rodrigues de Brito]]: pedophile who sexually abused, murdered and mutilated between 30 and 42 young boys from 1989 to 2003 in Maranhão and Pará; sentenced to 217 years imprisonment.<ref>{{cite magazine |url=http://veja.abril.com.br/100107/p_086.html |title=Ele matava, abusava, mutilava |trans-title=He killed, abused, mutilated |last=Teixeira |first=Jerônimo |date=January 10, 2007 |magazine=[[Veja (magazine)|Veja]] |language=pt |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140331173827/http://veja.abril.com.br/100107/p_086.html |archive-date=March 31, 2014}}</ref> *[[Pedro Rosa da Conceição]]: Brazilian mass murderer who killed three people and wounded thirteen others on April 22, 1904. Killed his cellmate and a guard in 1911, and is said to have murdered a family of twelve people in an unspecified date and year. Died in 1919. *[[Pedro Rodrigues Filho]]: also known as "Pedrinho Matador"; convicted and sentenced to 128 years imprisonment for 70 murders; however, the maximum one can serve in Brazil is 30 years; claimed to have killed more than 100 victims, including 40 prison inmates.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://noticias.r7.com/videos/exclusivo-marcelo-rezende-entrevista-criminoso-que-matou-mais-de-cem-pessoas/idmedia/4fd5696f92bbcc410d415dd0.html |title=Exclusivo: Marcelo Rezende entrevista criminoso que matou mais de cem pessoas |trans-title=Exclusive: Marcelo Rezende interview with criminal that killed more than one hundred people |first=Marcelo |last=Rezende |authorlink=Marcelo Rezende |date=11 June 2012 |website=R7 News |language=pt |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120615190337/http://noticias.r7.com/videos/exclusivo-marcelo-rezende-entrevista-criminoso-que-matou-mais-de-cem-pessoas/idmedia/4fd5696f92bbcc410d415dd0.html |archive-date=15 June 2012}}</ref> *[[Roneys Fon Firmino Gomes]]: known as the "Tower Maniac"; murdered at least six prostitutes in the city of [[Maringá]] between 2005 and 2015, disposing of their bodies under electric towers; sentenced to 21 years imprisonment.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://g1.globo.com/pr/norte-noroeste/noticia/2019/03/15/maniaco-da-torre-e-condenado-a-21-anos-e-4-meses-de-prisao.ghtml |title='Maníaco da Torre' é condenado a 21 anos e 4 meses de prisão |trans-title='Tower Maniac' is sentenced to 21 years and 4 months in prison |first=William |last=Souza |date=15 March 2019 |website=[[G1 (website)|G1]] |language=pt |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Francisco de Assis Pereira]]: rapist and serial killer, known as "O Maníaco do Parque" (The Park Maniac); arrested for the torture, rape and death of eleven women and for assaulting nine in a park in [[São Paulo]] during the 1990s.<ref>{{cite magazine |url=http://veja.abril.com.br/120898/p_106.html |title=Fui eu |trans-title=Was me |first=Laura |last=Capriglione |date=12 August 1998 |magazine=[[Veja (magazine)|Veja]] |accessdate=February 9, 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071021024742/http://veja.abril.com.br/120898/p_106.html |archive-date=October 21, 2007}}</ref> *[[Tiago Henrique Gomes da Rocha]]: security guard who has claimed to have killed 39 people in the state of [[Goiás]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/world-latin-america-29654569 |title=Brazil man 'confesses to 39 murders' |date=16 October 2014 |website=BBC News |accessdate=17 October 2014}}</ref> *[[Edson Izidoro Guimarães]]: nurse who killed four patients in the Rio de Janeiro neighborhood of [[Méier]]; suspected of 131 deaths in total.<ref>{{cite journal |title=Serial Murder by Healthcare Professionals |first1=Beatrice Crofts |last1=Yorker |first2=Kenneth W. |last2=Kizer |first3=Paula |last3=Lampe |first4=A.R.W. |last4=Forrest |first5=Jacquetta M. |last5=Lannan |first6=Donna A. |last6=Russell |lastauthoramp=yes |date=November 2006 |journal=Journal of Forensic Sciences |volume=51 |number=6 |pages=1362–1371 |publisher=Wiley-Blackwell |doi=10.1111/j.1556-4029.2006.00273.x}}</ref> *[[José Vicente Matias]]: also known as "Corumbá"; former [[artisan]] who raped, murdered and dismembered six women between 1999 and 2005, cannibalizing one of them; sentenced to 23 years imprisonment.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.jornalpequeno.com.br/2008/6/4/Pagina79933.htm |title='Corumbá' condenado a 23 anos por matar estudante |trans-title='Corumbá' sentenced to 23 years for killing student |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=4 June 2008 |newspaper=[[Jornal Pequeno]] |language=pt |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080609012441/http://www.jornalpequeno.com.br/2008/6/4/Pagina79933.htm |archive-date=June 9, 2008}}</ref> *[[Florisvaldo de Oliveira]]: also known as "Cabo Bruno"; former police officer accused of more than 50 murders on the outskirts of São Paulo in 1982; murdered by unknown assailants in 2012.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://f5.folha.uol.com.br/saiunonp/2015/03/1607636-cabo-bruno-mata-50-e-morre-com-20-tiros.shtml |title=Cabo Bruno mata 50 e morre com 20 tiros |trans-title=Cabo Bruno kills 50 and dies with 20 shots |first=Luiz Carlos |last=Ferreira |date=25 March 2015 |newspaper=[[Folha de S.Paulo]] |language=pt |accessdate=29 December 2017}}</ref> *[[Sebastião Antônio de Oliveira]]: also known as "The Monster of [[Bragança Paulista|Bragança]]"; mentally-ill man who murdered five children and raped at least eight between 1953 and 1975; committed suicide before trial in 1976.<ref>{{Cite magazine |url=http://memoria.bn.br/docreader/DocReader.aspx?bib=003581&pagfis=195392 |title=O monstro de Bragança |first=Edison |last=Torres |date=February 5, 1975 |magazine=[[O Cruzeiro]] |volume=XLVII |issue=6 |pages=28–33 |via=[[Biblioteca Nacional do Brasil]] |language=pt |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Diogo Figueira da Rocha]]: also known as "Dioguinho"; career criminal responsible for at least 50 murders between 1894 and 1897 around São Paulo; supposedly killed in a shootout with the police in 1897.<ref>{{Cite journal |url=https://www.tjrs.jus.br/export/poder_judiciario/historia/memorial_do_poder_judiciario/memorial_judiciario_gaucho/revista_justica_e_historia/issn_1676-5834/v3n6/doc/05-Marilia_Schneider.pdf |title=Além Da Justiça: O Homicida Dioguinho e Seus Cúmplices |trans-title=Beyond Justice: The Murderer Dioguinho and His Accomplices |first=Marília |last=Schneider |date=2003 |journal=Revista de Jurisprudência |publisher=Tribunal de Justiça do Estado do Rio Grande do Sul |volume=3 |number=6 |issn=1676-5834 |language=pt |via=Biblioteca Digital Jurídica do [[Superior Tribunal de Justiça]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Orlando Sabino]]: also known as the "Monster of [[Capinópolis]]"; suspected of murdering twelve people in several municipalities around [[Minas Gerais]] and Goiás; died from a heart attack in 2013.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.portaldearaguari.com.br/2011/05/historia-do-monstro-de-capinopolis.html |title=A história do Monstro de Capinópolis ganha livro |trans-title=The story of the Monster of Capinópolis earns a book |date=25 May 2011 |website=Portal de Araguari |language=pt |access-date=July 24, 2016 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170414082946/http://www.portaldearaguari.com.br/2011/05/historia-do-monstro-de-capinopolis.html |archive-date=2017-04-14}}</ref> *[[Anísio Ferreira de Sousa]]: gynaecologist from [[Altamira, Pará|Altamira]] who was convicted of the murder of three children but linked to the disappearance of a total of 19.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.hcnet.usp.br/ipq/nufor/pdf/meninos.pdf |title=Meninos Emasculados de Altamira: Resumo do Caso |trans-title=Emaculated Boys of Altamira: Case Summary |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |website=[[Hospital das Clínicas da Universidade de São Paulo]] |language=pt |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070611153409/http://www.hcnet.usp.br/ipq/nufor/pdf/meninos.pdf |archive-date=11 June 2007}}</ref> *[[Jorge Luiz Thais Martins]]: former [[Military Firefighters Corps]] colonel who killed nine drug addicts from August 2010 and January 2011 to avenge the death of his son.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www1.folha.uol.com.br/cotidiano/866813-ex-comandante-dos-bombeiros-do-pr-e-suspeito-de-matar-9.shtml |title=Ex-comandante dos bombeiros do PR é suspeito de matar 9 |trans-title=Former PR fire chief is suspected of killing 9 |first=Jean-Philip |last=Struck |date=27 January 2011 |newspaper=[[Folha de S.Paulo]] |language=pt |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Marcos Antunes Trigueiro]]: known as "The Industrial Maniac"; former taxi driver who killed five women from 2009 to 2010 in [[Contagem]] and [[Belo Horizonte]].
===Burundi=== *[[Ivomoku Bakusuba]]: confessed to having killed over 67 children. Committed suicide, "probably in the late 1940s, or in the early 1950s".
===Bulgaria=== *[[Hristo Georgiev (serial killer)|Hristo Georgiev]]: also known as "The Sadist"; former militiaman who murdered four women and one man in [[Sofia]] from 1974 to 1980; executed 1980.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://socbg.com/2015/09/%D0%BC%D0%B8%D0%BB%D0%B8%D1%86%D0%B8%D0%BE%D0%BD%D0%B5%D1%80-%D1%81%D0%B5%D1%80%D0%B8%D0%B5%D0%BD-%D1%83%D0%B1%D0%B8%D0%B5%D1%86-%D1%85%D0%B2%D1%8A%D1%80%D0%BB%D1%8F-%D0%B2-%D1%83%D0%B6%D0%B0%D1%81-2.html |title=Милиционер-сериен убиец хвърля в ужас София през 70-те – II част |trans-title=A serial killer plagues Sofia in the 1970s - Part II |first=Stoyan |last=Gŭlŭbov |date=September 2015 |website=Спомени от Народната република [Memories of the Peoples Republic] |language=bg |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Sokrat Kirshveng]]: also known as "The Killer with the [[Adze]]"; murdered two of his lovers in 1919, for which he was sentenced to death; commuted to 17 years imprisonment, and upon release in 1937, murdered his aunt and uncle-in-law; executed 1937.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://fakti.bg/life/300951-zloveshtata-istoria-na-parvia-serien-ubiec-v-balgaria-jestokia-sokrat-kirshveng |title=Злoвeщaтa иcтoрия нa първия ceриeн убиeц в Бългaрия - жecтoкия Coкрaт Киршвeнг |trans-title=The creepy story of Bulgaria's first serial killer - the cruel Sokrat Kirshveng |first=Milena |last=Tracheva |date=4 May 2018 |website=Fakti.bg |language=bg |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Lenko Latkov]]: murdered three elderly women in [[Haskovo Province]] from 1999 to 2000 and raped two children; suspected in another three killings in [[Plovdiv Province]]; murdered by his cellmate in 2003.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://old.segabg.com/article.php?id=103720 |title=Осъден на 8 г. затвор пребил до смърт сериен убиец на жени |trans-title=Man sentenced to 8 years in jail beats to death serial killer of women |first=Hristo |last=Dimitrov |date=16 September 2003 |website=Sega.bg |language=bg |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Mihail Leshtarski]]: also known as "The Killer from the Cave"; habitual thief who lived in the mountains, suspected of murdering at least five elderly pensioners from 2009 to 2011; convicted of one murder and sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://btvnovinite.bg/kriminalno/dve-dozhivotni-prisdi-za-ubietsa-ot-peshcherata.html |title=две доживотни присди за "убиеца от пешчерата" |trans-title=Two life sentences for "The Killer from the Cave" |date=21 March 2013 |website=[[bTV (Bulgaria)|bTV News]] |language=bg |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Ludwig Tolumov and Ivan Serafimov]]: also known as "The Sour and The Sweet"; criminal duo jointly responsible for three murders from May to July 2000; Serafimov, solely responsible for a 1996 murder, was later murdered by Tolumov, who was himself arrested and sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.crimes.bg/%D0%BB%D0%B8%D1%87%D0%BD%D0%BE%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B8/8310-%D1%81%D0%B5%D1%80%D0%B8%D0%B9%D0%BD%D0%B8%D1%82%D0%B5-%D1%83%D0%B1%D0%B8%D0%B9%D1%86%D0%B8-%D0%BD%D0%B0-%D0%B1%D1%8A%D0%BB%D0%B3%D0%B0%D1%80%D0%B8%D1%8F-%D1%83%D0%B1%D0%B8%D0%B9%D1%81%D1%82%D0%B2%D0%B5%D0%BD%D0%BE%D1%82%D0%BE-%D0%B4%D1%83%D0%BE.html |title=Серийните убийци на България. Убийственото дуо |trans-title=Bulgaria's Serial Killers. The Deadly Duo |date=18 January 2015 |website=Crimes.bg |language=bg |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===Canada=== *[[Gerald Thomas Archer]]: known as "the London Chambermaid Slayer"; killed three female hotel employees in his hometown of [[London, Ontario]]; died of a heart attack in 1995.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://london.ctvnews.ca/new-book-claims-london-was-once-serial-killer-capital-of-the-world-1.1726530 |title=New book claims London was once serial killer capital of the world |date=12 March 2014 |website=[[CTV News]] London |accessdate=25 March 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2015/aug/19/serial-killer-london-ontario-canada |title=What turned one city in Canada into the 'serial killer capital' of the world? |last=Lindzon |first=Jared |date=19 August 2015 |newspaper=[[The Guardian]] |accessdate=25 March 2017}}</ref> *[[Paul Bernardo]]: also known as "the [[Scarborough, Toronto|Scarborough]] Rapist"; a [[Toronto]] serial rapist who killed three teenage girls (including his wife's sister) with the aid of his wife [[Karla Homolka]].<ref>{{cite journal |url=http://www.cios.org/EJCPUBLIC/007/4/007415.HTML |title=Journalism Ethics and the Internet: Ethical Implications of Online Defiance of a Canadian Publication Ban |first=Eric B. |last=Easton |journal=The Electronic Journal of Communication / La Revue Electronique de Communication |volume=7 |number=4 |date=1997 |publisher=Communication Institute for Online Scholarship |accessdate=July 23, 2016}}</ref> *[[Wayne Boden]]: also known as "the Vampire Rapist" killed four women between 1968 and 1971; died in prison 2006.<ref>{{cite news |title=Doesn't Look Like a Killer |last=Noel |first=Albert |date=13 April 1972 |newspaper=[[Montreal Gazette]] |page=33}}</ref> *[[John Martin Crawford]]: convicted in 1996 for the murders of three women in [[Saskatoon]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.danielnpaul.com/SerialKiller-JohnMartinCrawford.html |title=Serial Killer - John Martin Crawford |first=Daniel N. |last=Paul |authorlink=Daniel N. Paul |website=danielnpaul.com |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Léopold Dion]]: also known as "Monster of [[Pont-Rouge]]"; raped and killed four young boys in 1960;<ref>{{cite magazine |url=https://archive.macleans.ca/article/1963/9/21/the-tragic-history-of-a-sex-criminal |title=The Tragic History of a Sex Criminal |last=Fulford |first=Robert |date=21 September 1963 |magazine=[[Maclean's]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> murdered in 1972 by a fellow prison inmate.<ref>{{cite journal |url=http://www.erudit.org/revue/crimino/1976/v9/n1-2/017057ar.pdf |title=Littérature carcérale québécoise |trans-title=Québec Prison Literature |last=Brunet-Aubry |first=Lise |date=1976 |journal=Criminologie |language=fr |volume=9 |number=1–2 |pages=191–195 |doi=10.7202/017057ar |access-date=24 November 2019 |via=[[Érudit]]}}</ref> *[[William Patrick Fyfe]]: convicted of killing five women in [[Montreal]] between 1979 and 1999; suspect in several other murders. *[[Russell Maurice Johnson]]: also known as the "Bedroom Strangler"; convicted of raping and murdering three women in the 1970s; total number of victims later found to be higher. *[[Gilbert Paul Jordan]]: also known as the "Boozing Barber", killed between eight and ten women by alcohol poisoning in [[Vancouver]]; died in 2006.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/predator-back-in-jail-1.236346 |title='Predator' back in jail |date=31 August 2000 |website=CBC News |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://justcriminals.info/2017/01/03/gilbert-paul-jordan-1965-1988/ |title=Gilbert Paul Jordan – 1965-1988 |date=3 January 2017 |website=Criminal Encyclopedia |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Joseph LaPage]]: also known as the "French Monster"; murdered four women in Canada and the US from 1867 to 1875; executed 1878.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/sn86072143/1878-03-22/ed-1/seq-1/#date1=1878&sort=date&date2=1878&words=Joseph+JOSEPH+La+LaPage+PAGE&searchType=basic&sequence=0&index=11&state=&rows=20&proxtext=Joseph+LaPage&y=0&x=0&dateFilterType=yearRange&page=1 |title=Justice At Last: Joseph LaPage Expiates His Awful Crimes on the Gallows |newspaper=Burlington Weekly Free Press |location=[[Burlington, Vermont]] |volume=XXIV |number=39 |date=22 March 1878 |via=[[Chronicling America]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Cody Legebokoff]]: one of Canada's youngest serial killers, convicted of murdering three women and a teenage girl around [[Prince George, British Columbia|Prince George]], [[British Columbia]] between 2009 and 2010.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://nationalpost.com/opinion/christie-blatchford-cody-legebokoff-without-remorse-is-convicted-of-four-counts-of-first-degree-murder |title=Cody Legebokoff found guilty in murder of four B.C. women |last=Blatchford |first=Christie |author-link=Christie Blatchford |date=September 11, 2014 |newspaper=[[National Post]] |access-date=2018-05-13 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.today/20140912132427/http://fullcomment.nationalpost.com/2014/09/11/christie-blatchford-cody-legebokoff-without-remorse-is-convicted-of-four-counts-of-first-degree-murder/ |archive-date=2014-09-12}}</ref> *[[Allan Legere]]: also known as "Monster of the [[Miramichi]]"; killer of five individuals.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.douglaschristie.com/DHC/TommyRoss.htm |title=Profiles of 5 SHU Inmates: Canada's most dangerous cons |last=Cameron |first=Corey |date=November 25, 2001 |website=[[Canoe.com|Canoe News]] |access-date=March 22, 2014 |via=douglaschristie.com}}</ref> *[[2010–2017 Toronto serial homicides|Bruce McArthur]]: [[Toronto]] man who killed and dismemembered eight men between 2010 and 2017; sentenced to life in prison in 2019.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.cnn.com/2019/02/08/us/bruce-mcarthur-toroto-serial-killer-sentencing/index.html |title=Toronto serial killer Bruce McArthur sentenced to life in prison |first=Ray |last=Sanchez |date=8 February 2019 |website=[[CNN]] |accessdate=8 February 2019}}</ref> *[[Michael Wayne McGray]]: killed seven people, including a woman and child and a cellmate, claims to have killed eleven others.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.crimezzz.net/serialkillers/M/McGRAY_michael_wayne.php |title=McGray, Michael Wayne |first=Elisabeth |last=Wetsch |website=Serial Killer Crime Index |access-date=2018-05-13 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160303230637/http://www.crimezzz.net/serialkillers/M/McGRAY_michael_wayne.php |archive-date=3 March 2016 }}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/news/national/i-got-very-good-at-it-killer-says/article4162061/ |title='I got very good at it,' killer says |last=Anderssen |first=Erin |date=24 March 2000 |newspaper=[[The Globe and Mail]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Dellen Millard and Mark Smich|Dellen Millard]]: convicted of murdering three people, including his father; two were killed with help from accomplice Mark Smich.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://nationalpost.com/news/canada/dellen-millards-conviction-in-fathers-death-makes-him-canadas-latest-serial-killer |title=Dellen Millard's conviction in father's death makes him Canada's latest serial killer |first=Adrian |last=Humphreys |date=September 24, 2018 |newspaper=National Post |accessdate=September 25, 2018}}</ref> *[[Clifford Olson]]: murdered eleven children in British Columbia in the early 1980s; died in prison 2011.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.ctv.ca/servlet/ArticleNews/story/CTVNews/20060621/olson_parole_hearing_060621/20060621 |title=Parole hearing being planned for Clifford Olson |date=June 21, 2006 |website=[[CTV News]] |accessdate=September 21, 2011 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060701075918/http://www.ctv.ca/servlet/ArticleNews/story/CTVNews/20060621/olson_parole_hearing_060621/20060621 |archivedate=July 1, 2006}}</ref> *[[Robert Pickton]]: [[Port Coquitlam]], British Columbia man charged with the first degree murders of 26 women; allegedly confessed to 49 murders; convicted December 9, 2007 of six charges; reduced to second degree murder.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.missingpeople.net/2005/pickton_indictments.htm |title=Pickton Indictments, 27 first degree murders charges |date=May 25, 2005 |website=MissingPeople.net |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Yves Trudeau (biker)|Yves Trudeau]]: known as "the Mad Bumper"; former member of an [[outlaw motorcycle gang]] took part in 43 murders between 1973 and 1985; died of [[bone-marrow cancer]] in 2008.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.canada.com/montrealgazette/news/story.html?id=8a8cea7d-bcd5-43b3-bb16-f68c53506479 |title=He killed at least 43, now ex-biker faces death |last=Cherry |first=Paul |date=16 July 2008 |newspaper=[[Montreal Gazette]] |accessdate=9 October 2011 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20121106084424/http://www.canada.com/montrealgazette/news/story.html?id=8a8cea7d-bcd5-43b3-bb16-f68c53506479 |archivedate=6 November 2012}}</ref> *[[Elizabeth Wettlaufer]]: registered nurse who murdered eight senior citizens in [[Ontario]] with fatal injections of [[insulin]], and gave non-fatal injections to six others, between 2007 and 2016.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.thestar.com/news/canada/2016/10/29/from-caring-nurse-to-accused-serial-killer-who-is-elizabeth-wettlaufer.html |title=From caring nurse to accused serial killer: who is Elizabeth Wettlaufer? |last1=Gillis |first1=Wendy |last2=Siekierska |first2=Alicja |last3=Goffin |first3=Peter |lastauthoramp=yes |date=October 29, 2016 |newspaper=[[Toronto Star]] |accessdate=June 3, 2017}}</ref> *[[Russell Williams (criminal)|Russell Williams]]: former Colonel of the [[Canadian Forces]]; killed two women and is suspected of murdering a third; sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.thestar.com/news/article/873244--col-russell-williams-a-serial-killer-like-none-police-have-seen |title=Col. Russell Williams: A serial killer like none police have seen |first1=Jim |last1=Rankin |first2=Sandro |last2=Contenta |date=October 9, 2010 |newspaper=Toronto Star |accessdate=October 16, 2010}}</ref> *[[Peter Woodcock]]: murdered three children in 1956 and 1957 in Toronto and a fellow psychiatric institute patient in 1991; died while incarcerated in 2010.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.thestar.com/news/ontario/article/776986--the-serial-killer-they-couldn-t-cure-dies-behind-bars#article |title=The serial killer they couldn't cure dies behind bars |first=Mark |last=Bourrie |date=March 9, 2010 |newspaper=Toronto Star |accessdate=July 22, 2010}}</ref>
===Chile=== *[[Émile Dubois (murderer)|Émile Dubois]]: French-born murderer and folk hero who's revered as "The Chilean Robin Hood" for killing alleged usurers; executed 1907.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.lanacion.cl/prontus_noticias/site/artic/20070323/pags/20070323170038.html |title=Emile Dubois, el inmigrante francés que se convirtió en mito |trans-title=Emile Dubois, the French immigrant who became a myth |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=24 March 2007 |newspaper=[[La Nación (Chile)|La Nación]] |location=Santiago, Chile |language=es |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090328140322/http://www.lanacion.cl/prontus_noticias/site/artic/20070323/pags/20070323170038.html |archive-date=28 March 2009}}</ref> *[[Catalina de los Ríos y Lisperguer]]: also known as "La Quintrala"; 17th century landowner tried for over 40 murders; died 1665.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.biografiadechile.cl/detalle.php?IdContenido=82&IdCategoria=8&IdArea=28&status=&TituloPagina=Historia%20de%20Chile |title=Catalina de los Ríos y Lisperguer: 1604-1665 |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |website=Biografia de Chile |language=es |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Julio Pérez Silva]]: also known as "Psychopath from [[Alto Hospicio]]", sentenced to life imprisonment for murdering fourteen women from 1998 to 2001. *[[Viña del Mar psychopaths|Jorge Sagredo and Carlos Topp]]: also known as the "Viña del Mar Psychopaths"; committed ten murders and four rapes from 5 August 1980 to 1 November 1981 in [[Viña del Mar]]; executed by firing squad on 29 January 1985; they were the last people executed in Chile.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://sicopatasdevina.cl/caso/ |title=El Caso Completo |trans-title=The Complete Case |website=Sicopatas De Viña.cl |accessdate=26 November 2013}}</ref>
===People's Republic of China=== *[[Bai Baoshan]]: robber who attacked several police stations in three provinces; killed fifteen people; executed 1998. *[[Dong Wenyu]]: burglar-rapist who killed six people during break-ins between March and May 2006; also raped the female victims' corpses; executed 2007.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://news.163.com/07/1128/21/3UDSA31V00011229.html |title=Rapist-murderer Dong Wenyu is in Fufa, Zhejiang today |access-date=9 January 2020 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071130182348/http://news.163.com/07/1128/21/3UDSA31V00011229.html |archive-date=30 November 2007 |url-status=dead }}</ref> *[[Li Yijiang]]: killed seven people in the early 2000s; shot in 2004.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news3.xinhuanet.com/legal/2003-08/29/content_1053437.htm |title=北京连环杀人案变态男子的学生时代 |trans-title=The student life of the man in the Beijing serial killing case |date=2003-08-29 |website=[[Xinhua News]] |language=zh-hans |access-date=2018-08-24 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304211517/http://news3.xinhuanet.com/legal/2003-08/29/content_1053437.htm |archive-date=2016-03-04}}</ref> *[[Liu Pengli]]: 2nd century BC Han prince; one of the earliest serial killers attested by historical sources.<ref>''[[Book of Han]]''</ref> *[[Long Zhimin]]: together with his wife Yan Shuxia, lured in and subsequently murdered 48 people in his home for various reasons between 1983 and 1985; ===Denmark=== *[[Christina Aistrup Hansen]]: nurse who killed three patients at the [[Nykøbing Falster]] Hospital; charges changed from three murders to four attempted manslaughter charges; initially sentenced to life imprisonment, changed to 12 years in prison.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://politiken.dk/indland/art5627110/Anklagers-afsluttende-bem%C3%A6rkning-Sygeplejerske-dr%C3%A6bte-i-et-bizart-skuespil |title=Anklagers afsluttende bemærkning: Sygeplejerske dræbte i et bizart skuespil |trans-title=Prosecutor's closing remarks: Nurse killed in a bizarre acts |first=Kristian |last=Corfixen |date=9 June 2016 |newspaper=[[Politiken]] |language=da |access-date=9 March 2018}}</ref> *[[Peter Lundin]]: killed his mother in the United States in 1991, then killed his mistress and her two children in Denmark 9 years later; sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://finans.tv2.dk/nyheder/article.php/lundin-morderen-der-vidste-at-ligene-sladrer/?id=8173031 |title=Lundin: Morderen der vidste at ligene sladrer |trans-title=Lundin: The killer who knew that bodies will talk |first=Niels |last=Tradsfeldt |date=9 September 2007 |website=[[TV 2 (Denmark)|TV 2]] |language=da |accessdate=9 March 2009}}</ref> *[[Dagmar Overbye]]: childcare provider who killed between nine and twenty-five children; sentenced to death in 1921 then [[Clemency#Related concepts|reprieved]]; died in prison on 6 May 1929.<ref>{{Cite encyclopedia |url=http://www.kvinfo.dk/side/170/bio/904/ |title=Dagmar Overby (1887–1929) |first=Hanne Rimmen |last=Nielsen |encyclopedia=[[Dansk kvindebiografisk leksikon]] |year=2003 |publisher=[[KVINFO]] |language=da |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===Ecuador=== *[[Gilberto Chamba]]: also known as the "Monster of [[Machala]]"; murdered eight people in Ecuador and one in Spain; sentenced to 45 years in prison in Spain on 5 November 2006.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.hoy.com.ec/noticias-ecuador/gilberto-chamba-alias-el-monstruo-de-machala-una-historia-real-a-lo-alfred-hitchcock-250160.html |title=Gilberto Chamba alias "El Monstruo de Machala": Una historia real a lo Alfred Hitchcock |trans-title=Gilberto Chamba alias the "Moster of Machala": A true story of Alfred Hitchcock |date=8 November 2006 |newspaper=[[Hoy (Ecuadorian newspaper)|Hoy]] |location=Quito |language=es |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140222001443/http://www.hoy.com.ec/noticias-ecuador/gilberto-chamba-alias-el-monstruo-de-machala-una-historia-real-a-lo-alfred-hitchcock-250160.html |archive-date=22 February 2014}}</ref> *[[Juan Fernando Hermosa]]: also known as "Niño del Terror"; minor responsible for killing twenty-three people from 1991 to 1992 in [[Quito]], mostly taxi drivers and homosexuals; sentenced to four years imprisonment and then released, later murdered on his 20th birthday by unknown assailants.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.eltelegrafo.com.ec/noticias/judicial/1/el-nino-del-terror-mataba-a-balazos-video |title=El 'Niño del terror' mataba a balazos |trans-title=The 'Child of Terror' shot to death |date=13 June 2014 |newspaper=[[El Telégrafo (Ecuador)|El Telégrafo]] |language=es |accessdate=26 March 2019 |url-status=live |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20190326210719/https://www.eltelegrafo.com.ec/noticias/judicial/1/el-nino-del-terror-mataba-a-balazos-video |archivedate=26 March 2019}}</ref>
===Egypt=== *[[Ramadan Abdel Rehim Mansour]]: also known as "Al-Tourbini"; gang leader who raped and murdered homeless children across Egypt by throwing them off trains in the 2000s, sometimes burying them alive; executed in 2010.<ref>{{cite book |url=https://archive.org/details/insideegyptlando00brad/page/199 |title=Inside Egypt: The Land of the Pharaohs on the Brink of a Revolution |first=John R. |last=Bradley |publisher=Palgrave Macmillan |year=2008 |pages=[https://archive.org/details/insideegyptlando00brad/page/199 199–200] |isbn=978-1-4039-8477-7 }}</ref><ref>{{cite journal |url=http://www.mawared.org/english/files/Qatrannada11.pdf |title=Street Children: From Negligence to Confrontation |journal=Qatr An-Nada: Towards a Fair Start for Children in the Arab World |pages=2–3 |issue=11 |year=2007 |publisher=Arab Resource Collective |accessdate=January 20, 2009 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110727072155/http://www.mawared.org/english/files/Qatrannada11.pdf |archivedate=July 27, 2011}}</ref><ref name=et>{{cite magazine |url=http://www.egypttoday.com/article.aspx?ArticleID=7119 |title=Killing Kids |first=Manal |last=el-Jesri |date=January 2007 |magazine=[[Egypt Today]] |accessdate=January 20, 2009 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080113105035/http://www.egypttoday.com/article.aspx?ArticleID=7119 |archive-date=13 January 2008}}</ref> *[[Raya and Sakina]]: Egypt's most famous serial killers and the first Egyptian women to be executed by the modern state of Egypt; executed along with their husbands in 1921.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://weekly.ahram.org.eg/1999/434/chrncls.htm |title=The women killers |first=Yunan Labib |last=Rizk |date=23 June 1999 |newspaper=[[Al-Ahram Weekly]] |issue=434 |accessdate=20 April 2015 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140307042506/http://weekly.ahram.org.eg/1999/434/chrncls.htm |archivedate=7 March 2014}}</ref>
===Estonia=== *[[Johannes-Andreas Hanni]]: murderer, rapist, and cannibal who killed three people in 1982; committed suicide in police custody on 6 November 1982<ref>{{cite web |url=http://maaja.ee/andreas-hanni-tallinna-inimsooja/ |title=Andreas Hanni – Tallinna inimsööja |trans-title=Andreas Hanni - Tallinn cannibal |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=9 April 2007 |website=Maaja |language=et |access-date=29 August 2018}}</ref> *[[Bomb man of Pae street|Märt Ringmaa]]: also known as the "Bomb Man of Pae Street"; killed seven people over the course of ten years in [[Tallinn]] using [[Improvised explosive device|IEDs]] that exploded in public places.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.epl.ee/uudised/370737 |title=Pae tänava pommimees läheb kohtusse |trans-title=Pae Street bomb man goes to court |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=20 January 2007 |newspaper=[[Eesti Päevaleht]] |language=et |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070123154734/http://www.epl.ee/uudised/370737 |archive-date=23 January 2007}}</ref> *[[Aleksandr Rubel]]: Ukrainian-born killer who was convicted the murderers of six people in [[Tallinn]] as a minor in the late 1990s; released from prison on 8 June 2006. *[[Yuri Ustimenko and Dmitry Medvedev]]: Russian duo who committed robberies, killing five people; Medvedev was killed by police, and Ustimenko was captured in Poland, extradited to Estonia and sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.delfi.ee/a/50939117 |title=Sarimõrvar Ustimenko toodi Eestisse täiendatud |trans-title=Serial killer Ustimenko brought to Estonia |first=Tanel |last=Õunapuu |date=12 November 2002 |newspaper=Eesti Päevaleht |language=et |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>

Swiss soldier who sexually abused and killed at least five hitchhikers between 1981 and 1987 in Switzerland, France and the United States; suspected of more murders.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://pipiou.over-blog.com/article-13989130.html |title=Michel Peiry "Le sadique de Romont" |trans-title=Michel Peiry "The sadist of Romont" |author=<!--Staff writer(s); watchmaker who poisoned his parents and lovers from 1872 to 1884; sentenced to penal labour in [[New Caledonia]], where he died in 1924.<ref>{{cite book |last=Brouardel |first=Paul |title=The Pel Affair |publisher=Baillière |date=1886 |page=48}}</ref> *[[Marcel Petiot]]: doctor who killed 63 would-be refugees in Paris who were fleeing from the [[Nazis]]; executed in 1946.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.trutv.com/library/crime/serial_killers/history/petiot/5.html |title=Crime Library: Serial Killers: Dr. Marcel Petiot |first=Michael |last=Newton |website=TruTV.com |access-date=2013-06-11 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121007230412/http://www.trutv.com/library/crime/serial_killers/history/petiot/5.html |archive-date=2012-10-07}}</ref> *[[Louis Poirson]]: also known as "Rambo";
