[[Madagascar|Malagasy]]-born stonemason who kidnapped women from 1995 to 2000, killing four of them; sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.leparisien.fr/faits-divers/plongee-dans-le-terrible-passe-du-tueur-en-serie-30-05-2002-2003110943.php |title=Plongée dans le terrible passé du tueur en série |trans-title=Diving into the terrible past of the serial killer |last=Albouy |first=Stéphane |date=30 May 2002 |newspaper=[[Le Parisien]] |language=fr |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Victor Prévost]]: also known as the "Butcher of La Chapelle"; former peacekeeper who murdered an acquaintance and his mistress between 1877 and 1879; suspected in two other disappearances; executed 1880.<ref>{{harvsp|La Lanterne|10/12/1880|p=1|id=LL}}</ref> *[[Gilles de Rais]]: 15th century satanist and child killer who is reputed to have killed 400; executed on 23 October 1440.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.trutv.com/library/crime/serial_killers/predators/rais/execution_13.html |title=Gilles de Rais: The Pious Monster |first=Mark |last=Gribben |website=The Crime Library |accessdate=17 November 2011 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120419115554/http://www.trutv.com/library/crime/serial_killers/predators/rais/execution_13.html |archive-date=April 19, 2012}}</ref> *[[Tommy Recco]]: killed his godfather in 1960; released in 1977, after which he killed a total of six cashiers in [[Béziers]] and [[Carqueiranne]] from 1979 to 1980; also suspected of murdering a trio of German tourists; one of the oldest French prisoners.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.lci.fr/faits-divers/corse-le-tueur-en-serie-tommy-recco-auteur-de-7-meurtres-demande-une-nouvelle-fois-sa-liberation-a-l-age-de-83-ans-2052546.html |title=Corse : Tommy Recco, auteur de 7 meurtres, demande une nouvelle fois sa libération à l'âge de 83 ans |trans-title=Corsica: Tommy Recco, perpetrator of 7 murders, again requests release at the age of 83 |last=Mousset |first=L. |date=19 May 2017 |website=[[La Chaîne Info]] |language=fr |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Sid Ahmed Rezala]]: known as "the Killer of the Trains"; Algerian-born serial killer who killed three women in 1999; committed suicide in custody in 2000.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/uk_news/755008.stm |title='Confession' in Peake murder |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=19 May 2000 |website=BBC News |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Rémy Roy]]: also known as the "[[Minitel]] Killer"; murdered three gay men after staged sadomasochistic acts from 1990 to 1991; sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.liberation.fr/france-archive/1996/06/29/le-tueur-du-minitel-condamne-a-perpetuite-remy-roy-etait-juge-pour-le-meurtre-de-trois-homosexuels-r_173025 |title=Le tueur du Minitel condamné à perpétuité. Rémy Roy était jugé pour le meurtre de trois homosexuels rencontrés par le biais de messageries |trans-title=The killer of Minitel sentenced to life. Rémy Roy was tried for the murder of three homosexuals met through couriers |last=Vital-Durand |first=Brigitte |date=29 June 1996 |newspaper=Libération |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> * [[Giuseppe Sasia]]: known as the "Shepherds' Killer"; Italian criminal who killed at least four men in the span of a few months in 1934 in [[Draguignan]], also suspected of a 1930 murder; executed 1936.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.retronews.fr/journal/le-temps/9-decembre-1934/123/649815/3 |title=Faits-Divers: Les assassinats de bergers dans le Haut-Var |trans-title=News in brief: The murders of shepherds in the Haut-Var |date=9 December 1934 |page=3 |newspaper=[[Le Temps (Paris)|Le Temps]] |language=fr |access-date=23 November 2019 |via=RetroNews}}</ref> * [[Antoinette Scieri]]: nurse who confessed to killing twelve elderly patients, convicted on 27 April 1926 and died in prison.<ref>{{cite book |last=Nash |first=Jay Robert |title=Look for the Woman: A Narrative Encyclopedia of Female Prisoners, Kidnappers, Thieves, Extortionists, Terrorists, Swindlers and Spies from Elizabethan Times to the Present |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=D9zaCQAAQBAJ |date=1 November 1986 |location=Lanham, Maryland |publisher=[[M. Evans and Company]] |isbn=978-1-4617-4772-7}}</ref> *[[Nadir Sedrati]]: also known as the "Cutter of the Canal"; murdered and dismembered three people in 1999, throwing the remains into the [[Marne-Rhine Canal]]; sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.estrepublicain.fr/faits-divers/2013/09/06/nadir-sedrati-le-depeceur-du-canal |title=Nadir Sedrati, tueur machiavélique |trans-title=Nadir Sedrati, Machiavellian killer |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=12 September 2013 |newspaper=L'Est Républicain |language=fr |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Alfredo Stranieri]]: also known as the "Classified Ad Killer"; Italian-born con man who committed two double murders in 1997 and 1999; sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.liberation.fr/societe/1999/07/21/quatre-cadavres-avec-preuves-d-achat-ce-sont-les-ex-proprietaires-des-commerces-rachetes-par-stranie_279306 |title=Quatre cadavres avec preuves d'achat. Ce sont les ex-propriétaires des commerces rachetés par Stranieri |trans-title=Four corpses with proof of purchase. These are the former owners of the shops bought by Stranieri |last=Bertrand |first=Olivier |date=21 July 1999 |newspaper=Libération |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Patrick Tissier]]: recidivistic rapist who killed three people from 1971 to 1993; sentenced to life imprisonment with a minimum of 30 years.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.la-croix.com/Archives/1998-02-02/Patrick-Tissier-est-condamne-a-la-reclusion-criminelle-a-perpetuite-_NP_-1998-02-02-451354 |title=Patrick Tissier est condamné à la réclusion criminelle à perpétuité |trans-title=Patrick Tissier is sentenced to life imprisonment |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=2 February 1998 |newspaper=[[La Croix]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Joseph Vacher]]: also known as "The French Ripper" and "The South-East Ripper"; 19th century serial killer of eleven people; executed by guillotine on 31 December 1898.<ref>{{cite book |url=http://murderpedia.org/male.V/v/vacher-joseph.htm |first1=Brian |last1=Lane |first2=Wilfred |last2=Gregg |title=The Encyclopedia of Serial Killers |date=1992 |location=London, UK |publisher=[[Headline Publishing Group|Headline]] |isbn=978-0-74723-731-0 |accessdate=7 January 2013 |quote=Yes, I committed the crimes... I committed them all in moments of frenzy. |via=Murderpedia}}</ref> *[[Denis Waxin]]: pedophile who raped six children from 1985 to 1992 in the [[Nord (French department)|Nord department]], killing three of them; sentenced to life imprisonment for a minimum of 29 years.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.nordeclair.fr/Locales/Lille/2009/08/04/le-cauchemar-du-pompiste-pedophile.shtml |title=Le cauchemar du pompiste pédophile |trans-title=The nightmare of the pedophile pump attendant |last=Renoul |first=Bruno |date=4 August 2009 |newspaper=[[Nord éclair]] |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151001200459/http://www.nordeclair.fr/Locales/Lille/2009/08/04/le-cauchemar-du-pompiste-pedophile.shtml |archive-date=1 October 2015}}</ref> *[[Jeanne Weber]]: convicted of the strangulation murders of ten children; committed suicide in custody in 1918.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://28rueaffre.eklablog.com/jeanne-weber-l-ogresse-de-la-goutte-d-or-a113380782 |title=Jeanne Weber, l'Ogresse de la Goutte d'Or |trans-title=Jeanne Weber, the Ogress of the [[Goutte d'Or]] |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=27 November 2014 |website=28 rue Affre |language=fr |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Eugen Weidmann]]: German who strangled and robbed American dancer [[Jean de Koven]], shot a former accomplice, and shot dead and robbed four other people around Paris in 1937.<ref>{{cite magazine |url=https://www.newyorker.com/magazine/1938/02/05/american-in-paris |title=American in Paris |last=Flanner |first=Janet |date=29 January 1938 |magazine=[[The New Yorker]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===Germany=== {{Main|List of German serial killers}}
===Ghana=== *[[Charles Quansah]]: known as the "Accra Strangler"; convicted of the [[strangulation]] deaths of nine women in [[Accra]]; suspected of killing 34; sentenced to death in 2003.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.modernghana.com/GhanaHome/NewsArchive/news_details.asp?id=VFhwck1VNUVZejA9&type=&section=&gender=General_News&menu_id=1&menu_id2=0&sub_menu_id=0 |title=Serial Killer Speaks Out |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=20 August 2003 |website=The Ghana Resource Center |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20070927025650/http://www.modernghana.com/GhanaHome/NewsArchive/news_details.asp?id=VFhwck1VNUVZejA9&type=&section=&gender=General_News&menu_id=1&menu_id2=0&sub_menu_id=0 |archive-date=27 September 2007}}</ref>
===Greece=== *[[Antonis Daglis]]: also known as the "[[Athens]] Ripper"; convicted in 1997 of the strangulation murder and dismemberment of three women and the attempted murder of six others; committed suicide in police custody in 1997.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.hri.org/news/greek/ana/1996/96-01-26.ana.html |title=Police charge 21-year-old with murder of two prostitutes |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=26 January 1996 |website=Athens News Agency Bulletin |number=797 |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Hermann Duft and Hans Wilhelm Bassenauer]]: Germans who murdered six persons in Greece, within a short period in 1969, were captured, tried, sentenced to death and executed in 1969.<ref name=palm>{{cite web |url=http://www.palmografos.com/permalink/20902.html#ixzz2z8BylBnB |title=Η εκτέλεση των Ντουφτ και Μπασενάουερ |trans-title=The execution of Duft and Basenauer |last=Kontogiannidis |first=Tásou |date=16 December 2013 |website=Palmographos |language=el |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Aristidis Pagratidis]]: also known as the "Ogre of Seikh Sou"; allegedly attacked couples in the forested area of Seikh Sou in suburban [[Thessaloniki]] from 1958 to 1959, killing three people; executed 1968, and since then his guilt has been questioned.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.athensmagazine.gr/article/news/36593-oi-thewries-synwmosias-gia-ton-laquo-drako-raquo-toy-seix-soy-h-skoteinh-ypothesh-kai-ta-fonika-poy-anatrixiazoyn-akoma-kai-miso-aiwna-meta |title=Οι θεωρίες συνωμοσίας για τον "δράκο" του Σέιχ Σου! Η σκοτεινή υπόθεση και τα φονικά που ανατριχιάζουν ακόμα και μισό αιώνα μετά!!! |trans-title=The conspiracy theories about the "dragon" of the Sheikh Shu! The dark affair and the killings that shake even half a century later!!! |last=Αδαμου |first=Ντονατελλασ |date=2013-04-11 |website=Athens Magazine |language=el |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Kyriakos Papachronis]]: also known as the "Ogre of [[Drama, Greece|Drama]]"; murdered three women from 1981 to 1982, committing other crimes as well; sentenced to life imprisonment, released on bail in 2004.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.kathimerini.gr/202903/article/epikairothta/ellada/eley8eros-o-papaxronhs-poy-apokhry3e-ton-ewsforo |title=Ελεύθερος ο Παπαχρόνης που αποκήρυξε τον Εωσφόρο |last=Καρανατση |first=Ελενα |date=9 December 2004 |newspaper=[[Kathimerini]] |language=el |access-date=2018-05-19}}</ref> *[[Mariam Soulakiotis]]: also known as the "Woman Rasputin"; convent abbot who lured, tortured and killed 177 wealthy women and children from 1939 to 1951; died 1954.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.reporter.com.cy/greece/article/61972/i-monachi-serial-killer-mariam-tis-kerateas |title=Η μοναχή serial killer Μαριάμ της Κερατέας |trans-title=The serial killer nun Mariam of Keratea |first=Ελίνα |last=Σταματίου |date=2016-05-09 |website=Ρεπορτερ |language=el |access-date=2019-04-27}}</ref> *[[Dimitris Vakrinos]]: killed five people and attempted seven more murders for minor quarrels between 1987 and 1996; hanged himself in the prison showers in 1997.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.tovima.gr/relatedarticles/article/?aid=87285 |title=Το… βρουβάκι του χωριού |first=Παναγιωτα |last=Μπιτσικα |date=13 April 1997 |newspaper=[[To Vima]] |language=el |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===Hong Kong=== *[[Lam Kor-wan]]: sexual sadist who murdered and dismembered four women in the 1980s; sentenced to death (commuted to life imprisonment as per tradition at that time).<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.scmp.com/magazines/post-magazine/short-reads/article/2106303/our-archives-capture-hong-kongs-jars-killer |title=From our archives: the capture of Hong Kong's Jars Killer |first=Jessica |last=Li |date=August 13, 2017 |newspaper=[[South China Morning Post]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Lam Kwok-wai]]: murdered three women, apprehended in 1993 and sentenced to life imprisonment (capital punishment already abolished).<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.scmp.com/article/128162/tuen-mun-rapist-loses-plea |title=Tuen Mun rapist loses plea |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=17 August 1995 |newspaper=South China Morning Post |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===Hungary=== *[[Angel Makers of Nagyrév]]: group of women led by Susanna Fazekas who poisoned around 300 people in the village of [[Nagyrév]] between 1914 and 1929.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/europe/3567679.stm |title=Unearthing Hungary husband murders |last1=Fish |first1=Jim |accessdate=10 December 2016 |website=BBC News |date=29 March 2004}}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine |url=https://www.psychologytoday.com/articles/199911/bad-girls |title=Bad Girls |first=Barry |last=Yeoman |magazine=[[Psychology Today]] |date=1 November 1999 |publisher=Sussex Publishers, LLC |accessdate=10 December 2016}}</ref> *[[Erzsébet Báthory]]: [[countess]] who killed servant girls; rumored to have killed more than 600.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.trutv.com/library/crime/serial_killers/predators/bathory/7.html |title=Countess Elizabeth Bathory – The Blood Countess |last=Ramsland |first=Katherine |website=The Crime Library |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110815205239/http://www.trutv.com/library/crime/serial_killers/predators/bathory/7.html |archive-date=2011-08-15}}</ref> *[[Aladár Donászi]]: robber who killed four people from 1991 to 1992 with his accomplice László Bene; committed suicide in prison in 2001.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.kisalfold.hu/szieszta/irnoka_volt_donaszi_a_hirhedt_gyilkos/1164138/ |title=Írnoka volt Donászi, a hírhedt gyilkos |trans-title=Clerk was Donászi, the notorious killer |date=25 March 2006 |website=Kisalföld |language=hu |accessdate=23 September 2015}}</ref> *[[Béla Kiss]]: murdered at least twenty-four women, escaped justice in the confusion of [[World War I]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/justice-story/killer-murdered-24-pickled-corpses-barrels-article-1.1607445 |title=Hungarian man murdered 24, pickled each corpse in barrels of alcohol in early 1900s |first=Mara |last=Bovsun |date=9 February 2014 |newspaper=[[New York Daily News]] |access-date=20 March 2016 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140302235328/http://www.nydailynews.com/news/justice-story/killer-murdered-24-pickled-corpses-barrels-article-1.1607445 |archive-date=March 2, 2014}}</ref> *[[Péter Kovács (serial killer)|Péter Kovács]]: also known as the "[[Martfű]] Monster"; truck driver who raped and killed between four and five women from 1957 and 1967, possibly responsible for more murders; executed 1968.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://nol.hu/mozaik/hatodik_tipusu_sorozatgyilkossag-333179 |title=Hatodik típusú sorozatgyilkosság |trans-title=Sixth type serial killer |date=17 May 2009 |newspaper=[[Népszabadság]] |language=hu |accessdate=28 August 2015}}</ref> *[[Gusztáv Nemeskéri]]: also known as the "Katóka Street Killer"; killed four people between 1996 and 1999 to settle his debts, including his half-brother; sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://index.hu/bulvar/gyilkos1009/ |title=Tényleges életfogytiglant kapott a négyszeres gyilkos |trans-title=The four-time killer got life imprisonment |date=9 October 2003 |website=[[Index (Hungarian website)|Index]] |language=hu |accessdate=12 May 2017}}</ref> *[[Zoltán Szabó (serial killer)|Zoltán Szabó]]: also known as the "Balástya Monster"; killed and mutilated at least four women on his farm in [[Balástya]] between 1998 and 2001; committed suicide while imprisoned in 2016.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.ma.hu/tart/rcikk/a/0/65744/1 |title=Életfogytiglani fegyház a "balástyai rém" megérdemelt büntetése |trans-title=Life imprisonment is a well-deserved punishment for "Balástya's Nightmare" |date=20 November 2003 |website=Ma.hu |language=hu |accessdate=2 October 2015}}</ref>
===Iceland=== *[[Axlar-Björn|Björn Pétursson]]: also known as "Axlar-Björn"; killed at least nine travellers in the 16th century.
===India=== *[[Thug Behram]] (ca. 1765–1840): alleged to have killed over 900 people; executed in 1840.<ref>{{cite book |last=Dash |first=Mike |author-link=Mike Dash |date=2005 |title=Thug: The True Story of India's Murderous Cult |location=London, UK |publisher=Granta Books |pages=283–289 |isbn=1-86207-604-9}}</ref><ref>{{cite book |last=Ash |first=Russell |date=1995 |title=The Top Ten of Everything 1996 |location=London, UK |publisher=[[Dorling Kindersley]] |page=[https://archive.org/details/toptenofeverythi00russ_0/page/65 65] |isbn=0-7894-0196-7 |url=https://archive.org/details/toptenofeverythi00russ_0/page/65 }}</ref><ref>{{cite book |last=Rubinstein |first=William D. |author-link=William Rubinstein |date=2004 |title=Genocide: A History |location=Harlow, Essex |publisher=[[Pearson Education Limited]] |page=83 |isbn=978-0-58250-601-5}}</ref> *[[Seema Gavit and Renuka Shinde]] (born 1975 and 1973): sisters who kidnapped and murdered five children between 1990 and 1996.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://indianexpress.com/article/india/india-others/thieves-who-kidnapped-used-and-killed-babies |title=Thieves who kidnapped, used and killed babies |first=Atikh |last=Rashid |date=18 August 2014 |newspaper=[[The Indian Express]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[M. Jaishankar]] (born 1977): also known as "Psycho Shankar", involved in about 30 rapes, murders and robbery cases around [[Tamil Nadu]].<ref name="IT_how_2013">{{cite magazine |url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/psycho-shankar-how-serial-rapist-killer-was-nabbed/1/308631.html |title=Psycho Shankar – How the serial rapist and killer was nabbed |first1=T. S. |last1=Sudhir |first2=Rohini |last2=Swamy |first3=Shreesha |last3=Reddy |lastauthoramp=yes |date=6 September 2013 |magazine=[[India Today]] |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=live |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150710200427/http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/psycho-shankar-how-serial-rapist-killer-was-nabbed/1/308631.html |archivedate=10 July 2015}}</ref> *[[Chandrakant Jha]] (born 1967): befriended and murdered seven male migrants from 1998 to 2007; sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{Cite magazine |url=https://www.indiatoday.in/india/north/story/rohini-court-death-sentence-to-serial-killer-chandrakant-jha-153306-2013-02-05 |title=Rohini Court awards death sentence to serial killer Chandrakant Jha |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=5 February 2013 |magazine=India Today |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Joshi-Abhyankar serial murders]]: series of ten murders committed by four art students in [[Pune]]; all were executed on 27 November 1983.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.rahulchandawarkar.com/news/general/general03float.htm |title=The Evil and the Dead |first=Rahul |last=Chandawarkar |date=September 6, 1998 |newspaper=[[Sunday Mid-Day]] |access-date=24 November 2019 |via=rahulchandawarkar.com |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20110715150717/http://www.rahulchandawarkar.com/news/general/general03float.htm |archivedate=15 July 2011}}</ref> *[[KD Kempamma]] (born 1970): also known as "Cyanide Mallika"; poisoned six women from 1999 to 2007 with cyanide; India's first convicted female serial killer; sentenced to death, commuted to life imprisonment.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/bengaluru/First-woman-serial-killer-nabbed/articleshow/2665976.cms |title=First woman serial killer nabbed |date=1 January 2008 |newspaper=[[The Times of India]] |accessdate=10 May 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.dailyo.in/variety/cyanide-mallika-serial-killers-women-crime/story/1/21649.html |title=Women who kill: The story behind India's first woman serial killer |last=Anand |first=Pinky |date=10 January 2018 |website=Daily O |accessdate=10 May 2018}}</ref> *[[2006 Noida serial murders|Surendra Koli]] (born 1970-71): convicted of raping and murdering four children in [[Delhi]] in 2005 and 2006 with another twelve cases pending.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.rediff.com/news/report/how-indira-jaising-got-midnight-reprieve-for-convict-koli/20140908.htm |title=How Indira Jaising got midnight reprieve for convict Koli |date=September 8, 2014 |website=[[Rediff]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=https://scroll.in/article/679297/nine-reasons-not-to-hang-alleged-nithari-serial-killer-surendra-koli |title=Nine reasons not to hang alleged Nithari serial killer Surendra Koli |first=Shivam |last=Vij |date=17 September 2014 |website=[[Scroll.in]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Mohan Kumar (serial killer)|Mohan Kumar]] (born 1963): also known as "Cyanide Mohan"; killed twenty female victims with cyanide, claiming they were contraceptive pills; sentenced to death in 2013.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.daijiworld.com/news/newsDisplay.aspx?newsID=67282 |title=Mangalore: Neighbours, Family, Refuse to Accept Mohan as Serial Killer |date=23 October 2009 |website=[[Daijiworld Media|Daijiworld.com]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Ravinder Kumar (serial killer)|Ravinder Kumar]] (born 1991): killed the children of poor families from 2008 until his arrest in 2015.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.firstpost.com/india/delhi-serial-rapist-ravinder-kumar-admits-killing-30-children-2355078.html |title=Delhi serial rapist Ravinder Kumar admits to killing more than 30 children |date=21 July 2015 |website=[[Firstpost]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Motta Navas]] (born 1966): killed pavement dwellers in their sleep during a three-month period in 2012 in [[Kollam]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.thehindu.com/todays-paper/tp-national/tp-kerala/man-held-on-charge-of-five-murders/article4060891.ece |title=Man held on charge of five murders |date=3 November 2012 |newspaper=[[The Hindu]] |accessdate=19 December 2012}}</ref> *[[Santosh Pol]] (born 1974): also known as "Dr. Death"; killed six people with [[succinylcholine]] in the town of Dhom.<ref>{{cite magazine |url=http://indiatoday.intoday.in/story/maharashtra-doctor-death-six-murders/1/741281.html |title=Maharashtra's 'Dr Death' confesses to 6 murders, five of them women |date=August 16, 2016 |magazine=India Today |accessdate=2016-08-17}}</ref> *[[Raman Raghav]] (1929–1995): also known as "Psycho Raman"; [[Mumbai]] man who killed homeless people and others in their sleep.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://indianexpress.com/article/lifestyle/life-style/the-monsoon-murders |title=The real man behind Raman Raghav 2.0: Mumbai's first big-ticket serial killer |first=Smita |last=Nair |date=2016-06-26 |newspaper=The Indian Express |access-date=2017-09-14}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/bollywood/inside-the-mind-of-raman-raghav-mumbai-s-serial-killer-of-the-60s/story-LaA01MtT0wrAM0ZprCoLYJ.html |title=Inside the mind of Raman Raghav, Mumbai's serial killer of the 1960s |first=Poonam |last=Saxena |date=2016-06-11 |newspaper=Hindustan Times |access-date=2017-09-14}}</ref> *[[Umesh Reddy]] alias BA Umesh (born 1969): confessed to eighteen rapes and murders, convicted in nine cases.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.telegraphindia.com/1091108/jsp/7days/story_11713568.jsp |title=Murders most foul |first=Varun |last=Verma |date=2009-11-08 |newspaper=[[The Telegraph (Kolkata)|The Telegraph]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Ripper Jayanandan]] (born 1968): also known as the "Singing Serial Killer"; killed seven people during robberies.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/kochi/Ripper-Jayanandan-gets-life-sentence/articleshow/11228173.cms |title=Ripper Jayanandan gets life sentence |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=24 December 2011 |newspaper=The Times of India |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Satish (Bahadurgarh baby killer)|Satish]] (born c. 1973): also known as the "[[Bahadurgarh]] Baby Killer"; confessed to and convicted for ten murders; sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://timesofindia.indiatimes.com/city/chandigarh/Serial-killers-life-spared/articleshow/2722792.cms |title=Serial killer's life spared |date=22 January 2008 |newspaper=The Times of India |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Auto Shankar]] (1954–1995): murdered nine teenage girls in [[Thiruvanmiyur]], [[Chennai]] during a six-month period in 1988; executed in 1995.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=EoZlAAAAIBAJ&sjid=mZ4NAAAAIBAJ&dq=auto%20shankar&pg=1032%2C3469058 |title=The mass murderer of Madras |first1=K. M. |last1=Thomas |date=9 September 1990 |newspaper=[[The Indian Express]] |accessdate=2 January 2013}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=PIxlAAAAIBAJ&sjid=q54NAAAAIBAJ&pg=817%2C2582855 |title=Auto Shankar, two others sentenced to death |date=1 June 1991 |newspaper=The Indian Express |accessdate=2 January 2013}}</ref> *[[Kampatimar Shankariya]] (1952–1979): killed at least 70 people with hammer in 1977-78; hung in Jaipur.<ref name=":0">{{Cite book|url=https://books.google.com/?id=DwNVbOcTncwC&pg=PA239&lpg=PA239&dq=kampatimar+shankariya#v=onepage&q=kampatimar%20shankariya&f=false|title=The Encyclopedia of Serial Killers|last=Newton|first=Michael|publisher=Infobase Publishing|year=2006|isbn=978-0-8160-6987-3|location=|pages=239|language=en}}</ref> *[[Darbara Singh (murderer)|Darbara Singh]] (born 1952): convicted for two murders, seventeen suspected victims.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.indiatvnews.com/crime/news/india-s-cruel-serial-baby-killer-darbara-singh-who-murdered-2674.html |title=India's cruel serial baby killer Darbara Singh, who murdered seventeen babies |date=2013-02-17 |website=[[India TV]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> Singh had three children; his wife expelled him from their house, because of his "bad habits". *[[Charles Sobhraj]] (born 1944): killed at least twelve Western tourists in [[Southeast Asia]] during the 1970s; imprisoned in [[India]] (released) and [[Nepal]] (in prison).<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.foxnews.com/story/international-serial-killer-charles-sobhraj-64-engaged-to-woman-20 |title=International Serial Killer Charles Sobhraj, 64, Engaged to Woman, 20 |date=5 July 2008 |website=[[Fox News]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.crimelibrary.com/notorious_murders/famous/charles_sobraj/1.html |title=Charles Sobhraj |first=Mark |last=Gribben |website=[[Crime Library]] |accessdate=20 February 2014 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140224131111/http://www.crimelibrary.com/notorious_murders/famous/charles_sobraj/1.html |archivedate=24 February 2014}}</ref> *[[Akku Yadav]] (died 2004): murdered at least three people and dumped their bodies on the railroad tracks; lynched by a mob of around 200 women in [[Nagpur]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://articles.timesofindia.indiatimes.com/2012-10-23/nagpur/34679336_1_murder-case-akku-yadav-panch-witness |title=Trial in Akku Yadav murder case begins |date=22 October 2012 |newspaper=The Times of India |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2005/sep/16/india.gender |title='Arrest us all': the 200 women who killed a rapist |first=Raekha |last=Prasad |date=16 September 2005 |newspaper=The Guardian |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2006/01/15/opinion/in-india-one-womans-stand-says-enough.html |title=In India, One Woman's Stand Says 'Enough' |first=Nicholas D. |last=Kristof |date=15 January 2006 |newspaper=The New York Times |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===Indonesia=== *[[Baekuni]]: also known as "Babe"; pedophile who killed between four and fourteen boys from 1993 to 2010; sentenced to life imprisonment, later changed to the death sentence.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://megapolitan.kompas.com/read/2010/01/17/07262786/Mutilasi.Baekuni.Lebih.Keji.Ryan.Henyansah.Lebih.Rumit |title=Mutilasi, Baekuni Lebih Keji, Ryan Henyansah Lebih Rumit |trans-title=Mutilation, Baekuni more vile, Ryan Henyansah more complex |date=17 January 2010 |newspaper=[[Kompas]] |language=id |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Very Idham Henyansyah]]: also known as "Ryan" and the "Singing Serial Killer"; convicted and sentenced to death in 2008 for the killing of eleven people.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/stories/2009/03/24/2525127.htm |title=Indonesia seeks death for singing serial killer |date=24 March 2009 |website=[[ABC News (Australia)|ABC News]] |accessdate=2011-01-10}}</ref> *[[Ahmad Suradji]]: admitted to killing 42 women around [[Medan]]; sentenced to death and executed by firing squad on 10 July 2008.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/asia/indonesia/2286216/Black-Magic-Killer-executed-for-42-murders.html |title=Black Magic Killer executed for 42 murders |first=Thomas |last=Bell |date=11 July 2008 |newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |accessdate=14 December 2016}}</ref>
===Iraq=== *[[Asghar the Murderer|Ali Asghar Borujerdi]]: also known as "Asghar the Murderer"; killed 33 young adults in Iraq and Iran; executed on 26 June 1934.<ref>{{cite journal |url=https://ulib.aub.edu.lb/data/hist258k-cs-47/Schayegh-Serial_murder_in_Tehran.pdf |title=Serial Murder in Tehran: Crime, Science, and the Formation of Modern State and Society in Interwar Iran |last=Schayegh |first=Cyrus |date=2005 |journal=Comparative Studies in Society and History |publisher=Cambridge University Press |volume=47 |issue=4 |pages=836–862 |doi=10.1017/S001041750500037X |issn=0010-4175 |jstor=3879345 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160520022651/http://ulib.aub.edu.lb/data/hist258k-cs-47/Schayegh-Serial_murder_in_Tehran.pdf |archive-date=20 May 2016}}</ref> *[[Louay Omar Mohammed al-Taei]]: medical doctor found to have killed 43 wounded policemen, soldiers and officials in [[Kirkuk]]; was a member of an [[Insurgency|insurgent cell]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/middle-east/insurgent-doctor-killed-dozens-of-wounded-soldiers-6105814.html |title=Insurgent doctor killed dozens of wounded soldiers |last=Cockburn |first=Patrick |date=23 March 2006 |newspaper=[[The Independent]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===Iran=== *[[Mohammed Bijeh]]: also known as the "Tehran Desert Vampire"; killed at least sixteen young boys near [[Tehran]]; executed in 2005. *[[Saeed Hanaei]]: also known as "The Spider Killer"; killed at least sixteen women around [[Mashhad]]; executed in 2002.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2002/04/18/world/iran-executes-worker-who-strangled-16-women-over-2-years.html |title=Iran Executes Worker Who Strangled 16 Women Over 2 Years |first=Nazila |last=Fathi |date=April 18, 2002 |newspaper=The New York Times |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Esmail Jafarzadeh]]: murdered a young girl in 2017, confessing to the murder of two women in 2012 and 2014 after his arrest; executed 2017.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://fararu.com/fa/news/324976/%D9%82%D8%A7%D8%AA%D9%84-%D8%A2%D8%AA%D9%86%D8%A7-%D8%AF%D9%88-%D8%B2%D9%86-%D8%AF%D9%8A%DA%AF%D8%B1-%D8%B1%D8%A7-%D9%87%D9%85-%DA%A9%D8%B4%D8%AA%D9%87-%D8%A7%D8%B3%D8%AA |title=قاتل آتنا دو زن ديگر را هم کشته‌ است |trans-title=Athena's killer has also killed two other women |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=6 August 2008 |website=[[Fararu]] |language=fa |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Gholamreza Khosroo Kurdieh]]: also known as "The Night Bat"; murdered nine women in Tehran in 1997, burning the bodies afterwards; executed 1997.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://images.hamshahrionline.ir/hamnews/1376/760523/HAVAD30.HTM |title=شد؟ 214 اعدام‌‏‎ چگونه‌‏‎ دختران‌‏‎ و‏‎ زنان‌‏‎ قاتل‌‏‎ |trans-title=214 was it? Execution of killer of girls and women |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=23 August 1997 |newspaper=[[Hamshahri]] |language=fa |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Majid Salek Mohammadi]]: murdered twenty-four people from 1981 to 1985, primarily women he considered unfaithful to their husbands; committed suicide in prison before he could be sentenced.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.isna.ir/news/95050119135/%D8%AE%D8%A7%D8%B7%D8%B1%D8%A7%D8%AA%DB%8C-%D8%A7%D8%B2-%D8%AF%D8%B3%D8%AA%DA%AF%DB%8C%D8%B1%DB%8C-%D8%A7%D9%88%D9%84%DB%8C%D9%86-%D9%82%D8%A7%D8%AA%D9%84-%D8%B3%D8%B1%DB%8C%D8%A7%D9%84%DB%8C-%D8%B2%D9%86%D8%A7%D9%86 |title=White rope murders |date=2016-08-20 |website=[[Iranian Students News Agency]] |language=fa |accessdate=25 July 2018}}</ref>
===Republic of Ireland=== *[[Geoffrey Evans|Geoffrey Evans and John Shaw]]: Englishmen who traveled to Ireland in 1976 and vowed to murder a woman once a week, killing two; both apprehended and sentenced. Until his 2012 death, Evans was one of Ireland's longest-serving prisoners.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.wicklownews.net/Post/2012/5/1911/brittas-bay-killer-geoffrey-evans-dies |title=Brittas bay killer Geoffrey Evans dies |date=21 May 2012 |newspaper=Wicklow News |accessdate=21 May 2012 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120524044621/http://www.wicklownews.net/Post/2012/5/1911/brittas-bay-killer-geoffrey-evans-dies |archivedate=24 May 2012}}</ref> *[[Darkey Kelly]]: [[brothel]]-keeper who killed six men in the 18th century; accused of witchcraft and was [[death by burning|burned at the stake]] in 1761.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.irishcentral.com/news/was-irish-witch-darkey-kelly-really-irelands-first-serial-killer-113340849-237364711.html |title=Was Irish witch Darkey Kelly really Ireland's first serial killer? |first=Cathy |last=Hayes |date=2011-01-12 |website=IrishCentral.com |accessdate=2015-03-04}}</ref><ref>{{cite podcast |url=https://www.podomatic.com/podcasts/nosmokewithouthellfire1/episodes/2011-01-19T14_46_14-08_00 |title=No Smoke Without Hellfire Part I |host=McLoughlin, Eamonn |date=2011-01-19 |website=PodOmatic |access-date=2015-03-04}}</ref> *[[Alice Kyteler]]: also known as "The Witch of [[Kilkenny]]"; alleged witch who poisoned four husbands in the 14th century; fled to England, fate unknown.<ref>{{cite book |chapter=Chapter II: "Dame Alice Kyteler, the Sorceress of Kilkenny |title=Irish Witchcraft and Demonology |first=St. John D., B.D. |last=Seymour |date=1913 |pages=25–26 |chapter-url=https://archive.org/stream/irishwitchcraftd00seymrich#page/24/mode/2up |location=Dublin |publisher=Hodges, Figgs}}</ref>
===Israel=== *[[Yahya Farhan]]: [[Bedouin]] serial killer, who murdered between two and four people from 1994 to 2004, including [[Murder of Dana Bennett|Dana Bennett]]; sentenced to three consecutive life sentences, and later acquitted of one murder.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.mako.co.il/news-law/legal/Article-cec7b38cde5f921004.htm |title=See: Farhan reconstructs Bennett's murder |first=Yossi |last=Mizrahi |date=July 21, 2010 |website=Mako |language=he |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Nicolai Bonner]]: killed four people in 2005 in [[Haifa]], three of them homeless; sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.haaretz.com/news/homeless-man-found-guilty-of-haifa-serial-murders-1.204551 |title=Homeless Man Found Guilty of Haifa Serial Murders |date=2006-11-07 |newspaper=[[Haaretz]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===Italy=== *[[Wolfgang Abel and Marco Furlan]]: German-Italian duo found guilty of ten of 27 counts of murder in 1987. *[[Beasts of Satan]]: Satanic cult members who committed three notorious ritual murders from 1998 to 2004.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/programmes/this_world/4446342.stm |title=Investigating the 'death metal' murders |last=Bagnall |first=Sam |date=23 November 2005 |website=BBC News |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Marco Bergamo (serial killer)|Marco Bergamo]]: also known as the "Monster of [[Bolzano]]"; murdered five women in Bolzano from 1985 to 1992; died from a lung infection in 2017.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.corriere.it/cronache/17_ottobre_17/morto-margo-bergamo-mostro-bolzano-che-aveva-ucciso-5-donne-8368d79c-b35d-11e7-9cef-7c546dada489.shtml |title=Morto Marco Bergamo, il "mostro di Bolzano" che aveva ucciso 5 donne |trans-title=Marco Bergamo, the "Monster of Bolzano" who had killed 5 women, is dead |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=17 October 2017 |newspaper=[[Corriere della Sera]] |language=it |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Donato Bilancia]]: also known as the "Monster of [[Liguria]]" murdered seventeen people in seven months between 1997 and 1998.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.occhirossi.it/biografie/DonatoBilancia.htm |title=Donato Bilancia |last=Del Frate |first=Daniele |date=31 October 2004 |website=Occhi Rossi |language=it |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Antonio Boggia]]: also known as the "Monster of Milan"; first documented Italian serial killer; murdered four people for monetary purposes between 1849 and 1859; hanged 1862.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.ilgiornale.it/news/cultura/storia-primo-serial-killer-italiano-944632.html |title=Storia del primo serial killer italiano |trans-title=History of the first Italian serial killer |first=Luca |last=Crovi |date=22 August 2013 |newspaper=[[Il Giornale]] |language=it |accessdate=1 June 2017}}</ref> *[[Ralph Brydges]]: also known as the "Monster of [[Rome]]"; English pastor who is widely believed to have murdered five girls in Rome in the 1920s, and four in other countries; never convicted of his crimes.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.ilgiornale.it/news/genova/mostro-e-commissario-che-bracc-fino-genova.html |title=Il mostro e il commissario che lo braccò fino a Genova |trans-title=The monster and the commissioner who chased him to Genoa |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=9 May 2012 |newspaper=Il Giornale |language=it |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Sonya Caleffi]]: nurse who poisoned terminally ill patients between 2003 and 2004, killing 5 of them; sentenced to 20 years of imprisonment.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.ildue.it/Notizie/SVittore/Dettaglio.asp?ID=537 |title=Sonya Caleffi a 'Grazia': 'Non sono un'assassina' |trans-title=Sonya Caleffi to 'Grazia': 'I am not a murderer' |date=28 March 2006 |website=IlDue.it |language=it |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080514001944/http://www.ildue.it/Notizie/SVittore/Dettaglio.asp?ID=537 |archive-date=May 14, 2008}}</ref> *[[Luigi Chiatti]]: also known as the "Monster of [[Foligno]]"; kidnapped and killed two children in 1992 and 1993; sentenced to two life sentences, but he was found unfit to stand trial and was reduced to 30 years in a mental hospital.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.umbria24.it/cronaca/lavvocato-bacino-%c2%abchiatti-non-e-uscito-dal-carcere-ne-ha-mai-chiesto-la-semiliberta%c2%bb |title=Luigi Chiatti non è uscito dal carcere né ha mai chiesto la semilibertà |trans-title=Luigi Chiatti was not released from prison and has never asked for parole |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=18 November 2010 |website=Umbria24 |language=it |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Leonarda Cianciulli]]: also known as the "Soap-Maker of [[Correggio]]"; murderer of three women between 1939 and 1940; died in a women's criminal asylum in 1970.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.museocriminologico.it/correggio_uk.htm |title=The Correggio soap-maker |website=Museo Criminologico |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060912155116/http://www.museocriminologico.it/correggio_uk.htm |archivedate=2006-09-12}}</ref> *[[Ferdinand Gamper]]: also known as the "Monster of [[Merano]]"; killed six people in 1996.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.italiacriminale.it/ferdinand-gamper-il-mostro-di-merano/ |title=Ferdinand Gamper: the monster Merano |website=Italia Criminale |language=it |access-date=17 March 2016 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160330223112/http://www.italiacriminale.it/ferdinand-gamper-il-mostro-di-merano/ |archive-date=2016-03-30}}</ref> *[[Pier Paolo Brega Massone]]: murdered at least four people in [[Milan]] and maimed other dozens of victims through unnecessary surgeries to illegally obtain a large amounts of money refunds; convicted and given a life sentence.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://milano.corriere.it/notizie/cronaca/14_aprile_09/clinica-orrori-condanna-all-ergastolo-brega-massone-80c798e6-c006-11e3-a6b2-109f6a781e55.shtml |title=Clinica degli orrori: Ergastolo per Brega Massone, arresto in aula |trans-title=Clinic of horrors: life imprisonment for Brega Massone, arrest in court |date=2014-04-09 |newspaper=[[Corriere della Sera]] |language=it |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Andrea Matteucci]]: also known as the "Monster of [[Aosta]]"; murdered a merchant and three prostitutes in Aosta from 1980 to 1995; sentenced to 28 years imprisonment and three years in a mental institution.<ref>{{Cite magazine |url=https://www.gqitalia.it/underground/2015/06/05/andrea-matteucci-il-mostro-di-aosta/ |title=L'inquietante parabola di Andrea Matteucci, il mostro di Aosta |trans-title=The disturbing parable of Andrea Matteucci, the monster of Aosta |first=Edoardo |last=Montolli |date=5 June 2015 |magazine=[[GQ|GQ Italia]] |language=it |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Maurizio Minghella]]: killed five women in his hometown of [[Genoa]] in 1978; imprisoned and released, after which he murdered at least four more and is suspected of other murders between 1997 and 2001; sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.lastampa.it/Torino/cmsSezioni/cronaca/200810articoli/8420girata.asp |title=Il pugile schizofrenico che strangola e dimentica; Diciotto anni di prigione Liberato, torna a uccidere |trans-title=The schizophrenic boxer who strangles and forgets; freed after eighteen years in prison to kill again |first=Massimo |last=Numa |date=22 October 2008 |newspaper=[[La Stampa]] |language=it |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20081022213240/http://www.lastampa.it/Torino/cmsSezioni/cronaca/200810articoli/8420girata.asp |archive-date=22 October 2008}}</ref> *[[Giorgio Orsolano]]: also known as the "Hyena of [[San Giorgio Canavese|San Giorgio]]"; raped, killed and dismembered three girls from 1834 to 1835 in his hometown of San Giorgio Canavese; executed 1835.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.torinoscienza.it/anatomia/le_collezioni/aprieed6eed6.html?obj_id=2375 |title=Death mask of Giorgio Orsolano |access-date=2018-11-24 |website=Torino Museo di Anatomia |language=it |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150210191624/http://www.torinoscienza.it/anatomia/le_collezioni/aprieed6eed6.html?obj_id=2375 |archivedate=2015-02-10}}</ref> *[[Ernesto Picchioni]]: also known as "The Monster of [[Nerola]]"; murdered people around his home; died of cardiac arrest in 1967.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://murderpedia.org/male.P/p/picchioni-ernesto.htm |title=Ernesto Picchioni A.K.A.: "The Monster of Nerola" |first=Juan Ignacio |last=Blanco |website=Murderpedia |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Milena Quaglini]]: murdered her husband and two men who tried to rape her from 1995 to 1999; committed suicide while imprisoned in 2001.<ref name=Milena>{{Cite web |url=http://www.misteriditalia.it/cn/?page_id=5150 |title=1995-1998: Milena Quaglini, La Donna Che Uccideva gli Uomini Violenti |trans-title=Milena Quaglini, The Woman Who Killed Violent Men |website=Misteri d'Italia |language=it |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Gianfranco Stevanin]]: also known as the "Monster of [[Terrazzo]]"; raped and murdered prostitutes after violent sex games between 1993 and 1994; violated the corpse of one victim; sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://ricerca.repubblica.it/repubblica/archivio/repubblica/1996/08/25/sono-morte-dopo-un-gioco-di.html |title=Sono Morte Dopo Un Gioco Di Sesso Estremo ... |trans-title=I Died After An Extreme Sex Game ... |date=1996-08-25 |newspaper=[[la Repubblica]] |language=it |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Roberto Succo]]: murdered at least five people, including his parents, committed suicide while in prison in 1988.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/films/features/c-dric-kahn-inside-the-mind-of-a-killer-178982.html |title=Cédric Kahn: Inside the mind of a killer |last=Romney |first=Jonathan |date=2 June 2002 |newspaper=The Independent |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Giulia Tofana]]: leader of a group of female poisoners in the 17th century; died in her bed, never been arrested.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://mikedashhistory.com/2015/04/06/aqua-tofana-slow-poisoning-and-husband-killing-in-17th-century-italy/ |title=Aqua Tofana: Slow-Poisoning and Husband-Killing in 17th Century Italy |first=Mike |last=Dash |date=6 April 2015 |website=A Blast From the Past |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Giorgio Vizzardelli]]: shot and killed five people around [[Sarzana]] from 1937 to 1939; sentenced to life imprisonment; committed suicide by slitting his throat with a kitchen knife in 1973.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.ilgiornale.it/news/genova/mostro-sarzana-80-anni-906542.html |title=Il mostro di Sarzana 80 anni dopo |trans-title=The monster of Sarzana 80 years later |date=14 April 2013 |newspaper=[[Il Giornale]] |language=it |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===Jamaica=== *[[Lewis Hutchinson]]: Scottish immigrant convicted of shooting dozens of people in the 18th century; executed in 1773.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.jamaica-gleaner.com/pages/history/story0036.htm |title=Pieces of the Past – Lewis Hutchinson: The Mad Master |last=Tortello |first=Rebecca |date=6 November 2002 |newspaper=[[The Gleaner (newspaper)|Jamaica Gleaner]] |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20150127042527/http://jamaica-gleaner.com/pages/history/story0036.htm |archivedate=27 January 2015}}</ref>
===Japan=== *[[Ryuun Daimai]]: also known as the "Nun Slayer"; former monk who raped and killed at least five people in several cities between 1905 and 1915; executed 1916.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www5b.biglobe.ne.jp/~madison/murder/text_japan/ryuun.html|title=Daimai Ryuun|last=|first=|date=|website=|access-date=December 25, 2011}}</ref> *[[Sachiko Eto]]: also known as the "Drumstick Killer"; cult leader who murdered six of her followers with [[Taiko]] sticks from 1994 to 1995; executed 2012.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.kahoku.co.jp/tohokunews/201904/20190414_13031.html|title=<Retrospective of the Heisei Era> (6) Sukagawa Prayer Murders (7 years)|last=|first=|date=April 14, 2019|work=[[Kahoku Shimpō]]|access-date=2019-04-16|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20190416041418/https://www.kahoku.co.jp/tohokunews/201904/20190414_13031.html|archive-date=16 April 2019|publisher=}}</ref> *[[Satarō Fukiage]]: raped and killed at least seven girls in the early 20th century; executed 1926.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www8.ocn.ne.jp/~moonston/child.htm |title=Child Killers: 吹上佐太郎 |website=Monsters |language=ja |accessdate=2007-11-04 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071117231639/http://www8.ocn.ne.jp/~moonston/child.htm |archivedate=2007-11-17}}</ref> *[[Sokichi Furuya]]: murdered eight elderly people in several western Japanese cities for more than a month in 1965; suspected of four earlier murders, for two of which an accomplice was executed; executed 1985.<ref>[[Asahi Shimbun]] (June 1, 1985) Tokyo morning newspaper, p. 23 "Robbery murderer, execution of Furuya at Osaka Detention Center"</ref> *[[Hiroaki Hidaka]]: killed four prostitutes in [[Hiroshima]] in 1996; executed 25 December 2006.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2007/02/09/news/lawyer-to-sue-after-prison-bars-meeting-before-inmate-is-executed/ |title=Lawyer to sue after prison bars meeting before inmate is executed |date=2007-02-09 |newspaper=[[The Japan Times]] |accessdate=2008-02-23}}</ref> *[[Miyuki Ishikawa]]: [[midwife]] who murdered an estimated 103 infants, but could have been up to 169, in the 1940s.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://homepage3.nifty.com/koseki-t/yougo2.html |script-title=ja:養護施設の子どもたち・・・・・・児童と福祉に関連するできごと |first=Takashi |last=Koseki |website=Koseki-t |language=ja |accessdate=2008-02-24 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20070211225216/http://homepage3.nifty.com/koseki-t/yougo2.html |archivedate=February 11, 2007}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://homepage2.nifty.com/kousinren/nenhyo/nenpyo4/1948.htm |title=15 March 1948 |website=Kousinren |language=ja |accessdate=2008-02-24 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://archive.today/20120713061748/http://homepage2.nifty.com/kousinren/nenhyo/nenpyo4/1948.htm |archive-date=2012-07-13}}</ref> *[[Chisako Kakehi]]: poisoned her husband and two other men to death, attempted to kill a fourth man, and is a suspect in another seven deaths; sentenced to death in 2017.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.news.com.au/world/asia/japans-black-widow-given-death-penalty-for-murders/news-story/a2c64e7c3f304991462bed828274a8f7 |title=Japan's 'Black Widow' given death penalty for murders |last=Palin |first=Megan |date=7 November 2017 |website=[[News.com.au]] |access-date=11 November 2017}}</ref> *[[Kiyotaka Katsuta]]: [[firefighter]] who shot and strangled at least eight people, some during robberies, between 1972 and 1982.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2000/12/01/national/serial-killer-two-other-murderers-hanged/ |title=Serial killer, two other murderers hanged |date=December 1, 2000 |newspaper=The Japan Times |accessdate=2008-03-01}}</ref> *[[Kanae Kijima]]: also known as "The Konkatsu Killer"; marriage fraudster who poisoned between three and seven men for money, from 2007 to 2009; sentenced to death.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www3.nhk.or.jp/news/html/20170414/k10010948561000.html|title=Kanae Kijima, accused of killing three men in staged accidents, on death row|last=|first=|date=April 14, 2017|work=NHK|access-date=April 15, 2017|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170415103815/http://www3.nhk.or.jp/news/html/20170414/k10010948561000.html|archive-date=15 April 2017|publisher=[[NHK]]}}</ref> *[[Yoshio Kodaira]]: rapist thought to have killed eleven people in Japan and China as a soldier; executed on 5 October 1949.<ref>{{cite magazine |url=http://www.time.com/time/magazine/article/0,9171,853940-2,00.html |title=Peace, It's Wonderful |date=1949-10-17 |magazine=TIME |accessdate=2008-02-09}}</ref> *[[Genzo Kurita]]: killed six women and two children and engaged in rape and [[necrophilia]]; executed on 16 January 1959.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://kokkai.ndl.go.jp/SENTAKU/sangiin/024/0640/02405100640002c.html |title=第024回国会 法務委員会公聴会 第2号 |trans-title=The 24th Diet Legal Committee Hearing No.2 |date=1956-05-10 |website=[[National Diet Library]] |language=ja |accessdate=2008-01-09 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171023230218/http://kokkai.ndl.go.jp/SENTAKU/sangiin/024/0640/02405100640002c.html |archive-date=23 October 2017 |url-status=dead }}</ref> *[[Hiroshi Maeue]]: also known as "Suicide Website Murderer"; [[Osaka]] man who lured people from suicide clubs promising to kill himself with his victims.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2007/03/29/national/man-gets-death-for-murdering-suicidal-trio/ |title=Man gets death for murdering suicidal trio |date=2007-03-29 |newspaper=The Japan Times |accessdate=2008-02-23}}</ref> *[[Futoshi Matsunaga]] and [[Junko Ogata]]: also known as "House of Horror"; tortured and killed at least seven people between 1996 and 1998, including Ogata's family.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.japantimes.co.jp/weekly/news/nn2005/nn20050312a5.htm |title=Pair accused of slaying 7 face gallows |date=2005-03-03 |newspaper=The Japan Times Weekly |accessdate=2008-02-10 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://archive.today/20121227215212/search.japantimes.co.jp/cgi-bin/nn20050303a1.html |archive-date=27 December 2012}}</ref> *[[Tsutomu Miyazaki]]: also known as "The [[Otaku]] Murderer", "The Little Girl Murderer" and "Dracula"; killed four pre-school-age girls and ate the hand of a victim; executed in 2008.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.yomiuri.co.jp/dy/national/20080618TDY02306.htm |title=Miyazaki unrepentant to the last / Serial child killer goes to execution without apologizing or explaining his thinking |date=2008-06-18 |newspaper=[[Yomiuri Shimbun]] |location=Tokyo |accessdate=2008-06-18 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://archive.today/20080621044230/http://www.yomiuri.co.jp/dy/national/20080618TDY02306.htm |archivedate=2008-06-21}}</ref> *[[Seisaku Nakamura]]: also known as the "[[Hamamatsu]] Deaf Killer", murdered at least nine people; executed in 1943.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://kangaeru.s59.xrea.com/senzen.htm |first=Eruo |last=Kanga |script-title=ja:戦前の少年犯罪 |website=Juvenile crime database |language=ja |accessdate=2007-11-22}}</ref> *[[Akira Nishiguchi]]: killed five people and engaged in fraud; executed on 11 December 1970.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.alpha-net.ne.jp/users2/knight9/nisiguti.htm |script-title=ja:西口彰連続強盗殺人事件 |website=無限回廊 |language=ja |accessdate=2007-11-22 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071201122525/http://www.alpha-net.ne.jp/users2/knight9/nisiguti.htm |archivedate=2007-12-01}}</ref> *[[Kiyoshi Ōkubo]]: also known as "Tanigawa Ivan"; raped and murdered eight young women over a period of 41 days in 1971. *[[Miyuki Ueta]]: former snack hostess who murdered between two and six men she dated in [[Tottori (city)|Tottori]], from 2004 to 2009; sentenced to death.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.sankei.com/affairs/news/170826/afr1708260002-n1.html|title=Tottori Consecutive Suspicious Deaths Case: former snack hostess, defandant Ueta on death row|last=|first=|date=August 26, 2017|work=Sankei Shimbun|access-date=September 26, 2017|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170926113636/http://www.sankei.com/affairs/news/170826/afr1708260002-n1.html|archive-date=September 26, 2017|publisher=Sankei Shimbun}}</ref> *[[Yukio Yamaji]]: murdered his own mother in 2000, and then murdered a 27-year-old woman and her 19-year-old sister in 2005.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.japantimes.co.jp/news/2006/12/14/national/man-to-hang-for-sisters-murders/ |title=Man to hang for sisters' murders |date=14 December 2006 |newspaper=The Japan Times |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===Kazakhstan=== *[[Nikolai Dzhumagaliev]]: also known as "Metal Fang"; raped and hacked seven women to death with an axe in [[Almaty]] in 1980, then cannibalised them using his unusual false teeth.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.trutv.com/library/crime/blog/2012/05/17/modern-cannibalism-six-killers-with-a-taste-for-human-flesh/index.html |title=Modern cannibalism: Six killers with a taste for human flesh |first=Michael |last=Washburn |date=2012-05-17 |website=TruTV.com |accessdate=2014-01-18 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120626165904/http://www.trutv.com/library/crime/blog/2012/05/17/modern-cannibalism-six-killers-with-a-taste-for-human-flesh/index.html |archive-date=26 June 2012}}</ref> *[[Yuri Ivanov (serial killer)|Yuri Ivanov]]: also known as the "Ust-Kamenogorsk Maniac"; raped and killed sixteen girls and young women who spoke badly of men in [[Ust-Kamenogorsk]] from 1974 to 1987; executed 1987.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://meta.kz/novosti/kazakhstan/814276-gromkie-prestupleniya-sovetskogo-vremeni-ust-kamenogorskiy-manyak.html |title=Громкие преступления советского времени: Усть-каменогорский маньяк |trans-title=High-profile crimes of the Soviet era: Ust-Kamenogorsk maniac |date=29 July 2013 |website=Novosti Kazakhstana |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Ivan Mandzhikov]]: also known as the "Kazgugrad Monster"; raped and strangled four female students and one man in the vicinity of the [[Al-Farabi Kazakh National University|KazGU University]] between 1988 and 1989; executed 1993.<ref>{{Citeweb|url=https://www.caravan.kz/gazeta/uzhas-nad-kazgu-kak-ubivali-studentok-88018/|title=The horror over KazGU: how students were killed|author=Oleg Gubaydulin|publisher=Caravan.kz|date=February 28, 2010|language=Russian}}</ref>
===Latvia=== *[[Ansis Kaupēns]]: army deserter who committed 30 robberies and 19 murders from 1920 to 1926; executed 1927 in [[Vircava Parish]].<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.vietas.lv/index.php?p=10&id=481 |title=Ansis Kaupēns (1895-1927) |first=Zemgales |last=Ziņas |date=11 November 2005 |website=Vietas.lv |language=lv |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180823042154/http://www.vietas.lv/index.php?p=10&id=481 |archive-date=2018-08-23}}</ref> *[[Kaspars Petrovs]]: convicted of murdering thirteen elderly [[Riga]] women in 2005; confessed to killing 38.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://newsfromrussia.com/hotspots/2005/05/12/59725.html |title=Latvian serial killer sentenced to life in prison for 13 murders |date=2005-05-12 |website=[[Pravda.ru]] |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060327205411/http://newsfromrussia.com/hotspots/2005/05/12/59725.html |archivedate=March 27, 2006}}</ref> *[[Stanislav Rogolev]]: also known as "Agent 000"; robbed, raped and killed ten women from 1980 to 1982; suspected of having inside information for the investigation on him; executed 1984.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.kriminal.lv/news/retrodetektiv-delo-rogaleva-manyyak-byl-lichnym-agentom-generala-kavalierisa |title=Ретродетектив. Дело Рогалева: маньяк был личным агентом генерала Кавалиериса |trans-title=Retrodetective. The case of Rogalev: the maniac was a personal agent of General Cavalieris |first=Игорь |last=Ищук |date=13 May 2010 |website=Kriminal.lv |language=lv |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===Lebanon=== *[[George and Michel Tanielian]]: also known as the "Taxi Driver Killers"; [[Syria]]n brothers who killed and robbed mostly taxi drivers in the [[Matn District]] from July to November 2011; both sentenced to death.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.lbcgroup.tv/news/d/lebanon-news/10173/beirut-serial-killer-mystery-solved/en |title=Beirut serial killer mystery solved |date=November 15, 2011 |website=Lebanon News |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===Lithuania=== *[[Antanas Varnelis]]: murdered and robbed six pensioners between July and December 1992 around several municipalities; first known serial killer in Lithuania; executed 1994.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.delfi.lt/news/daily/lithuania/ivykiai-sukrete-lietuva-a-varnelio-istorija-danu-tv-pranese-lietuvoje-psichopatai-saudomi-teismo-nuosprendziu.d?id=34684635|title="Events that shocked Lithuania" The Story of A. Varnelis. Danish TV reported: Lithuanian psychopath executed|last=Knispeliu|first=Egidijumi|date=July 21, 2010|website=DELFI|access-date=November 27, 2019}}</ref>
===Malta=== *[[Silvio Mangion]]: only known serial killer in Malta; murdered three elderly pensioners during robberies between 1984 and 1998; sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.independent.com.mt/articles/2012-07-04/local-news/Man-On-trial-for-third-murder:-Mangion-made-%E2%80%98serial-killer%E2%80%99-joke-about-his-tattoos-312479|title=Man On trial for third murder: Mangion made 'serial killer' joke about his tattoos|publisher=[[The Malta Independent]]|date=July 4, 2012}}</ref>
===Mexico=== *[[Macario Alcala Canchola]]: also known as "Jack Mexicano" ("Mexican Jack"), was a [[Jack the Ripper]] copycat active in the 1960s.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://enciclopediadelosasesinosenserie.blogspot.mx/2010/02/macario-alcala-canchola-jack-el.html |title=Macario Alcala Canchola. "Jack el Mexicano" (México) |trans-title=Macario Alcala Canchola. "Mexican Jack" (Mexico) |last1=Rivera |first1=Horacio B. |date=February 10, 2010 |website=Enciclopedia de los Asesinos en serie |language=es |accessdate=April 24, 2014}}</ref> *[[Sara Aldrete]]: also known as "La Madrina"; cult follower of Adolfo Constanzo; convicted in 1994 of murdering several individuals during her association with Constanzo.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=950DEEDA103AF93BA35756C0A96F948260 |title=Leader in Cult Slayings Ordered Own Death, Two Companions Say |date=May 8, 1989 |newspaper=[[The New York Times]] |quote=The leader of a drug-smuggling cult that is believed to have killed fifteen people and buried their bodies along the United States-Mexican border ordered his own killing when the police closed in on him, two of his companions said today. |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[David Avendaño Ballina]]: also known as "The Hamburger"; alleged leader of a sex servant gang who robbed and poisoned their clients from 1997 to 2007; arrested in 2008.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.oem.com.mx/esto/notas/n592543.htm |title=Cayó El Hamburguesa, líder de la banda de "Las Goteras" |trans-title=The fall of 'El Hamburguesa', leader of the band of "Las Goteras" |first=Manuel |last=Olmos |date=13 February 2008 |website=[[Organización Editorial Mexicana]] |language=es |accessdate=18 August 2012 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160305022326/http://www.oem.com.mx/esto/notas/n592543.htm |archive-date=5 March 2016}}</ref> *[[Juana Barraza]]: also known as "Mataviejitas" ("Old Lady Killer"); operated within the metropolitan area of [[Mexico City]] until 25 January 2006.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/americas/7323821.stm |title=Life for Mexico's Old Lady Killer |date=2008-04-01 |website=BBC News |accessdate=2009-03-31}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/latestCrisis/idUKN3122188820080401 |title=Mexico's "Little Old Lady Killer" gets life term |date=2008-04-01 |website=[[Reuters]] |accessdate=2009-03-31}}</ref> *[[José Luis Calva]]: cannibal; police found the remains of multiple female victims in his house; committed suicide on 11 December 2007.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://edition.cnn.com/2007/WORLD/americas/12/11/mexico.suicide.ap/ |title='Cannibal' killer commits suicide |date=11 December 2007 |website=[[CNN]] |accessdate=2007-12-23 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20071215011523/http://edition.cnn.com/2007/WORLD/americas/12/11/mexico.suicide.ap/ |archivedate=2007-12-15}}</ref> *[[Gregorio Cárdenas Hernández]]: known as "the Strangler of Tacuba"; strangled four women in the [[Tacuba (Mexico)|Tacuba]] neighbourhood in 1942; died in 1999 of natural causes.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.eluniversal.com.mx/articulo/english/2016/11/16/el-goyo-cardenas-one-mexicos-most-infamous-serial-killers |title=El Goyo Cárdenas, one of Mexico's most infamous serial killers |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=16 November 2016 |newspaper=[[El Universal (Mexico City)|El Universal]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Andrés Ulises Castillo Villarreal]]: known as the "Chihuahua Ripper"; drugged, raped, killed and mutilated three men in [[Chihuahua (state)|Chihuahua]] in 2015; confessed to twelve more murders, but suspected of twenty overall; sentenced to 120 years imprisonment.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.milenio.com/opinion/jose-luis-duran-king/vidas-ejemplares/el-descuartizador-de-chihuahua |title=El Descuartizador de Chihuahua |trans-title=The Chihuahua Ripper |last=Durán King |first=José Luis |date=9 January 2016 |newspaper=[[Milenio]] |language=es |access-date=1 December 2018}}</ref> *[[The Ciudad Juárez Rebels]]: gang of serial killers who killed women in Ciudad Juárez from 1995 to 1996; convicted of eight murders, suspected of killing from ten to 14; claimed to have worked for Abdul Latif Sharif.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://asesinosenseriebios.blogspot.mx/2009/09/el-depredador-de-ciudad-juarez-mexico.html |title=El Depredador De Ciudad Juárez |trans-title=The Predator of Ciudad Juárez |last=Rivera |first=Horacio B. |date=29 September 2009 |website=Encyclopedia of serial killers |accessdate=4 January 2013 |quote=... the detainees were: Sergio Armendariz Diaz "El Diablo", Jose Luis Rosales, Fernando Germes Aguirre, Juan Jose Contreras Jurado, Gerardo Fernandez Molina, Carlos Hernandez Molina Mariscal, Carlos Barrientos Vidales, Hector Raymundo Olivares, Romel Omar Ceniceros Garcia and Ericka Fierro, the majority were released due to lack of incriminating evidence ...}}</ref> *[[Adolfo Constanzo]]: also known as "The Godfather of Matamoros"; serial killer and cult leader in Mexico; committed suicide in 1989.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://query.nytimes.com/gst/fullpage.html?res=950DE0D71F3FF930A25757C0A96F948260 |title=Drugs, Death and the Occult Meet In Grisly Inquiry at Mexico Border |first=Peter |last=Applebome |date=April 13, 1989 |newspaper=[[The New York Times]] |accessdate=2008-07-28}}</ref> *[[Feminicides of the cotton field|Edgar Álvarez Cruz and Francisco Granados]]: responsible for the so-called "Feminicides of the cotton field"; Cruz, with the help of the drugged Granados, kidnapped, raped, tortured and killed at least 8-10 young women in satanic rituals between 1993 and 2003; suspected of committing a total of fourteen murders.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.oem.com.mx/esto/notas/n911023.htm |title=Vinculan feminicidios con actos satánicos |trans-title=They link feminicides with satanic acts |first=Adrián |last=Sánchez |website=Organización Editorial Mexicana |language=es |accessdate=23 February 2013 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141216214811/http://www.oem.com.mx/esto/notas/n911023.htm |archive-date=December 16, 2014}}</ref> *[[Pedro Padilla Flores]]: also known as "El Asesino de Rio Bravo"; killed three women in 1986; escaped to the US but was deported back to Mexico; suspect in the Ciudad Juárez murders.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://asesinosenseriebios.blogspot.mx/2011/02/pedro-padilla-flores-el-asesino-del-rio.html |title=Pedro Padilla Flores "El Asesino del Río Bravo" (México) |first=Horacio B. |last=Rivera |date=3 February 2011 |website=Enciclopedia de los asesinos en serie |language=es |access-date=15 May 2012}}</ref> *[[Gabriel Garza Hoth]]: also known as "The Black Widower"; killed three women in Mexico City between 1991 and 1998, his victims were wives and lovers.<ref>{{cite book |url=https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofse0000newt |url-access=registration |page=[https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofse0000newt/page/346 346] |quote=gabriel garza hoth. |title=The Encyclopedia of Serial Killers |last=Newton |first=Michael |date=February 2006 |location=New York |publisher=Facts On File, Inc. |isbn=0-8160-6195-5 |accessdate=November 2, 2013}}</ref> *[[Delfina and María de Jesús González]]: also known as "Las Poquianchis"; killed a total of 91 in [[Guanajuato]]; arrested and sentenced to 40 years in prison in 1964.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.guinnessworldrecords.com/world-records/most-prolific-murder-partnership |title=Most prolific murder partnership |website=[[Guinness World Records]] |accessdate=9 April 2018}}</ref> *[[Francisco Guerrero Pérez]]: also known as "El Chalequero" ("The man of the vests"); the first documented serial killer in Mexico; committed approximately twenty murders in Mexico City between 1880 and 1888 plus one more in 1908.<ref>{{cite book |title=The Sausage Rebellion: Public Health, Private Enterprise, and Meat in Mexico City, 1890–1917 |first=Jeffrey M. |last=Pilcher |chapter=2. The Porfirian Jungle |chapter-url=https://books.google.com/books?id=GHgF0Xz2fcYC&pg=PA63&dq=francisco+guerrero+chalequero#v=onepage&q=francisco%20guerrero%20chalequero |year=2006 |edition=1st |publisher=University of New Mexico Press |location=Albuquerque, New Mexico |pages=62–65 |isbn=978-0-8263-3796-2 |accessdate=2012-07-20}}</ref><ref>{{cite book |title=Libro Rojo, Vol. 1 |last=Viñas |first=Gerardo Villadelángel |chapter=13. El Chalequero |chapter-url=https://books.google.com/books?id=hTkS8dDnorQC&pg=PA129&dq=francisco+guerrero+el+chalequero#v=onepage&q=francisco%20guerrero%20el%20chalequero |language=es |edition=1st |year=1888 |publisher=Fondo de Cultura Económica |location=Mexico City, Mexico |pages=128–145 |isbn=9681686152 |accessdate=2012-07-20}}</ref> *[[Fernando Hernández Leyva]]: convicted of 33 murders in 1986, suspected of 137 killings.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.crimezzz.net/serialkillers/L/LEYVA_fernando_hernandez.php |title=Fernando Hernández Leyva |last=Wetsch |first=Elisabeth |website=Serial Killer Crime Index |accessdate=24 February 2013 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150923211212/http://www.crimezzz.net/serialkillers/L/LEYVA_fernando_hernandez.php |archive-date=23 September 2015 }}</ref> *[[Monsters of Ecatepec|Juan Carlos Hernández and Patricia Martínez]]: pair from [[Ecatepec]], [[State of Mexico]], known as "The Monsters of Ecatepec", who raped, murdered and cannibalized between ten and twenty women. Active between 2012 and 2018.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://mexiconewsdaily.com/news/killers-confess-to-eating-remains/ |title=Serial killers of Ecatepec confess to eating the remains of their victims |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=10 October 2018 |website=Mexico News Daily |access-date=19 October 2018}}</ref> *[[Luis Oscar Jiménez Herrera]]: also known as "The Tinaco Killer"; murdered sixteen women in Nuevo León between 2013 and 2016, but also suspected of a 2010 murder in San Luis Potosí; sentenced to 123 years imprisonment.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://elmanana.com.mx/noticia/162970/Dan-123-aos-por-homicidios-y-secuestros.html |title=Dan 123 años por homicidios y secuestros |trans-title=Given 123 years for homicides and kidnappings |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=March 10, 2018 |newspaper=[[El Mañana (Nuevo Laredo)|El Mañana]] |location=[[Nuevo Laredo]] |language=es |access-date=August 5, 2019}}</ref> *[[César Armando Librado Legorreta]]: also known as "El Coqueto"; raped and killed six women in the [[Greater Mexico City]] between 2011 and 2012; sentenced to 240 years in prison.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://portal2.edomex.gob.mx/pgjem/seguridad_delicuencia/buscados/prioridad1/groups/public/documents/edomex_archivo/pgjem_pdf_media_librado_l.pdf |title=César Armando Librado Legorreta alias "El Coqueto" |date=2012 |website=Procuraduría General de Justicia del Estado de México |language=es |access-date=3 March 2012 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131022001612/http://portal2.edomex.gob.mx/pgjem/seguridad_delicuencia/buscados/prioridad1/groups/public/documents/edomex_archivo/pgjem_pdf_media_librado_l.pdf |archive-date=22 October 2013}}</ref> *[[Los Huipas]]: gang of four indigenous homosexual men, led by Eusebio Yocupicio Soto, who murdered seven men who made fun of them between 1949 and 1950; initially sentenced to death, later commuted to 30 years imprisonment.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.elgrafico.mx/especiales/asesinos-seriales/11-03-2016/huipas-desollaron-siete-por-burlas-homofobicas|title=Huipas: seven were skinned for homophobic ridicule|last=|first=|date=|website=www.elgrafico.mx|language=es|access-date=March 25, 2020}}</ref> *[[Rudolfo Infante and Anna Villeda]]: couple from [[Matamoros, Tamaulipas|Matamoros]] responsible for the murders of eight women. Apprehended in 1991.<ref>{{cite book |url=https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofse0000newt |url-access=registration |page=[https://archive.org/details/encyclopediaofse0000newt/page/447 447] |quote=the encyclopedia of serial killers villeda. |title=The Encyclopedia of Serial Killers |last=Newton |first=Michael |date=February 2006 |location=New York, USA |publisher=Facts On File, Inc. |isbn=0-8160-6195-5 |accessdate=2013-11-24}}</ref> *[[Abdul Latif Sharif]]: also known as "The Ciudad Juárez Predator"; Egyptian man responsible for murdering an unknown number of women in [[Ciudad Juárez]],<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.trutv.com/library/crime/serial_killers/predators/ciudad_juarez/4.html |title=Ciudad Juarez:The Serial Killer's Playground |first=Michael |last=Newton |website=TruTV.com |page=4 |accessdate=2012-07-22 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120505045358/http://www.trutv.com/library/crime/serial_killers/predators/ciudad_juarez/4.html |archive-date=2012-05-05}}</ref> possibly as many as fifteen but convicted of only one; died in prison. *[[Daniel Audiel López Martínez]]: killed five women in Ciudad Juárez between 2007 and 2010.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.excelsior.com.mx/node/700670 |title=Detienen a asesino serial de mujeres de Ciudad Juarez |trans-title=Serial killer of women captured in Ciudad Juarez |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=January 3, 2011 |website=Excelsior |language=es |accessdate=June 6, 2014}}</ref> *[[Raúl Osiel Marroquín]]: also known as "El Gato Imperial"; killed four gay men in Mexico City.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.pgr.gob.mx/cmsocial/coms06/260106.htm |title=Conferencia de Prensa que ofreció Genaro García Luna, titular de la Agencia Federal de Investigación para anunciar la detención del presunto asesino serial y secuestrador Raúl Marroquín Reyes |trans-title=Press conference held by Genaro García Luna, head of the Federal Investigation Agency, to announce the capture of the serial killer Raúl Marroquín Reyes |date=January 26, 2006 |website=Procuraduría General de Justicia |language=es |accessdate=18 July 2014 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120226070959/http://www.pgr.gob.mx/cmsocial/coms06/260106.htm |archivedate=26 February 2012}}</ref> *[[Filiberto Hernández Martínez]]: killed six people between 2010 and 2013 in [[San Luis Potosí]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.omahasuntimes.com/2014/07/filiberto-hernandez-child-serial-killer-suspect-confesses-to-5-murders-cops/ |title=Filiberto Hernandez, Child Serial Killer Suspect, Confesses To 5 Murders: Cops |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=5 July 2014 |newspaper=Omaha Sun Times |location=[[Omaha, Nebraska]] |accessdate=17 January 2015 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402191055/http://www.omahasuntimes.com/2014/07/filiberto-hernandez-child-serial-killer-suspect-confesses-to-5-murders-cops/ |archive-date=2 April 2015}}</ref> *[[Jorge Humberto Martínez Córtez]]: also known as "El Matanovias"; killed between two and three of his romantic partners from 2011 to 2014; currently awaiting sentencing.<ref>{{cite magazine |url=https://www.proceso.com.mx/508643/interpol-captura-en-guatemala-al-matanovias-la-pgj-cdmx-solicitara-traslado |title=Interpol captura en Guatemala al "Matanovias"; la PGJ-CDMX solicitará su traslado |trans-title=Interpol captures the "Matanovias" in Guatemala; the PGJ-CDMX requests his transfer |date=24 October 2017 |magazine=[[Proceso (magazine)|Proceso]] |language=es |publisher=Comunicación e Información S.A. de C.V |accessdate=2 April 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.eluniversal.com.mx/metropoli/cdmx/entregan-el-matanovias-pgr-en-guatemala |title=Entregan a "El Matanovias" a PGR en Guatemala |trans-title=They deliver "El Matanovias" to PGR in Guatemala |first=José |last=Meléndez |date=15 October 2017 |newspaper=El Universal |language=es |accessdate=2 April 2018}}</ref> *[[Alejandro Máynez]]: may have killed over 50 women with accomplices.<ref>{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=Pr5HAAAAYAAJ&q=alejandro+maynez&dq=alejandro+maynez |title=Cosechja de mujeres: safarí en el desierto mexicano |first=Diana |last=Washington Váldez |publisher=University of Texas |year=2005 |isbn=9706519882 |pages=168–170}}</ref> *[[House of Laments|Tadeo Fulgencío Mejía]]: responsible for several murders during the 1890s and 1900s, motivated by delirious idea of contacting his deceased wife. Now the house in [[Guanajuato]], where he committed the crimes, is known as "The House of Laments" (''Casa de los lamentos''), and according to legend is haunted.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.aztecaamerica.com/notas/extranormal/59060/tragedia-en-casa-de-los-lamentos |title=Tragedia en Casa de los Lamentos |last=Enciso |first=Alejandra |date=2011-06-16 |website=[[TV Azteca]] |language=es |accessdate=2013-11-18}}</ref> *[[Silvia Meraz]]: [[Sonora]] woman involved in an occult sect, killed three persons.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/centralamericaandthecaribbean/mexico/9177633/Children-sacrificed-to-Mexicos-cult-of-Saint-Death.html |title=Children 'sacrificed' to Mexico's cult of Saint Death |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=31 March 2012 |newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |accessdate=17 April 2014}}</ref> *[[Agustín Salas del Valle]]: also known as "Jack the Strangler"; killed more than twenty women in Mexico City's Central Zone.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://asesinosenseriebios.blogspot.mx/2010/01/agustin-salas-del-valle-el.html |title=Agustín Salas del Valle, "El Estrangulador de mujeres" (México) |first=Horacio B. |last=Rivera |date=19 January 2010 |website=Enciclopedia de los asesinos en serie |language=es |access-date=10 July 2017}}</ref> *[[Felícitas Sánchez Aguillón]]: named "The Ogress of [[Colonia Roma]]" was a nurse, midwife and baby farmer responsible for an unknown number of murders during the 1930s, possibly 50 victims, in [[Mexico City]]<ref>{{cite web |url=http://enciclopediadelosasesinosenserie.blogspot.mx/2010/12/felicitas-sanchez-aguillon-la.html |title=Felícitas Sánchez Agillón. "La Descuartizadora de la Colonia Roma".
