(México) |last1=Rivera |first1=Horacio B. |date=6 December 2010 |website=Enciclopedia de los asesinos en serie |language=es |accessdate=25 December 2013}}</ref> *[[Cristina Soledad Sánchez Esquivel]]: also known as "La Matataxistas"; killed between five and six taxi drivers in [[Nuevo León]] in 2010 with her accomplice Aarón Herrera Hernández; sentenced to 130 years imprisonment.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.info7.mx/seccion/la-matataxistas-actuo-por-venganza-contra-los-hombres/477032 |title=La matataxistas actuó por venganza contra los hombres |trans-title=La Matataxistas acted for revenge against men |first=Badillo |last=Victor |date=2010-06-17 |website=INFO7 |language=es |accessdate=26 October 2018}}</ref> *[[Magdalena Solís]]: religious fanatic, proclaimed "The High Blood's Priestess", killed eight persons in ritual sacrifices<ref name="TrueTv's Crime Library">{{cite web |url=http://www.trutv.com/library/crime/serial_killers/weird/vampires/4.html |title=Crime Library: The Vampire Killers |first=Katherine |last=Ramsland |website=TruTv |access-date=July 21, 2012 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20121014144507/http://www.trutv.com/library/crime/serial_killers/weird/vampires/4.html |archive-date=2012-10-14}}</ref> *[[Mario Alberto Sulú Canché]]: killed three young girls between 2007 and 2008 in [[Mérida, Yucatán]]; later died in prison.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://asesinosenseriebios.blogspot.mx/2010/02/mario-alberto-sulu-canche-el.html |title=Mario Alberto Sulú Canché. El Matachavitas. (México) |trans-title=Mario Alberto Sulú Canché. The Young-Girls-Killer |last1=Rivera |first1=Horacio B. |date=19 February 2010 |website=La enciclopedia de los asesinos en serie |language=es |accessdate=14 May 2014}}</ref>
===Moldova=== *[[Alexander Skrynnik]]: also known as the "Moldavian Chikatilo"; killed and then mutilated three women in [[Chișinău]] and [[Yakutia]] from the mid–1970s to 1980; executed 1981.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://brw.md/moldavskii-maniac-aleksander-skrynnikov/ |title=Почерк преступника 2. Дело Скрынника |trans-title=Handwriting of the criminal 2. The case of Skrynnik |date=October 25, 2017 |website=BRW Журнал |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===Morocco=== *[[Hadj Mohammed Mesfewi]]: also known as the "[[Marrakesh]] Arch-Killer"; drugged and killed 36 women; died 1906.
===Netherlands=== *[[Klaas Annink]]: also known as "Huttenkloas"; robber and murderer from [[Twente]] who killed along with his wife Anna and son Jannes; both he and his wife were executed in 1775.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.molenaarshuis.nl/huttenkloas.htm |title=Huttenkloas |website=Molenaarshuis |language=nl |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20060620072915/http://www.molenaarshuis.nl/huttenkloas.htm |archivedate=June 20, 2006}}</ref> *[[Hendrikje Doelen]]: 19th century farm-wife who poisoned several people in a [[poorhouse]] from 1845 to 1846, killing three of them; died of natural causes in 1847.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.drenlias.nl/index.html?option=com_familias&task=zoeken&bron=na1811&lname1=DOELEN&fname1=HENDRIKJE&header=advanced&plaats=&van=1848&tot=1848&methode=exact&submit.x=21&submit.y=14&submit=Zoeken |title=Hendrikje Doelen |website=Drenlias.nl |access-date=24 November 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180827044030/http://www.drenlias.nl/index.html?option=com_familias&task=zoeken&bron=na1811&lname1=DOELEN&fname1=HENDRIKJE&header=advanced&plaats=&van=1848&tot=1848&methode=exact&submit.x=21&submit.y=14&submit=Zoeken |archive-date=27 August 2018 |url-status=dead }}</ref> *[[Willem van Eijk]]: also known as the "Beast of [[Harkstede]]"; convicted of the murders of five women between 1971 and 2001. *[[Koos Hertogs]]: convicted of the murders of three women between 1979 and 1980. *[[Aalt Mondria]]: escaped mental patient who murdered a family of three in 1978; after release, murdered his girlfriend's son in 1997; died 2011 from untreated [[Hepatitis C]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.destentor.nl/hardenberg/seriemoordenaar-aalt-mondria-overleden~ae72d3fa/ |title=Seriemoordenaar Aalt Mondria overleden |trans-title=Serial killer Aalt Mondria dies |date=28 September 2011 |newspaper=[[De Stentor]] |language=nl |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Gustav Müller (serial killer)|Gustav Müller]]: German watchmaker who murdered his wife and son in [[Rotterdam]] in 1897; surrendered and subsequently confessed to killing his parents and at least fourteen other wives around the world; acquitted by reason of insanity and confined to an asylum.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://chroniclingamerica.loc.gov/lccn/2016270503/1897-11-09/ed-1/seq-6/#date1=1897&sort=date&rows=20&words=Gustav+Muller&searchType=basic&sequence=0&index=12&state=&date2=1898&proxtext=Gustav+Muller&y=19&x=19&dateFilterType=yearRange&page=2 |title=Slew Fourteen Wives |date=November 9, 1897 |newspaper=Waterbury Evening Democrat |access-date=24 November 2019 |via=Chronicling America}}</ref> *[[Patrick Soultana]]: strangled two women in 2010, suspected of three more murders; sentenced to 25 years plus provision in 2014.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.volkskrant.nl/vk/nl/2686/Binnenland/article/detail/3600023/2014/02/19/Patrick-S-bekent-betrokkenheid-bij-moord-op-Farida-Zargar.dhtml |title=Patrick S. bekent betrokkenheid bij moord op Farida Zargar |trans-title=Patrick S. confesses involvement in the murder of Farida Zargar |date=24 March 2017 |newspaper=de Volkskrant |language=nl |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Michel Stockx]]: murdered three children around [[Assen]] in 1991; sentenced to 20 years in prison in 1992; died of severe burns from an incident during his work therapy in 2001.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.misdaadjournalist.nl/rapportages/michelstockxendedodekinderen.html |title=Michel Stockx en de dode kinderen |trans-title=Michel Stockx and the dead children |first=Hendrik Jan |last=Korterink |website=Misdaad Journalist |language=nl |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Maria Swanenburg]]: suspected of killing between 27 and 90 people with [[arsenic]] in [[Leiden]] in the 1880s; died in prison in 1915. *[[Hans van Zon]]: murdered three people from April to August 1967, including a former lover; suspected of several other murders; died 1998 from [[alcohol poisoning]].<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.trouw.nl/nieuws/gentleman-killer-hans-van-z-vast-voor-poging-tot-doodslag-buurman~b84f4d0a/ |title='Gentleman-killer' Hans van Z. vast voor poging tot doodslag buurman |trans-title='Gentleman-killer' Hans van Z. charged with attempted homicide of neighbor |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=12 March 1997 |newspaper=[[Trouw]] |language=nl |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===New Zealand=== *[[Robert Butler (criminal)|Robert Butler]]: Irish highwayman who allegedly killed a family of three in [[Dunedin]] in 1880; acquitted, but was later hanged for shooting a man in Australia.<ref>{{DNZB |title=Robert Butler |first=Brian |last=O'Brien |id=2b53 |accessdate=23 April 2017}}</ref> *[[Daniel Cooper (murderer)|Daniel Cooper]]: also known as "The [[Newlands, New Zealand|Newlands]] Baby Farmer"; killed two infants and supposedly his first wife; executed 1932.<ref>{{cite book |first=C. A. L. |last=Treadwell |title=Notable New Zealand Trials |location=New Plymouth |publisher=Thomas Avery |date=1936}}</ref> *[[Minnie Dean]]: Scottish immigrant [[Baby farming|baby farmer]] who killed at least three children by [[Laudanum]] poisoning and suffocation in the 1890s; executed by hanging in 1895.<ref>{{cite book |first=Graham |last=Hutchins |title=Bad: Crooks, Creeps and Killers in New Zealand |location=Auckland |publisher=Hodder Moa |date=2010 |isbn=978-1-86971-174-0}}</ref>
===North Macedonia=== *[[Viktor Karamarkov]]: known as "The Macedonian [[Rodion Raskolnikov|Raskolnikov]]"; drug addict who murdered four elderly women in [[Skopje]] from March to October 2009; sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://makfax.com.mk/makedonija/109986/ |title=Доживотен затвор за Виктор Карамарков |trans-title=Life imprisonment for Viktor Karamarkov |date=June 16, 2010 |website=[[Makfax]] |language=mk |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Vlado Taneski]]: crime reporter arrested in June 2008 for the murder of three elderly women on whose deaths he had written articles; committed suicide in police custody; suspected of killing another woman.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/media/2008/jun/24/pressandpublishing.internationalcrime |title=The shocking story of the newspaper crime reporter who knew too much |last=Smith |first=Helena |date=2008-06-24 |newspaper=[[The Guardian]] |location=London, UK |accessdate=2008-06-24}}</ref>
===Norway=== *[[Arnfinn Nesset]]: manager of a [[geriatric]] nursing home who poisoned twenty-two residents at the [[Orkdal]] Alders-og Sjukeheim institution over a period of years before being convicted in 1983.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=U7QSAAAAIBAJ&sjid=cfkDAAAAIBAJ&pg=2293,1624213&dq=arnfinn-nesset |title=Slayer of 22 sentenced |date=19 March 1983 |newspaper=[[Spokane Chronicle]] |accessdate=12 August 2011}}</ref>
===Pakistan=== *[[Javed Iqbal (serial killer)|Javed Iqbal]]: believed to have raped and killed 100 boys, committed suicide while in prison in 1991.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.indiatvnews.com/crime/news/serial-killer-javed-iqbal-who-sexually-abused-and-killed-2733.html |title=Serial killer Javed Iqbal who sexually abused and killed 100 children in Pakistan |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=25 February 2013 |website=[[India TV]] |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/6PqlVwKyg?url=http://www.indiatvnews.com/crime/news/serial-killer-javed-iqbal-who-sexually-abused-and-killed-2733.html |archive-date=26 May 2014}}</ref> *[[Amir Qayyum]]: also known as the "Brick Killer"; murdered fourteen homeless men in [[Lahore]] with rocks or bricks when they were asleep and was sentenced to death in May 2006.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.turkishweekly.net/news/31571/-death-for-lahore-brick-killer.html |title=Death for Lahore 'brick killer' |date=May 11, 2006 |website=Turkish Weekly |accessdate=February 26, 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140302140823/http://www.turkishweekly.net/news/31571/-death-for-lahore-brick-killer.html |archive-date=March 2, 2014}}</ref>
===Panama=== *[[Silvano Ward Brown]]: known as "The Panamá Strangler"; first serial killer in Panamanian history; strangled three women from 1959 to 1973 in the [[Panamá Province]]; released in 1993 after serving a 20-year sentence.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://impresa.prensa.com/mas_de_la_prensa/muertes-prostitutas_0_966653491.html |title=Las muertes de las prostitutas |trans-title=The deaths of prostitutes |date=July 13, 2003 |newspaper=[[La Prensa (Panama City)|La Prensa]] |language=es |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Gilberto Ventura Ceballos]]: [[Dominican Republic|Dominican]] man who murdered five Panamanian youths of Chinese descent in [[La Chorrera, Panama|La Chorrera]] from 2010 to 2011; sentenced to 50 years imprisonment.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.telemetro.com/nacionales/Condenan-Ventura-Ceballos-asesinato-chorreranos_0_1152485117.html |title=Dictan 50 años de prisión para Ventura Ceballos y Méndez por asesinato de 5 jóvenes chorreranos |trans-title=Ventura Ceballos and Méndez setenced to 50 years in prison for the murder of 5 young chorreranos |first=Nimay |last=González |date=9 July 2018 |website=[[Telemetro]] |language=es |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180709183020/http://www.telemetro.com/nacionales/Condenan-Ventura-Ceballos-asesinato-chorreranos_0_1152485117.html |archive-date=9 July 2018}}</ref> *[[William Dathan Holbert]]: also known as "Wild Bill"; American expatriate who had the bodies of five other Americans buried on his property; he would kill people to get their money and properties; his wife, Laura Michelle Reese, was also arrested.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.telemetro.com/nacionales/Desmienten-Wild-Bill-designado-capellan_0_731627270.html |title=Desmienten que "Wild Bill" haya sido designado como capellán |trans-title=They deny that "Wild Bill" has been appointed as chaplain |website=Telemetro |language=es |accessdate=5 September 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140908004447/http://www.telemetro.com/nacionales/Desmienten-Wild-Bill-designado-capellan_0_731627270.html |archive-date=8 September 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2010/08/05/william-holbert-panama-mu_n_671658.html |title=William Holbert Panama Murders: More Bodies Found at Hostel of U.S. Man Accused of Serial Killings |first=Nicholas |last=Sabloff |date=August 5, 2010 |website=Huffington Post |accessdate=28 March 2014 }}</ref>
===Peru===
*[[Pedro Pablo Nakada Ludeña]]: also known as "The Apostle of Death"; convicted of seventeen murders and claimed 25; sentenced to 35 years in prison.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.eltelegrafo.com.ec/noticias/judicial/13/pedro-pablo-nakada-el-mayor-asesino-en-serie-del-peru |title=Pedro Pablo Nakada, el mayor asesino en serie del Perú |trans-title=Pedro Pablo Nakada, the greatest serial killer of Peru |date=1 November 2013 |newspaper=[[El Telégrafo (Ecuador)|El Telégrafo]] |language=es |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===Philippines=== *[[Edgar Matobato]]: self-confessed hitman and serial killer who claims to have killed hundreds of people as part of the [[Davao Death Squad]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.rappler.com/newsbreak/in-depth/147414-edgar-matobato-liar-truth-teller |title=Edgar Matobato: Liar or truth-teller? |first=Chay F. |last=Hofileña |date=27 September 2016 |website=[[Rappler]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>

Further allegations |date=8 April 2017 |newspaper=[[Fakt]] |language=pl |accessdate=9 January 2018}}</ref> *[[Joachim Knychała]]: also known as "The Vampire of [[Bytom]]" or "Frankenstein", who murdered five women between 1975 and 1982.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.zyciebytomskie.pl/artykul.php?id=1886&glowny=0 |title=Wampir z Bytomia |date=7 February 2011 |newspaper=Życie Bytomskie |language=pl |accessdate=24 May 2012}}{{Dead link |date=August 2018 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://wiadomosci.onet.pl/wiadomosci/slaski-frankenstein,1,3488062,wiadomosc.html |title=Śląski Frankenstein |trans-title=Silesian Frankenstein |first=Erika |last=Sjoblom |date=12 November 2008 |website=[[Onet.pl]] |language=pl |accessdate=24 May 2012 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://archive.today/20120716065047/http://wiadomosci.onet.pl/wiadomosci/slaski-frankenstein,1,3488062,wiadomosc.html |archive-date=16 July 2012}}</ref> *[[Edmund Kolanowski]]: necrophile who murdered three women from 1970 to 1982; also mutilated and desecrated corpses he excavated from chapels; executed 1986.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://poznan.wyborcza.pl/poznan/1,109268,11163581,Zanim_znow_zaatakuje____Historia_nekrofila.html |title=Zanim znów zaatakuje... killed four women the area of [[Ruda Śląska]]; committed suicide in 1985.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.fakt.pl/wydarzenia/polska/slask/mieczyslaw-zub-fantomas-nieuchwytny-psychopata-ktory-terroryzowal-slask/986ydes |title=Nieuchwytny psychopata terroryzował Śląsk |trans-title=An elusive psychopath terrorized Silesia |first=Maciej |last=Molenda |date=2017-04-06 |newspaper=Fakt |access-date=2017-05-05}}</ref>
===Portugal=== *[[Diogo Alves]]: also known as the "Aqueduct Murderer"; Spanish man who robbed and threw poor people off [[Lisbon]]'s [[Águas Livres Aqueduct]] between 1836 and 1840; executed 1841.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://pereulki.com/2015/06/ubijtsa-s-akveduka-istoriya-diogo-alvesha-samogo-izvestnogo-prestupnika-portugalii/ |title=Убийца с Акведука: История Диого Алвеша, Самого Известного Преступника Португалии |trans-title=Aqueduct Killer: The Story of Diogo Alves, Portugal's Most Famous Criminal |date=June 22, 2015 |website=Переулки Лиссабона |language=ru |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[António Luís Costa]]: ex-[[Portuguese National Republican Guard|GNR]] officer from [[Santa Comba Dão]] who murdered three women between 2005 and 2006; sentenced to 25 years in prison.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://expresso.sapo.pt/dossies/diario/os-vizinhos-de-socrates-na-prisao=f899794 |title=Os vizinhos de Sócrates na prisão |trans-title=Sócrates's prison neighbours |last1=Franco |first1=Hugo |last2=Moleiro |first2=Raquel |last3=Gustavo |first3=Rui |lastauthoramp=yes |date=25 November 2014 |newspaper=[[Expresso (newspaper)|Expresso]] |language=pt |access-date=13 May 2016}}</ref>
===Romania===
*[[Vera Renczi]]: poisoned two husbands, one son and 32 of her suitors in the 1920s and 1930s.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://adevarul.ro/locale/calarasi/sfarsitul-cumplit-celei-mai-sadice-criminale-vaduva-neagra-femeia-misterioasa-ucis-35-barbati-1_57372ef05ab6550cb8eef23c/index.html |title=Sfârşitul cumplit al celei mai sadice criminale. The Black Widow, the mysterious woman who killed 35 men |first=Ionela |last=Stănilă |date=1 June 2016 |newspaper=[[Adevărul]] |language=ro |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.descopera.ro/cultura/3470508-vaduva-neagra-sau-castelana-din-berkerekul |title=Vaduva Neagra sau Castelana din Berkerekul |trans-title=Black Widow or Chatelaine of Berkerekul |first=Adrian |last=Nicolae |date=11 October 2008 |website=Descoperă |language=ro |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Ion Rîmaru]]: murdered and raped young women in [[Bucharest]] from 1970 to 1971; executed in 1971.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://adevarul.ro/locale/alexandria/secretele-faimosului-criminal-ramaru-vampirul-bucuresti-sugea-sangele-victimelor-sfasia-organele-genitale-dintii-1_56602b4f7d919ed50ed9e3a3/index.html |title=Secretele faimosului criminal Râmaru, "vampirul din Bucureşti": sugea sângele victimelor şi le sfâşia organele genitale cu dinţii |trans-title=Secrets of the famous criminal Râmaru, "the vampire from Bucharest": sucked the blood of his victims and ripped their genitals with his teeth |first=Elisabeth |last=Bouleanu |date=4 December 2015 |newspaper=Adevărul |language=ro |access-date=4 December 2015}}</ref> *[[Vasile Tcaciuc]]: also known as "The Butcher of [[Iași]]": murdered victims with an axe and confessed to have committed at least 26 murders; shot dead by a policeman while trying to escape from prison.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.procuror.ro/article/8791/Vasile-Tcaciuc-ndash-Macelarul-din-Iasi |title=Vasile Tcaciuc – Macelarul din Iasi |trans-title=Vasile Tcaciuc - Butcher from Iasi |date=2009 |website=Procuror |language=ro |accessdate=February 20, 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140225183013/http://www.procuror.ro/article/8791/Vasile-Tcaciuc-ndash-Macelarul-din-Iasi |archive-date=2014-02-25}}</ref> *[[Romulus Vereș]]: convicted of five murders in the 1970s; sent to a mental institution; died in 1993.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.clujeanul.ro/cluj/citeste-povestea-celui-mai-temut-criminal-al-clujului-omul-cu-ciocanul-2394295 |title=Citeşte povestea celui mai temut criminal al Clujului: "Omul cu ciocanul" |trans-title=Read the story of the most feared criminal in Cluj: "The man with the hammer" |date=2008-02-17 |website=Clujeanul |language=ro |accessdate=2008-03-12 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20080301111548/http://www.clujeanul.ro/cluj/citeste-povestea-celui-mai-temut-criminal-al-clujului-omul-cu-ciocanul-2394295 |archive-date=2008-03-01}}</ref>
===Russia=== {{Main|List of Russian serial killers}}
===Serbia=== *[[Baba Anujka]] (also known as Anna Pistova, Ana di Pištonja, Anuyka Dee, "The Banat Witch" and "The Witch of [[Vladimirovac]]"); professional poisoner who poisoned between 50 and 150 people until apprehended in 1928.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.novosti.rs/vesti/naslovna/reportaze/aktuelno.293.html:792782-BANATSKA-VESTICA-ZAVILA-VLADIMIROVAC-U-CRNO-Baba-Anujka-je-bila-prvi-serijski-ubica-u-Srbiji-ubila-150-ljudi |title=Baba Anujka je bila prvi serijski ubica u Srbiji, ubila 150 ljudi |trans-title=Baba Anujka was the first serial killer in Serbia, killing 150 people |date=5 May 2019 |newspaper=[[Večernje novosti]] |language=sr |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===Slovakia=== *[[Matej Čurko]]: also known as the "Slovak Cannibal"; killed and cannibalized two willing victims in 2010 in [[Kysak]], suspected of another 28 such cases from 2009 to 2011; killed by police in 2011.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.corriere.it/english/11_agosto_02/cannibal-victims_fa52f944-bcf3-11e0-b530-d2ad6f731cf9.shtml |title=Slovak Cannibal's Possible Italian Victims – Thirty Missing Women Profiled |first=Massimo |last=Sideri |translator-first=Giles |translator-last=Watson |date=August 2, 2011 |newspaper=[[Corriere della Sera]] |edition=English |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Juraj Lupták]]: also known as the "Strangler from [[Banská Bystrica]]"; shepherd who raped and strangled three women from 1978 to 1982; executed 1987 in Bratislava.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://korzar.sme.sk/c/5770728/dievca-vymodelovalo-tvar-svojho-vraha-bol-nim-krvavy-baca.html#axzz4krXbYeYQ |title=Dievča vymodelovalo tvár svojho vraha. Bol ním "krvavý bača" |trans-title=The girl modeled the face of her killer. He was "bloody shepherd" |first=Eva |last=Bombová |date=18 February 2011 |newspaper=[[Korzár]] |language=sk |accessdate=2017-06-24}}</ref> *[[Ondrej Rigo]]: killed, raped and mutilated nine women in [[Amsterdam]], [[Munich]] and [[Bratislava]], always wearing socks on his hands; he remains the [[Slovaks|Slovak]] murderer with the highest number of victims and he is also the most prolific serial killer in modern Slovak history.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://refresher.sk/33850-Ondrej-Rigo-Na-svedomi-ma-9-zivotov-a-vysluzil-si-titul-najbrutalnejsi-seriovy-vrah-Slovenska?gdpr-accept=1 |title=Ondrej Rigo: Na svedomí má 9 životov a vyslúžil si titul najbrutálnejší sériový vrah Slovenska |trans-title=Ondrej Rigo: He killed 9 and is Slovakia's most brutal serial killer |first=František |last=Kulhánek |date=4 June 2016 |website=Refresher.sk |language=sk |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Jozef Slovák]]: after serving just 8 years for his first murder from 1978, Slovák killed at least four other women in [[Slovakia]] and [[Czech Republic]] in the early 1990s; highly intelligent, holder of numerous patents in electronics.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.pluska.sk/slovensko/vrah-genius.html |title=Vrah génius! |trans-title=Killer genius! |date=9 June 2008 |newspaper=[[Plus JEDEN DEŇ]] |language=sk |accessdate=20 December 2014}}</ref>
===Slovenia=== *[[Silvo Plut]]: killed three women in Slovenia and Serbia from 1990 until 2006; committed suicide in prison in 2007.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.dnevnik.si/204085 |title=Silvo Plut obsojen na 30 let zaporne kazni |trans-title=Silvo Plut sentenced to 30 years in prison |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=2 October 2006 |newspaper=[[Dnevnik (Slovenia)|Dnevnik]] |language=sl |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Metod Trobec]]: raped and killed at least five women between 1976 and 1978; committed suicide in prison in 2006.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.slovenskenovice.si/crni-scenarij/doma/dolenja-vas-kraj-nesrecnega-imena |title=Dolenja vas, kraj nesrečnega imena |trans-title=Dolenja Vas, a place of unlucky name |first=Vojko |last=Zakrajšek |date=January 5, 2012 |newspaper=[[Slovenske novice]] |language=sl |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===South Africa=== {{as of|2014|October}}, South Africa had 160 recorded serial killers since 1950. A disproportionately large number of them were white males, although no racial group was more likely to be a victim.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.iol.co.za/news/crime-courts/most-sa-serial-killers-are-white-males-1.1766044 |title=Most SA serial killers are white males |last=Geach |first=Chelsea |date=16 October 2014 |newspaper=[[Cape Argus]] |via=[[Independent Online (South Africa)|Independent Online]] |accessdate=29 October 2014}}</ref>
*[[Asande Baninzi]]: killed eighteen people in the span of three months in 2001 with accomplice Mthutuzeli Nombewu; was given 19 life sentences and 189 years imprisonment.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.crimezzz.net/serialkiller_news/B/BANINZI_asande.php |title=Asande Baninzi |last=Wetsch |first=Elisabeth |date=2005 |website=Serial Killer News |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151008070518/http://www.crimezzz.net/serialkiller_news/B/BANINZI_asande.php |archive-date=2015-10-08}}</ref> *[[Pierre Basson]]: first documented South African serial killer; killed nine people in [[Claremont, Cape Town|Claremont]] between 1903 and 1906 and buried them in his backyard; committed suicide to avoid arrest.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.africacrime-mystery.co.za/books/fsac/chp1.htm |title=Murdering for money, Pierre Basson: 1903 |last=Marsh |first=Rob |date=2009 |website=AfricaCrime-Mystery.co.za |access-date=19 November 2016}}</ref> *[[Sibusiso Duma]]: murdered seven people in the [[Pietermaritzburg]] area of [[KwaZulu Natal]] in 2007.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.news24.com/SouthAfrica/News/Life-in-jail-for-serial-killer-20090817 |title=Life in jail for Serial Killer |date=2009-08-17 |website=[[News24]] |access-date=2010-04-10 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120920180328/http://www.news24.com/SouthAfrica/News/Life-in-jail-for-serial-killer-20090817 |archive-date=2012-09-20}}</ref> *[[Gamal Lineveldt]]: responsible for the "[[Cape Flats]] Murders"; murdered four European women from October to November 1940; executed 1942.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://murderpedia.org/male.L/l/lineveldt-gamal.htm |title=Gamal Salie Lineveldt |first=Juan Ignacio |last=Blanco |website=Murderpedia |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Cedric Maake]]: also known as the "[[Wemmer Pan]] Killer"; serial rapist; murdered at least 27 people from 1996–1997.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/africa/679141.stm |title=Serial killer jailed for 1,340 years |date=16 March 2000 |website=BBC News |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Bulelani Mabhayi]]: also known as "The Monster of Tholeni"; killed twenty women and children from 2007 to 2012 in the village of Tholeni in the [[Eastern Cape]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.news24.com/SouthAfrica/News/Serial-killer-pleads-guilty-to-20-murders-20130828 |title=Serial killer pleads guilty to 20 murders |date=2013-08-28 |website=News24 |accessdate=5 April 2014}}</ref> *[[Simon Majola]]: together with accomplice Themba Nkosi, known as "The Bruma Lake Killers"; robbed and drowned at least eight men in Bruma Lake from 2000 to 2001; both sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.iol.co.za/saturday-star/dredging-up-the-lake-serial-killers-1136700 |title=Dredging up the lake serial killers |first=Hanlie |last=Retief |date=13 September 2011 |newspaper=[[The Star (South Africa)|The Saturday Star]] |access-date=24 November 2019 |via=[[Independent Online (South Africa)|Independent Online]]}}</ref> *[[Fanuel Makamu]]: also known as "The [[Mpumalanga]] Serial Rapist"; along with accomplice Henry Maile, robbed, raped and murdered six six women from February to September 2000; Maile was shot by police on September 14, while Makamu was captured and sentenced to 165 years imprisonment.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.news24.com/SouthAfrica/News/Serial-killer-gets-165-years-20040727 |title=Serial killer gets 165 years |first1=Zenzele |last1=Kuhlase |first2=Oris |last2=Mnisi |date=27 July 2004 |website=[[News24]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Jimmy Maketta]]: also known as "The Jesus Killer" convicted on sixteen counts of murder, nineteen counts of rape from 1996–1999.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.iol.co.za/news/south-africa/serial-killer-guilty-on-47-counts-351242 |title=Serial killer guilty on 47 counts |first=Caryn |last=Dolley |date=2007-05-03 |website=Independent Online |accessdate=2009-08-19}}</ref> *[[Johannes Mashiane]]: also known as "The Beast of [[Atteridgeville]]" thirteen counts of murder, twelve counts of sodomy from 1982–1989.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://ajas29.tripod.com/stats.html |title=Serial Killers |website=A History of Madness: An Index of Serial Killers and Murderers |access-date=2010-04-09 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111003172900/http://ajas29.tripod.com/stats.html |archive-date=2011-10-03}}</ref> *[[Daisy de Melker]]: poisoner; killed two husbands and one son between 1923–1932; executed in 1932.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.crimemagazine.com/daisy-de-melker-south-africas-first-serial-killer-0 |title=Daisy de Melker: South Africa's First Serial Killer |first=Marilyn Z. |last=Tomlins |date=13 October 2009 |website=Crime Magazine.com |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Samuel Bongani Mfeka]]: strangled six women from 1993 to 1996 in KwaZulu-Natal.<ref>{{cite book |last=Newton |first=Michael |title=The Encyclopedia of Serial Killers |url=https://books.google.fr/books?id=DwNVbOcTncwC&pg=PA381&lpg=PA381&dq=Samuel+Bongani+Mfeka#v=onepage&q=Samuel%20Bongani%20Mfeka |date=February 2006 |publisher=Infobase Publishing |isbn=978-0-8160-6987-3 |page=381}}</ref><ref>{{cite book|last=Schechter |first=Harold |title=The A to Z Encyclopedia of Serial Killers |url=https://books.google.fr/books?id=zM7ROzJPK2MC&pg=PA341&lpg=PA341&dq=%22Samuel+Bongani+Mfeka%22#v=onepage&q=%22Samuel%20Bongani%20Mfeka%22 |date=27 November 2012 |publisher=Simon & Schuster |isbn=978-1-4391-3885-4 |page=341 }}</ref> *[[Jack Mogale]]: also known as the "West-End serial killer"; convicted of raping and murdering sixteen women in [[Johannesburg]] in 2008 and 2009.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.news24.com/SouthAfrica/News/West-End-killer-awaits-sentencing-20110316 |title=West-End killer awaits sentencing |date=2011-03-16 |website=News24 |access-date=2011-03-17 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110629051305/http://www.news24.com/SouthAfrica/News/West-End-killer-awaits-sentencing-20110316 |archive-date=2011-06-29}}</ref> *[[Elifasi Msomi]]: also known as "The Axe Killer" murdered fifteen people from 1953-1955, claiming that he was under the influence of the [[Tokoloshe]].<ref name="LeandiLouw">{{cite web |url=https://medium.com/@LeandiLouw/south-africas-3-most-memorable-serial-killers-560c5b7a6f1a |title=South Africa's 3 Most Memorable Serial Killers |first=Leandi |last=Louw |date=6 August 2018 |website=[[Medium.com]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Mukosi Freddy Mulaudzi]]: also known as "The [[Limpopo]] Serial Killer"; escaped convict, originally responsible for two murders in 1990, who murdered eleven more people between 2005 and 2006; given 11 life sentences.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.iol.co.za/news/south-africa/limpopo-serial-killer-case-postponed-297239 |title=Limpopo serial killer case postponed |date=11 October 2006 |website=[[Independent Online (South Africa)|Independent Online]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Nicholas Lungisa Ncama]]: murdered six people in the [[Eastern Cape]] in 1997; sentenced to life in prison.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.dispatch.co.za/1997/12/09/page%201.htm |title=Serial Killer Suspect in Court |first=Stan |last=Mzimba |date=9 December 1997 |newspaper=[[Daily Dispatch]] |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080501154307/http://www.dispatch.co.za/1997/12/09/page%201.htm |archivedate=May 1, 2008}}</ref> *[[Velaphi Ndlangamandla]]: also known as "The Saloon Killer"; robber who murdered nineteen people around Mpumalanga from April to September 1998; sentenced to 137 years imprisonment.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.iol.co.za/news/south-africa/saloon-killer-gets-137-years-for-19-murders-42926 |title='Saloon killer' gets 137 years for 19 murders |date=19 September 2000 |website=Independent Online |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[David Randitsheni]]: also known as "[[Modimolle]] Serial Killer" raped and murdered ten children (kidnapped and raped more) from 2004–2008.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.iol.co.za/news/south-africa/serial-killer-found-hanging-by-a-sheet-456838 |title=Serial killer found hanging by a sheet |date=2009-08-31 |agency=SAPA |website=Independent Online |accessdate=2009-08-31}}</ref> *[[Gert van Rooyen]]: allegedly abducted and murdered at least six girls from across [[South Africa]] from 1988–1989.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.iol.co.za/news/south-africa/he-feared-god-but-loved-young-girls-1.322079 |title=Feared God but 'loved' young girls |last=Gallagher |first=Christina |date=7 April 2007 |newspaper=[[The Star (South Africa)|The Star]] |via=Independent Online |access-date=10 June 2018 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150918005419/http://www.iol.co.za/news/south-africa/he-feared-god-but-loved-young-girls-1.322079 |archive-date=18 September 2015}}</ref> *[[Louis van Schoor]]: former security guard who confessed to murdering 100 people; released on parole.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.iol.co.za/news/south-africa/serial-killer-freed-after-12-years-in-prison-1.225629 |title=Serial killer freed after 12 years in prison |first=Barbara |last=Hollands |date=2004-10-31 |website=Independent Online |accessdate=2015-12-09}}</ref> *[[Khangayi Sedumedi]]: also known as the "Century City Killer"; raped, robbed and murdered between four and six women in [[Century City, Cape Town|Century City]] from 2011 to 2015; sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.iol.co.za/news/century-city-killers-modus-operandi-revealed-2032665 |title=Century City killer's modus operandi revealed |first=Catherine |last=Rice |date=June 9, 2016 |website=Independent Online |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Samuel Sidyno]]: also known as "Capital Hill Serial Killer"; murdered seven people in [[Pretoria]] from 1998–1999.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.iol.co.za/news/south-africa/sadistic-serial-killer-gets-seven-life-terms-45868 |title=Sadistic serial killer gets seven life terms |date=5 September 2000 |website=Independent Online |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Norman Afzal Simons]]: also known as "Station Strangler" raped, sodomised and murdered twenty-two children on the [[Cape Flats]] from 1986–1994.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.iol.co.za/news/south-africa/revisiting-the-station-strangler-cases-1.250970 |title=Revisiting the Station Strangler cases |last1=Bailey |first1=Candice |date=16 August 2005 |website=Independent Online |accessdate=16 December 2015}}</ref> *[[Moses Sithole]]: also known as the "ABC Killer" and the "South African Strangler"; raped and killed at least 38 young women in [[Atteridgeville]], [[Boksburg]] and Cleveland from 1994–1995.<ref name="LeandiLouw"/><ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.iafrica.com/features/827627.htm |title=Worst criminals of SA |last=Kendal |first=Rebekah |date=3 May 2007 |website=iAfrica.com |accessdate=3 January 2011 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110720084655/http://news.iafrica.com/features/827627.htm |archive-date=20 July 2011}}</ref> *[[Thozamile Taki]]: also known as the "[[Sugarcane]] Serial Killer"; robbed and killed ten women in [[KwaZulu Natal]] and three in [[Eastern Cape]], dumping their bodies in sugarcane and tea [[plantation]]s.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.news24.com/SouthAfrica/News/Sugarcane-killer-Release-her-20100302 |title=Sugarcane killer : Release her |date=2010-03-02 |website=News24 |access-date=2010-04-10 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120920180212/http://www.news24.com/SouthAfrica/News/Sugarcane-killer-Release-her-20100302 |archive-date=2012-09-20}}</ref> *[[Sipho Thwala]]: also known as the "[[Phoenix, Durban|Phoenix]] Strangler"; raped and murdered nineteen women in the sugarcane fields of [[KwaZulu Natal]] from 1996 to 1997.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.discoverychannel.co.uk/crime/serialkillers/phoenixstrangler/index.shtml |title=Crimes That Shook The World: The Phoenix Strangler |date=2009 |website=Discovery Channel: Crimes and Forensics |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091208090320/http://www.discoverychannel.co.uk/crime/serialkillers/phoenixstrangler/index.shtml |archive-date=2009-12-08}}</ref> *[[Stewart Wilken]]: also known as "Boetie Boer"; raped, sodomised and murdered at least seven victims in and around [[Port Elizabeth]] from 1990–1997.<ref>{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=oN_QKBYvSloC&pg=PA344 |title=Serial Murderers and their Victims |last=Hickey |first=Eric W. |date=23 June 2009 |publisher=Cengage Learning |page=344 |isbn=978-0-495-60081-7}}</ref><ref>{{cite book |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=s7cEAQAAIAAJ |title=Strangers on the Street: Serial Homicide in South Africa |last=Pistorius |first=Micki |authorlink=Micki Pistorius |year=2002 |publisher=Penguin |isbn=978-0-14-100356-6 |accessdate=5 April 2012}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.stuff.co.nz/auckland/local-news/north-harbour-news/696177 |title=Story of a Serial Killer |date=30 October 2008 |newspaper=North Harbour News |accessdate=5 April 2012}}</ref> *[[Elias Xitavhudzi]]: also known as "Pangaman" murdered sixteen people in [[Atteridgeville]] in the 1960s.<ref>{{cite book |last=Newton |first=Michael |title=The Encyclopedia of Serial Killers |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=DwNVbOcTncwC |date=February 2006 |publisher=Infobase Publishing |pages=207 & 246 |isbn=978-0-8160-6987-3}}</ref> *[[Christopher Mhlengwa Zikode]]: also known as "Donnybrook Serial Killer"; murdered eighteen people in [[Donnybrook, KwaZulu-Natal]] from 1994–1995.<ref>{{Cite book |url=https://books.google.com/?id=oN_QKBYvSloC&pg=PA341&lpg=PA341&dq=christopher+zikode,+serial+killer#v=onepage&f=false |title=Serial Murderers and their Victims |first=Eric W. |last=Hickey |date=June 23, 2009 |page=341 |publisher=Cengage Learning |isbn=978-0-495-60081-7 |via=Google Books}}</ref>
===South Korea=== *[[Chijon family]]: gang of cannibals that was sentenced to death for killing five people; sentenced to death in 1994; all members were [[executed by hanging]] on November 2, 1995.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://news.joins.com/article/3684096 |title=살인마 지존파 원래 조직명은 마스칸 |trans-title=Murderer tribe originally named Maskan |date=2009-07-12 |newspaper=[[JoongAng Ilbo]] |language=ko |access-date=2016-08-26}}</ref> *[[Crown Prince Sado]]: [[Joseon]] prince who raped and killed his palace staff; sealed in a rice chest and died.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://koreajoongangdaily.joins.com/news/article/Article.aspx?aid=3010313 |title=The ever-changing history of Prince Sado |author=Jin Eun-Soo |date=15 October 2015 |newspaper=[[Korea JoongAng Daily]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Jeong Du-yeong]]: killed an officer in 1986; after release, killed eight other people in robberies from 1999 to 2000; sentenced to death.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.donga.com/fbin/output?f=eA_&n=200004160101 |title=열달새 9명 죽였다…부산 中企회장부부 살해범 자백 |trans-title=Killed nine people in ten months ... confessed to murder of husband and wife |date=16 April 2000 |newspaper=[[The Dong-a Ilbo]] |language=ko |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Jeong Nam-gyu]]: sexually assaulted and killed fourteen people from 2004 to 2006; died in hospital after failing to hang himself the previous day.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.naver.com/main/read.nhn?mode=LPOD&mid=sec&sid1=001&sid2=140&oid=001&aid=0002987292&isYeonhapFlash=Y |title=연쇄살인범 정남규 서울구치소서 자살 |trans-title=Serial Killer Chung Nam-gyu commits suicide at Seoul detention center |date=2009-11-22 |agency=[[Yonhap News Agency]] |website=[[Naver]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Kang Ho-sun]]: sentenced to death in 2010 for killing ten women, including his wife and mother-in-law.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.thestandard.com.hk/breaking_news_detail.asp?id=13851 |title=Death sentence for South Korean serial killer |date=10 November 2013 |newspaper=[[The Standard (Hong Kong)|The Standard]] |accessdate=2013-11-10 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20131110003435/http://www.thestandard.com.hk/breaking_news_detail.asp?id=13851 |archivedate=2013-11-10}}</ref> *[[Kim Hae-sun]]: violent drunkard who raped and killed three children in 2000; executed 2001.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://media.daum.net/culture/art/view.html?cateid=1021&newsid=20060323092612574&p=tvreport |title=어이없고 해괴한 범죄 '사이코패시'족들! |trans-title=A ridiculous and bizarre crime psychopath! |date=2006-03-23 |website=[[Daum.net]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Kim Sun-ja (serial killer)|Kim Sun-ja]]: poisoned five people with potassium cyanide between 1986 and 1988 for monetary reasons; executed 1997.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.hyunbulnews.com/news/articleView.html?idxno=296863|title=Death penalthy for the elderly Kim is unfair|last=Kim|first=Jiwon|date=November 23, 2011|work=Modern Buddhist Newspaper|access-date=July 16, 2019}}</ref> *[[Lee Choon-jae]]: responsible for the "Hwaseong serial murders"; murdered fifteen women, including his sister-in-law, and raped numerous others; sentenced to life imprisonment for one murder in 1994, and connected to the others decades later.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://bnonews.com/index.php/2019/09/serial-killer-who-terrorized-south-korea-identified-after-30-years/ |title=South Korean serial killer who inspired 'Memories of Murder' identified after 30 years |date=September 18, 2019 |website=[[BNO News]] |accessdate=September 19, 2019}}</ref> *[[Yoo Young-chul]]: cannibal; killed twenty-one people from September 2003 to July 2004, mainly young women and rich men; sentenced to death in 2004.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://english.chosun.com/site/data/html_dir/2004/08/13/2004081361048.html |title=Serial Killer Claims to Have Eaten Victims' Organs |first=Yong-hyun |last=Ahn |date=13 August 2004 |newspaper=[[The Chosun Ilbo]] |accessdate=12 July 2016}}</ref>
===Spain=== *[[The "Frenchman's Garden" Murders|Andrés Aldije Monmejá and José Muñoz Lopera]]: responsible for the "Frenchman's Garden" murders; owners of an illegal gambling house who killed six visitors from 1889 to 1904; both garroted in 1906.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://gaceta.es/noticias/huerto-frances-peligroso-casino-andalucia-profunda-26052017-1710/ |title=El huerto del francés, un peligroso casino en la Andalucía profunda |trans-title=The French Orchard, a dangerous casino in deepest Andalusia |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=26 May 2017 |newspaper=[[La Gaceta (Spain)|La Gaceta]] |language=es |access-date=26 November 2017}}</ref> *[[Francisca Ballesteros]]: known as ''La Viuda Negra''<ref name="abc.es">{{Cite news |url=https://www.abc.es/espana/asesinos-serie-201012010000_noticia.html |title=La negra lista de asesinos en serie de España |trans-title=The black list of serial killers in Spain |date=December 1, 2010 |newspaper=[[ABC (newspaper)|ABC]] |language=es |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> ("The [[Latrodectus|Black Widow]]"), poisoned her husband and three children in [[Valencia, Spain|Valencia]] between 1990 and 2004 (one survived), sentenced to 84 years in prison in 2005. *[[Manuel Blanco Romasanta]]: travelling salesman who claimed to be a [[werewolf]], confessed to thirteen murders and was convicted of eight in 1853; his initial death sentence commuted in order to make a study in [[clinical lycanthropy]], died in prison ten years later.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.typicallyspanish.com/news/publish/article_13582.shtml |title=The Wolfman of Allariz |author=m.p. |date=13 November 2007 |website=Typically Spanish |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111204040513/http://www.typicallyspanish.com/news/publish/article_13582.shtml |archive-date=2011-12-04}}</ref> *[[Manuel Delgado Villegas]]: also known as ''El Arropiero''<ref name="abc.es"/> ("The [[Arrope]] Trader"), wandering criminal with [[XYY syndrome]] that confessed to 48 murders in [[Spain]], [[France]] and [[Italy]], including his girlfriend; considered guilty of seven and interned in a mental institution until his death in 1998. *[[Joaquín Ferrándiz Ventura]]: insurance salesman who murdered five women in [[Castellón Province]] between 1995 and 1996.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://elpais.com/diario/1998/09/10/cvalenciana/905455100_850215.html |title=La Guardia Civil detiene al supuesto asesino de Sonia Rubio en Benicàssim. El supuesto asesino de Sonia Rubio ya fue condenado por abuso sexual |trans-title=The Civil Guard arrests the presumed killer of Sonia Rubio in Benicàssim. The presumed killer of Sonia Rubio had been convicted previously of sexual assault |last=Fabra |first=María |date=September 10, 1998 |newspaper=El País |location=Madrid, Spain |language=es |access-date=September 5, 2017}}</ref> *[[Alfredo Galán]]: also known as "The Playing Card Killer", Spanish Army corporal who killed six individuals in 2003.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.elobservadordelmundo.com/reportaje_detalle.asp?cod=1020 |title=La Parte Oscura de la Mente: Alfredo Galán Sotillo - El Asesino de la Baraja |trans-title=The Dark Part of the Mind: Alfredo Galán Sotillo - The Killer of the Baraja |date=August 19, 2011 |website=El Observador del Mundo |language=es |accessdate=March 14, 2014 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110910130600/http://www.elobservadordelmundo.com/reportaje_detalle.asp?cod=1020 |archive-date=10 September 2011}}</ref> *[[Juan Díaz de Garayo]]: also known as "The Sacamantecas"; killed six people from 1870 to 1879 in [[Álava]]. Executed by [[garrote]] in 1881.<ref>{{cite book |last=Becerro de Bengoa |first=Ricardo |date=1881 |title=El Sacamantecas. Su Retrato y sus Crímenes. Narración escrita con arreglo a todos los datos auténticos |location=Vitoria |publisher=Viuda e Hijos de Iturbe |language=es}}</ref><ref>{{cite book |last=Bernaldo de Quirós |first=Constancio |date=1909 |title=Vidas Delincuentes |location=Madrid |publisher=Centro Editorial Góngora |language=es}}</ref> *[[Francisco García Escalero]]: also known as ''El Mendigo Asesino''<ref name="abc.es"/> ("The Killer Beggar"); [[schizophrenia|schizophrenic]] beggar convicted of eleven murders, confined to a psychiatric hospital since 1995 *[[Gila Giraldo]]: also known as "La Serrana de la Verra"; alleged 15th-16th century serial killer who beheaded men she slept with. *[[Murder of Rocío Wanninkhof#Tony Alexander King|Tony Alexander King]]: also known as the "Costa Killer"; British sex offender who murdered two girls in [[Malaga]] in 1999 and 2003; suspected of possibly committing more murders in his native UK; sentenced to 19 years imprisonment.<ref name="El Mundo">{{cite news |url=http://www.elmundo.es/elmundo/2003/09/22/sociedad/1064218068.html |title=El asesino de Sonia y Rocío estranguló a cinco mujeres en Reino Unido |trans-title=The murderer of Sonia and Rocío who strangled five women in the United Kingdom |date=September 23, 2003 |newspaper=[[El Mundo (Spain)|El Mundo]] |location=Madrid, Spain |language=es |access-date=September 21, 2017}}</ref> *[[Ramón Laso]]: killed his two wives, child and brother in law in order to pursue extra-marital relationships.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.elespanol.com/reportajes/grandes-historias/20170113/185732087_0.html |title=El enterrador convertido en asesino cuyas víctimas jamás aparecieron |trans-title=The undertaker turned murderer whose victims were never found |last=Rada |first=Juan |date=January 15, 2017 |newspaper=[[El Español]] |location=Madrid, Spain |language=es |access-date=September 9, 2017}}</ref> *[[Enriqueta Martí]]: self-proclaimed [[witch]] who kidnapped, prostituted, murdered and made potions with the remains of small children in early 20th century [[Barcelona]] (12 bodies were identified in her home); murdered in prison while awaiting trial in 1913.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://hemeroteca.lavanguardia.com/preview/1912/04/19/pagina-3/33336536/pdf.html |title=Poco después de las tres y media de la madrugada de ayer, falleció en la cárcel de mujeres la tristemente célebre secuestradora Enriqueta Martí Ripoli... |trans-title=Shortly after half past three in the morning yesterday, the sadly celebrated kidnapper Enriqueta Martí Ripoli died in the women's prison... |date=13 May 1913 |page=3 |newspaper=[[La Vanguardia]] |language=es |access-date=21 April 2018}}</ref> *[[Dámaso Rodríguez Martín]]: ''El Brujo'' ("The Warlock"), serial rapist and [[voyeur]] imprisoned in 1981 after attacking a couple, killing the man and raping the woman. Escaped from prison to the [[Anaga]] mountains in 1991, where he killed two German hikers (one of them was raped). Cornered in an abandoned house, he shot himself unsuccessfully, only to be shot dead in turn by law enforcement.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.laopinion.es/sucesos/2016/02/14/brujo-bestia-moquinal/655875.html |title='El Brujo', la bestia de El Moquinal |trans-title='El Brujo', the beast of El Moquinal |last=Herrero |first=Antonio |date=15 February 2016 |newspaper=[[La Opinión]] |language=es |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160304005951/http://www.laopinion.es/sucesos/2016/02/14/brujo-bestia-moquinal/655875.html |archive-date=4 March 2016}}</ref> *[[José Antonio Rodríguez Vega]]: ''El Mataviejas''<ref name="abc.es"/> ("The Old Lady Killer"), raped and killed at least sixteen elderly women, sentenced to 440 years in prison in 1995, murdered by fellow inmates in 2002. *[[Abdelkader Salhi (serial killer)|Abdelkader Salhi]]: known as the "10 Killer"; German convicted of a robbery-murder in 1988 in Germany, later moving to Spain and allegedly murdering three prostitutes from August to September 2011; currently awaiting sentencing.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.euroweeklynews.com/2011/09/29/costa-del-sol-serial-killer-arrested/#.XLCrBDAzbIV |title='Costa del Sol Serial Killer' arrested |date=29 September 2011 |website=[[EuroWeekly News]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Gustavo Romero Tercero]]: "The [[Valdepeñas]] Killer", killed three people from 1993 to 1998.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.elmundo.es/elmundo/2005/04/21/sociedad/1114074425.html |title=Condenan a 103 años de prisión a Gustavo Romero por el asesinato de tres personas en Valdepeñas |trans-title=Gustavo Romero sentenced to 103 years in prison for the murder of three people in Valdepeñas |date=April 22, 2005 |newspaper=El Mundo |location=Madrid, Spain |language=es |access-date=September 14, 2017}}</ref> *[[Margarita Sánchez Gutiérrez]]: known as "The Black Widow of Barcelona"; poisoned family members and relatives, killing four of them; acquitted of the murders, but sentenced to 34 years for other crimes.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.elpais.com/articulo/opinion/buzon/nicho/abierto/elpepiopi/19960801elpepiopi_1/Tes |title=Un buzón como un nicho abierto |trans-title=A mailbox as an open niche |last1=Martin |first1=Andreu |date=1 August 1996 |newspaper=El País |language=es |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===Swaziland=== *[[David Thabo Simelane]]: raped and killed 28 women, suspected of 45; sentenced to death in 2011.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.swazilive.com/Swaziland_News/Swaziland_News_Stories.asp?News_id=2722 |title=David Simelane gets death penalty, to be hanged |first=Linda |last=Jele |date=2 April 2011 |website=Swaziland News |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===Sweden=== *[[Malmö Östra hospital murders|Anders Hansson]]: hospital [[orderly]] in [[Malmö]] who poisoned his victims with detergents Gevisol and Ivisol between October 1978 and January 1979; his actions were called the "[[Malmö Östra hospital murders]]".<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.aftonbladet.se/nyheter/article12915042.ab |title=99 dagar – 27 mord |trans-title=99 days - 27 murders |first=Linda |last=Hjertén |date=2011-04-24 |newspaper=[[Aftonbladet]] |language=sv |accessdate=2014-01-17}}</ref> *[[Anders Lindbäck (vicar)|Anders Lindbäck]]: [[vicar]] who poisoned poor people with arsenic, three of them who died; committed suicide in custody in 1865. *[[John Ingvar Lövgren]]: confessed to four murders committed between 1958 and 1963 in the Stockholm region.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://stockholm.edublogs.org/2012/12/17/vi-kartlagger-fleminggatan-nummer-for-nummer/ |title=Vi kartlägger Fleminggatan nummer för nummer |trans-title=We map Fleminggatan number by number |date=2012-12-17 |website=Stockholm – en guide till kultur, sevärdheter och |language=sv |accessdate=2014-01-17}}</ref> *[[Hilda Nilsson]]: known as "The Angel Maker on Bruks Street"; [[Helsingborg]] baby farmer who murdered eight children; committed suicide in custody in 1917.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sydsvenskan.se/malmo/atskilliga-spadbarn-dog-hos-anglamakerskorna/ |title=Åtskilliga spädbarn dog hos änglamakerskorna |trans-title=Several infants died at the hands of angel makers |last=Andersson |first=Martin |date=2 December 2012 |newspaper=[[Sydsvenskan]] |location=[[Malmö]] |language=sv |accessdate=6 December 2015}}</ref>
===Switzerland=== *[[Roger Andermatt]]: also known as the "Death-Keeper of [[Lucerne]]"; nurse who killed twenty-two people from 1995 to 2001; sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.nzz.ch/aktuell/startseite/articleDL2GQ-1.11845 |title=Es bleibt bei lebenslänglich für den "Todespfleger" |trans-title=It remains a life sentence for the "death-keeper" |date=16 February 2006 |newspaper=[[Neue Zürcher Zeitung]] |language=de |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Werner Ferrari]]: child killer who lured his victims from popular festivals, strangling them afterwards; sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.blick.ch/news/schweiz/die-eltern-der-ermordeten-fabienne-imhof-klagen-an-warum-bloss-lernen-die-richter-nichts-id1799956.html |title=Die Eltern der ermordeten Fabienne Imhof klagen an: "Warum bloss lernen die Richter nichts?" |trans-title=The parents of the murdered Fabienne Imhof complain: "Why are the judges learning nothing?" |date=2012-03-08 |newspaper=[[Blick]] |language=de |accessdate=2014-09-25}}</ref> *[[Erich Hauert]]: sex offender who committed eleven rapes and three murders from 1982 to 1983; sentenced to life imprisonment; his case impacted treatment of dangerous sexual offenders in Switzerland tremendously.<ref>''Neue Zürcher Zeitung'', 20 September 1996, p. 53.</ref>
===Taiwan=== *[[Chen Ruiqin]]: known as "The Chiayi Demon"; murdered five relatives and one girlfriend for insurance money between 1985 and 2003; also suspected in two other disappearances; executed 2013.<ref>{{Cite journal|last=|first=|date=|title=Chen Ruiqin layed down! Took the lives of six, two wives, three sons and one girlfriend|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pcrKPgWTRdY|journal=Zhongtian News|volume=|pages=|via=|}}</ref> *[[Lin Yuru (criminal)|Lin Yuru]]: fatally poisoned three relatives in [[Puli, Nantou|Puli]] to pay off gambling debts between 2008 and 2009; sentenced to death.<ref>[http://www.appledaily.com.tw/appledaily/article/headline/20100408/32420230/applesearch/詐領保險金9個月殺3人魔女求處3死刑遭求處死刑 Fraudulent witch's claims kills 3 people in 9 months, sentenced to death] by Apple Daily</ref> *[[Zhang Renbao]]: murdered three women from 1993 to 2003, also sexually violating the first victim; sentenced to death.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.appledaily.com.tw/appledaily/article/headline/20040617/1013505/ |title=箱屍案變態殺人犯判死 |trans-title=Box corpse case murderer sentenced to death |date=17 June 2004 |newspaper=[[Apple Daily (Taiwan)|Apple Daily]] |language=zh |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===Tunisia=== *[[Naceur Damergi]]: rapist who killed thirteen minors in the [[Nabeul]] region in the 1980s; executed by hanging in 1990.<ref>{{Cite web |url=https://www.leaders.com.tn/article/11418-comment-a-ete-pendu-le-tueur-en-serie-de-nabeul |title=Comment a été pendu le tueur en série de Nabeul |trans-title=How was the serial killer of Nabeul hanged |date=17 May 2013 |website=Leaders |language=fr |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.truecrimelibrary.com/crime_series_show.php?series_number=13&id=857 |title=Worldwide Hangings: Naceur Damergi |date=2014 |website=True Crime Library |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140222024758/http://www.truecrimelibrary.com/crime_series_show.php?series_number=13&id=857 |archive-date=February 22, 2014}}</ref>
===Turkey=== *[[Süleyman Aktaş]]: also known as the "Nailing Killer"; killed five people and nailed them in the eyes and head; he is kept in a psychiatric hospital.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.haber7.com/guncel/haber/220403-civici-katilden-folklor-gosterisi |title='Çivici katil'den folklor gösterisi |trans-title=Folklore show from 'The Nail Killer' |first=Aziz |last=Gül |date=2007-02-16 |website=Haber7.com |language=tr |accessdate=2014-03-04}}</ref> *[[Adnan Çolak]]: also known as "The Beast of Artvin"; killed seventeen elderly women in [[Artvin]], Turkey from 1992 to 1995; in 2000 he was sentenced to death six times, and 40 years in prison. However, since October 1984, Turkey has not executed any prisoners, and {{as of|2004|lc=y}}, Turkey does not have capital punishment. *[[Seyit Ahmet Demirci]]: also known as the "Furniture dealers' killer"; killed three furniture dealers selected at random and because he was sexually abused by his employer during his youth;<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.hurriyet.com.tr/gundem/mobilyaci-seri-katili-39131508 |title=Mobilyacı seri katili |trans-title=The serial killer |date=6 February 2000 |newspaper=[[Hürriyet]] |language=tr |accessdate=13 August 2018}}</ref> sentenced to death.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.cnnturk.com/turkiye/turkiyenin-korkunc-cinayetler-isleyen-14-seri-katili |title=Türkiye'nin korkunç cinayetler işleyen 14 seri katili |trans-title=Turkey's 14 serial killers committed terrible murders |date=13 June 2016 |website=[[CNN Türk]] |language=tr |accessdate=13 August 2018}}</ref> *[[Özgür Dengiz]]: serial killer from [[Ankara]], who killed four people and cannibalized at least one.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.milliyet.com.tr/2007/09/16/guncel/agun.html |title=Yerli Hannibal'ın anatomisi |trans-title=Anatomy of the native Hannibal |first1=Mansur |last1=Çeli̇k |first2=Gökçer |last2=Tahi̇nci̇oğlu |date=September 16, 2007 |newspaper=[[Milliyet]] |language=tr |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071105112638/http://www.milliyet.com.tr/2007/09/16/guncel/agun.html |archive-date=5 November 2007}}</ref> *[[Atalay Filiz]]: fugitive suspected of four murders from 2012 to 2016.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.hurriyet.com.tr/son-dakika-haberi-atalay-filiz-yakalandi-40116460 |title=Son dakika haberi: Atalay Filiz yakalandı, üstünden çıkanlar şoke etti! |trans-title=Breaking news: Atalay Filiz caught, shocked by those on top! |first1=Banu |last1=Şen |first2=Taylan |last2=Yıldırım |date=2016-06-12 |newspaper=[[Hürriyet]] |language=tr |accessdate=2016-06-12}}</ref> *[[Ali Kaya (serial killer)|Ali Kaya]]: also known as "The Babyface Killer"; responsible for ten murders.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.sabah.com.tr/Yasam/2014/01/06/bebek-yuzlu-katil-firar-etti |title='Bebek yüzlü katil' firar etti |trans-title='Baby-faced killer' escaped |first=Adsız |last=Günebakan |date=6 January 2014 |newspaper=[[Sabah (newspaper)|Sabah]] |language=tr |accessdate=6 January 2014 }}</ref> *[[Hamdi Kayapınar]]: also known as "Avcı" ("Hunter"); killed eight people from 1994 to 2018; sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.haberturk.com/kayseri-haberleri/62629762-seri-katil-hamdi-kayapinar-adliyeye-sevk-edildikiz-kardesi-dahil-7-kisiyi-olduren-hamdi |title=Seri katil Hamdi Kayapınar adliyeye sevk edildi |trans-title=Serial killer Hamdi Kayapınar was sent to court |date=7 August 2018 |newspaper=[[Habertürk]] |language=tr |accessdate=9 August 2018}}</ref> *[[Yavuz Yapıcıoğlu]]: also known as "The Screwdriver Killer"; responsible for at least eighteen murders.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.radikal.com.tr/haber.php?haberno=60681 |title=Tornavidalı seri cinayet |trans-title=Serial murder with a screwdriver |first=Erdal |last=Özcan |date=2002-12-25 |newspaper=[[Radikal]] |language=tr |accessdate=2014-03-05 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140305170036/http://www.radikal.com.tr/haber.php?haberno=60681 |archive-date=2014-03-05}}</ref>
===Ukraine=== *[[Zaven Almazyan]]: also known as the "Voroshilovgrad Maniac"; Russian soldier who raped and killed three women in [[Voroshilovgrad]]; executed 1973.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.allkriminal.ru/article/17492/671 |title=Луганский маньяк Завен Алмазян |trans-title=Lugansk maniac Zaven Almazyan |date=3 October 2011 |website=AllKriminal.ru |language=ru |access-date=2013-10-07}}</ref> *[[Oleksandr Berlizov]]: also known as the "Night Demon"; sexual psychopath who raped numerous women from 1969 to 1972 in [[Dnipropetrovsk]], killing nine of them; executed 1972. *[[Sergei Dovzhenko]]: killed between seventeen and nineteen people in his native home of [[Mariupol]] for "mocking" him; sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://ilich.in.ua/news.php?id=84 |title=Одиночка ли серийный убийца и зачем он убивал? |trans-title=Is he a lone serial killer and why did he kill? |first=D. |last=Sumtsov |date=1 January 2003 |newspaper=Illichivets |language=ru |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20140716002407/http://ilich.in.ua/news.php?id=84 |archive-date=2014-07-16}}</ref> *[[Tamara Ivanyutina]]: also known as the "Kiev Poisoner"; poisoned people from personal spite 1976 to 1987, killing nine of them; executed 1987.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.bulvar.com.ua/arch/2012/4/4f206e104267f/ |title=Отравление века |last=Poddubny |first=Nikolay |date=2012-01-24 |website=Бульвар Гордона |language=ru |access-date=2012-11-05 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://www.webcitation.org/6DV9upYYV?url=http://www.bulvar.com.ua/arch/2012/4/4f206e104267f/ |archive-date=7 January 2013 }}</ref> *[[Ruslan Khamarov]]: seduced and murdered eleven women in his home from 2000 to 2003; sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.segodnya.ua/oldarchive/c2256713004f33f5c2256e7f0035f846.html |title="Бердянский Маньяк" Требует Привести Девушку Прямо К Нему В Камеру |date=24 April 2004 |newspaper=[[Segodnya]] |language=ru |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Oleg Kuznetsov (serial killer)|Oleg Kuznetsov]]: also known as "The [[Balashikha]] Ripper"; killed a total of ten people in Russia and Ukraine; sentenced to death but commuted to life imprisonment.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.tyurma.com/mordovskaya-edinichka-prigovorennye-k-zhizni |title=Мордовская "единичка" - приговоренные к жизни |trans-title=Mordovian "one" - sentenced to life |website=Tyurma.com |language=ru |access-date=24 November 2019 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170106104333/http://www.tyurma.com/mordovskaya-edinichka-prigovorennye-k-zhizni |archive-date=6 January 2017 |url-status=dead }}</ref> *[[Anatoly Onoprienko]]: also known as "The Terminator"; murdered 52 people from 1989 until his capture in 1996; died in prison in 2013.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.cnn.com/WORLD/europe/9811/30/ukraine.serial.killer/index.html |title=Accused Ukrainian serial killer makes surprise request at trial |date=1998-11-30 |website=CNN |accessdate=2008-09-10 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20080519073812/http://www.cnn.com/WORLD/europe/9811/30/ukraine.serial.killer/index.html |archivedate=2008-05-19}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/programmes/from_our_own_correspondent/219734.stm |title=The lives changed by Onoprienko |first=James |last=Commarasamy |date=1998-11-23 |website=BBC News |accessdate=2008-09-10}}</ref> *[[Dnepropetrovsk maniacs|Viktor Sayenko and Igor Suprunyuk]]: also known as the "Dnepropetrovsk Maniacs"; teenagers in [[Dnipro|Dnipropetrovsk]] who bludgeoned 21 people to death in 2007 with the aid of a third teenager, often filming their murders; sentenced to life in prison in 2009.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.unian.net/eng/news/news-204617.html |title=Three 19‑year-old youths committed 19 murders in Dnepropetrovsk during a month|publisher=[[UNIAN]] |access-date=2008-12-25 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120115153056/http://www.unian.net/eng/news/news-204617.html |archive-date=2012-01-15 |url-status=live }}</ref> *[[Serhiy Tkach]]: convicted of raping and murdering 36 women between 1980-2005; claims the total is 100.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/worldnews/europe/ukraine/3933579/Man-sentenced-to-life-in-prison-for-murdering-36-women.html |title=Man sentenced to life in prison for murdering 36 women |first=Miriam |last=Elder |date=24 December 2008 |newspaper=[[The Daily Telegraph]] |accessdate=2008-12-24}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/world/europe/7798753.stm |title=BBC News: Serial killer jailed in Ukraine |date=24 December 2008 |website=BBC News |accessdate=24 December 2008}}</ref> *[[Nighttime Killers|Vladyslav Volkovich and Volodymyr Kondratenko]]: also known as the "Nighttime Killers"; charged with shooting, stabbing and bludgeoning sixteen victims to death in [[Kiev]] between 1991 and 1997; Kondratenko committed suicide in prison during the trial; Volkovich was found guilty and sentenced to life imprisonment.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.podrobnosti.com.ua/projects/vovremya/2003/06/02/62096.html |title=Дуэт серийных убийц |trans-title=The Serial Killer Duo |date=June 2, 2003 |website=[[Podrobnosti]] |accessdate=2009-01-04 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090123055610/http://podrobnosti.com.ua/projects/vovremya/2003/06/02/62096.html |archive-date=2009-01-23}}</ref> <!-- NOTE: The Dnepropetrovsk maniacs are spree killers. Please do not add them to this article. -->
===United Kingdom===
====England==== *[[Stephen Akinmurele]]: also known as the "Cul-de-sac killer"; committed suicide in [[Manchester Prison|Strangeways]] in 1999 while awaiting trial for the murders of five elderly people in [[Blackpool]] and the [[Isle of Man]] between 1995 and 1998.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/uk/1999/aug/30/jamiewilson1 |title='Serial killer' found hanged |first=Jamie |last=Wilson |date=August 30, 1999 |newspaper=The Guardian |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Beverley Allitt]]: also known as "Angel of Death"; [[Lincolnshire]] [[paediatric]] nurse who killed four children in her care and injured at least nine others; sentenced to life imprisonment in 1991.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/child-murderer-confesses-at-last-1510845.html |title=Child murderer confesses at last |last=Foster |first=Jonathan |date=15 October 1993 |newspaper=[[The Independent]] |location=London, UK |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Mary Bateman]]: also known as the "[[Yorkshire]] Witch"; 19th century thief hanged for the poisoning of a couple (husband survived); suspected in three more deaths; executed 1809.<ref>{{cite book |last=Strevens |first=Summer |date=2017 |title=The Yorkshire Witch: The Life and Trial of Mary Bateman |location=[[Barnsley]] |publisher=[[Pen and Sword Books]] |page=135 |isbn=978-1-47386-387-3}}</ref> *[[Levi Bellfield]]: also known as the "Bus Stop Stalker"; convicted of the 2002 [[murder of Amanda Dowler]] and two fatal hammer attacks on young women in [[South West (London sub region)|South West London]] in 2003 and 2004.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.heraldscotland.com/he-murdered-two-how-many-more-did-bellfield-target-1.875373 |title=He murdered two... how many more did Bellfield target? |date=26 February 2008 |newspaper=[[The Herald (Glasgow)|The Herald]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[London Burkers|John Bishop, Thomas Williams, Michael Shields and James May]]: known as "The London Burkers"; English copycats of [[Burke and Hare murders|Burke and Hare]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.historybytheyard.co.uk/early_murder_investigations.htm |title=Early Murder Investigations |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |website=History by the Yard |access-date=24 January 2007}}</ref> *[[Geordie Bourne]]: Scottish 16th century bandit who killed seven people around the [[Scottish Marches|East English Marches]]; executed by unknown means.<ref>{{cite book |url=https://archive.org/stream/memoirsrobertca00orregoog#page/n66/mode/2up |editor-last=Powell |editor-first=G. H. |date=1905 |title=Memoirs of Robert Carey, Earl of Monmouth |location=London, UK |publisher=Alexander Moring Ltd. The De La More Press |pages=42–45 |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Ian Brady]] and [[Myra Hindley]]: also known as the "[[Moors murders|Moors Murderers]]"; murdered five children, aged between 10 and 17 between 1963 and 1965. Buried four of their victims on [[Saddleworth Moor]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk/661139.stm |title=Hindley: I wish I'd been hanged |date=29 February 2000 |website=BBC News |access-date=11 August 2009}}</ref> *[[Mary Ann Britland]]: poisoned her daughter, husband, and the wife of her lover in 1886; first woman to be executed by hanging at [[HM Prison Manchester|Strangeways Prison]] in [[Manchester]] in 1886 by executioner [[James Berry (executioner)|James Berry]].<ref>{{cite book |url=https://archive.org/stream/MyExperiencesAsAnExecutioner/Berry#page/n37/mode/1up |last=Berry |first=James |editor-first=H. Snowden |editor-last=Ward |date=1892 |title=My Experiences as an Executioner |location=London, UK |publisher=Percy Lund & Co |pages=74–76 |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Peter Bryan]]: [[Psychiatric hospital|institutionalized]] for fatal hammer attack on woman in 1993; re-apprehended for [[cannibalism|cannibalizing]] a friend in 2004, but able to batter a fellow patient to death months later.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.nydailynews.com/news/world/2009/09/03/2009-09-03_series_of_blunders_frees_cannibal_peter_bryan.html |title=Series of blunders frees schizophrenic cannibal Peter Bryan, who kills two more people |last=Hazlett |first=Alexandra |date=3 September 2009 |newspaper=New York Daily News |accessdate=23 November 2009 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090905074132/http://www.nydailynews.com/news/world/2009/09/03/2009-09-03_series_of_blunders_frees_cannibal_peter_bryan.html |archive-date=5 September 2009}}</ref> *[[George Chapman (murderer)|George Chapman]]: Polish-born poisoner who murdered three women between 1897 and 1902; suspected by some authors of being [[Jack the Ripper]].
