killed three people from 1962 to 1971; died in prison in 1990.<ref>{{cite book |last=Lane |first=Brian |date=1993 |title=The Murder Guide: 100 Extraordinary, Bizarre and Gruesome Murders |location=London, UK |publisher=Robinson |page=191 |isbn=1-85487-083-1}}</ref>
====Northern Ireland==== *[[Shankill Butchers]]: The Shankill Butchers was an Ulster loyalist gang—many of whom were members of the [[Ulster Volunteer Force]] (UVF)—that was active between 1975 and 1982 in Belfast, Northern Ireland. The gang was based in the Shankill area and were responsible for the deaths of at least twenty-three people, most of whom were [[Irish Catholic]]s killed in sectarian attacks.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.politics.ie/history/18916-sectarianism-racism-one-same.html |title=Sectarianism – Racism – One and the Same? |author=Conuil |date=July 2007 |website=Politics.ie |access-date=21 December 2015 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110609160824/http://www.politics.ie/history/18916-sectarianism-racism-one-same.html |archive-date=2011-06-09}}</ref>
====Scotland==== *[[Robert Black (serial killer)|Robert Black]]: schoolgirl killer; convicted of four murders in [[Northern Ireland]], [[England]], and [[Scotland]] between 1981 and 1986, suspected of many more; died in prison in 2016.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.truecrimelibrary.com/magazinearticle/death-of-a-serial-killer-robert-blacks-timeline-of-terror/ |title=Death of A Serial Killer – Robert Black's Timeline Of Terror |date=April 2016 |website=True Crime Library |accessdate=3 July 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-northern-ireland-35296135 |title=Robert Black: Convicted child killer dies in prison |date=12 January 2016 |website=BBC News |accessdate=12 January 2016}}</ref> *[[Burke and Hare murders|William Burke and William Hare]]: notorious [[body snatcher]]s in [[Edinburgh]] in the 19th century.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.historic-uk.com/HistoryUK/HistoryofScotland/Burke-Hare-infamous-murderers-graverobbers/ |title=The Story of Burke and Hare |first=Ben |last=Johnson |website=Historic UK |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Archibald Hall]]: also known as the "Monster Butler"; killed five in the 1970s, three with accomplice Michael Kitto.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.watfordobserver.co.uk/nostalgia/crimelibrary/archibaldthomsonhall/themurderousbutler/ |title=The Murderous Butler: Archibald Thomson Hall, alias Roy Fontaine |newspaper=[[Watford Observer]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Peter Manuel]]: also known as the "Beast of [[Birkenshaw, North Lanarkshire|Birkenshaw]]"; American-born murderer of seven, suspected of killing 15; executed in 1958.<ref>{{cite book |url=https://books.google.co.uk/books?id=Dv6G7xTW0FUC&pg=PT25&lpg=PT25&dq=capelrig+Anne+Kneilands#v=onepage&q=capelrig%20Anne%20Kneilands |first1=Hector |last1=MacLeod |first2=Malcolm |last2=McLeod |title=Peter Manuel, Serial Killer |date=2010 |edition=ebook |publisher=Mainstream Publishing |location=Edinburgh |isbn=978-1-84596-883-0}}</ref> *[[Edward William Pritchard]]: English doctor who poisoned his wife and her mother in [[Glasgow]] in 1865; two years earlier their maid had died in a mysterious fire.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://heritage.scotsman.com/notoriouscriminalsfeatureseries/A-deadly-bedside-manner.2680240.jp |title=A deadly beside manner |first=Leighton |last=Bruce |date=21 November 2005 |newspaper=[[The Scotsman]] |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20090307062517/http://heritage.scotsman.com/notoriouscriminalsfeatureseries/A-deadly-bedside-manner.2680240.jp |archive-date=7 March 2009}}</ref> *[[World's End Murders|Angus Sinclair]]: convicted of the murders of four young women, including the "World's End Murders" in [[Edinburgh]], believed to have murdered eight; died in prison in 2019.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/uknews/1309040/Child-killer-gets-life-for-1978-death-of-teenager.html |title=Child killer gets life for 1978 death of teenager |first=Tara |last=Womersley |date=14 June 2001 |newspaper=The Daily Telegraph |location=London, UK |accessdate=5 February 2014}}</ref> *[[Peter Tobin]]: rapist and killer of three women in Scotland and England between 1991 and 2006; sentenced to life in prison.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://news.bbc.co.uk/1/hi/uk/8132283.stm |title=Piecing together serial killer Peter Tobin's past |first=Mario |last=Cacciottolo |date=16 December 2009 |website=BBC News |access-date=9 January 2017}}</ref>
====Wales==== *[[John Cooper (serial killer)|John Cooper]]: also known as "The Wildman" and "The Bullseye Killer"; [[Pembrokeshire]] burglar responsible for the robbery and shotgun double-murders of a brother and sister in 1985 and a couple in 1989.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.walesonline.co.uk/news/wales-news/the-moment-bullseye-revealed-killer-6025096 |title='The moment Bullseye revealed the killer': How shotgun killer John Cooper was caught |last=McCarthy |first=James |date=16 September 2013 |website=[[Wales Online]] |accessdate=26 May 2014}}</ref> *[[Peter Moore (serial killer)|Peter Moore]]: also known as "The Man in Black"; businessman who killed four men at random in [[North Wales]] in 1995.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.flintshirechronicle.co.uk/flintshire-news/local-flintshire-news//tm_headline=flintshire-murderer-peter-moore-in-european-court-of-human-rights-appeal-over-life-sentence%26method=full%26objectid=28267583%26siteid=51352-name_page.html |title=Flintshire murderer Peter Moore in European Court of Human Rights appeal over life sentence |first=Eleanor |last=Barlow |date=3 March 2011 |newspaper=[[Flintshire Chronicle]] |accessdate=13 October 2011 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20110720013139/http://www.flintshirechronicle.co.uk/flintshire-news/local-flintshire-news//tm_headline=flintshire-murderer-peter-moore-in-european-court-of-human-rights-appeal-over-life-sentence%26method=full%26objectid=28267583%26siteid=51352-name_page.html |archive-date=20 July 2011}}</ref>
===United States=== {{main|List of serial killers in the United States}}
===Uruguay=== *[[Pablo Goncálvez]]: Spanish-born murderer who killed tennis player [[Patricia Miller (tennis)|Patricia Miller]]'s half-sister and two other women; freed in 2016 but was arrested in 2017 in [[Paraguay]] for carrying an unregistered weapon and a quantity of cocaine.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.teledoce.com/telemundo/nacionales/pablo-goncalvez-en-libertad-salio-de-campanero-a-las-2357-del-jueves/ |title=Pablo Goncálvez en libertad: salió de Campanero a las 23:57 del jueves 23 de junio |trans-title=Pablo Goncálvez released: he left Campanero at 23:57 on Thursday, June 23 |date=24 June 2016 |website=[[Teledoce]] |location=Uruguay |language=es |access-date=23 December 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.elpais.com.uy/informacion/paraguay-analiza-expulsion-goncalvez.html |title=Paraguay analiza la expulsión de Goncálvez |trans-title=Paraguay analyzes the expulsion of Goncálvez |date=27 June 2017 |newspaper=[[El País (Uruguay)|El País]] |location=Uruguay |language=es |access-date=27 June 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |url=http://www.elobservador.com.uy/bonomi-paraguay-pidio-informacion-pablo-goncalvez-n1089872 |title=Bonomi: "Paraguay pidió informacion" sobre Pablo Goncálvez |trans-title=Bonomi: "Paraguay asked for information" about Pablo Goncálvez |date=26 June 2017 |newspaper=[[El Observador (Uruguay)|El Observador]] |location=Uruguay |language=es |access-date=27 June 2017}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.subrayado.com.uy/noticias/68137/la-historia-de-pablo-goncalvez-ahora-preso-en-paraguay |title=La historia de Pablo Goncálvez, ahora preso en Paraguay |trans-title=The story of Pablo Goncálvez, now imprisoned in Paraguay |date=25 June 2017 |website=[[Channel 10 (Uruguay)|Subrayado]] |location=Uruguay |language=es |access-date=27 June 2017}}</ref>
===Uzbekistan=== *[[Polatbay Berdaliyev]]: raped, murdered and robbed a total of eleven women in Uzbekistan and neighboring [[Kazakhstan]] with accomplice Abduseit Ormanov between 2011 and 2012; both sentenced to life imprisonment in both countries.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.kazpravda.kz/articles/view/taksi-na-tot-svet |title=Такси на тот свет |trans-title=Taxi to the next world |first=Irina |last=Orlova |date=19 October 2018 |newspaper=[[Kazakhskaya Pravda]] |language=ru |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===Venezuela=== *[[Dorángel Vargas]]: killed and cannibalized at least ten men between 1997 and 1999 in [[San Cristóbal, Táchira]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.absurddiari.com/s/llegir.php?llegir=llegir&ref=5673 |title=El caníbal de los Andes confiesa: "Comer gente es como comer peras" |trans-title=The cannibal of the Andes confesses: 'Eating people is like eating pears' |date=19 November 2004 |website=L'absurd Diari |language=es |accessdate=10 September 2008}}</ref>
===Yemen=== *[[Abdallah al-Hubal]]: killed seven people in 1990 after the Yemeni reunion; fled prison and killed a young couple and three other people in 1998; killed in a shootout with the police.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.tueursenserie.org/article.php?id_article=30 |title=Al-Hubal, Abdallah |first=Emily |last=Tibbatts |website=Tueurs en Serie.org |language=fr |access-date=2007-10-22 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://archive.today/20120915095812/http://www.tueursenserie.org/article.php?id_article=30 |archive-date=2012-09-15}}</ref> *[[Mohammed Adam Omar]]: known as "The Sana'a Ripper"; [[Sudan]]ese morgue assistant who killed between two and 51 women across Yemen and other countries from 1975 to 1999; guilt has been questioned; executed 2001.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2001/08/14/world/sana-journal-a-fittingly-gory-finale-to-a-sordid-murder-case.html |title=Sana Journal; A Fittingly Gory Finale To a Sordid Murder Case |first=John F. |last=Burns |date=August 14, 2001 |newspaper=[[The New York Times]] |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.today/20191013081509/https://www.nytimes.com/2001/08/14/world/sana-journal-a-fittingly-gory-finale-to-a-sordid-murder-case.html |archive-date=13 October 2019}}</ref> *[[Dhu Shanatir]]: 5th-century Yemeni (formerly Himyarite) serial killer.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.paperstreetprod.com/compendium/archives/text/5intothe.txt |title=Into the Abyss |last=Horberg |first=Karl |date=8 May 1997 |website=Paper Street Productions |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20050426080712/http://www.paperstreetprod.com/compendium/archives/text/5intothe.txt |archivedate=April 26, 2005}}</ref>
===Zambia=== *[[Mailoni Brothers]]: three brothers who killed at least twelve people from 2007 to 2013 in [[Central Province, Zambia|Central Province]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://allafrica.com/stories/201306300093.html |title=Zambia: Mailoni Brothers - History of Serial Killers in Zambia |last=Kaluba |first=Austin |date=29 June 2013 |website=[[AllAfrica.com]] |accessdate=2014-04-15 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150402135713/http://allafrica.com/stories/201306300093.html |archive-date=2 April 2015}}</ref>
===Zimbabwe=== *[[Richard McGown]]: also known as "Dr. Death"; Scottish doctor responsible for administering fatal doses of morphine to at least five patients in [[Harare]] from 1986 to 1992; convicted of two counts of [[culpable homicide]] and sentenced to a year in prison, after which he was released and returned to the UK.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/news/world/race-trial-doctor-guilty-of-homicide-1567492.html |title='Race-trial' doctor guilty of homicide |first=Angus |last=Shaw |date=11 January 1995 |newspaper=[[The Independent]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
==Unidentified serial killers== This is a list of unidentified serial killers. It includes circumstances where a suspect has been arrested, but not convicted.
===Australia=== *[[Bowraville Murders]]: murders of three [[Indigenous Australians|Aboriginal]] children in 1990 and 1991.<ref>{{Cite episode |title=Truth be Told (transcript) |url=http://www.abc.net.au/austory/content/2006/s1733527.htm |access-date=24 November 2019 |series=Australian Story |series-link=Australian Story |first=Caroline |last=Jones |network=Australian Broadcasting Corporation |station=[[ABC Television]] |date=4 September 2006 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160701073359/http://www.abc.net.au/austory/content/2006/s1733527.htm |archive-date=1 July 2016}}</ref><ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.smh.com.au/articles/2004/02/07/1075854109819.html |title=Lone cop to tell inquest name of killer suspect |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date=February 8, 2004 |newspaper=The Sydney Morning Herald |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref><ref>{{Cite episode |title=The Ghosts of Bowraville (transcript) |url=http://www.abc.net.au/cgi-bin/common/printfriendly.pl?http%3A%2F%2Fwww.abc.net.au%2Frn%2Ftalks%2Fbbing%2Fstories%2Fs10587.htm |access-date=2019-02-21 |series=Background Briefing |first=Chris |last=Bullock |network=Australian Broadcasting Corporation |station=[[ABC Radio National]] |date=20 July 1997 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170101001011/http://www.abc.net.au/cgi-bin/common/printfriendly.pl?http%3A%2F%2Fwww.abc.net.au%2Frn%2Ftalks%2Fbbing%2Fstories%2Fs10587.htm |archive-date=2017-01-01}}</ref> *[[Claremont serial killings]]: murders of two young women and the disappearance of a third in 1996 and 1997.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/2018-02-22/bradley-edwards-charged-with-sarah-spiers-murder/9475258 |title=Claremont serial killings: Sarah Spiers murder charge for Bradley Robert Edwards |date=23 February 2018 |website=[[ABC News (Australia)|ABC News]] |accessdate=27 February 2018}}</ref> *[[The Family Murders]]: murder and mutilation of five young men and boys from 1979 to 1983. [[Bevan Spencer von Einem]] was convicted of one murder.<ref>{{cite episode |title=The Butchered Boys |series=Crime Investigation Australia |series-link=Crime Investigation Australia |network=[[Crime & Investigation Network]] |series-no=1 |number=16}}</ref> *[[Tynong North and Frankston Murders]]: murders of six females in [[Tynong North, Victoria|Tynong North]] and Frankston in 1980 and 1981.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.theage.com.au/national/retired-detectives-back-in-the-hunt-20051121-ge1a2c.html |title=Retired detectives back in the hunt |last=Silvester |first=John |date=2005-11-21 |newspaper=The Age |access-date=2018-09-14}}</ref>
===Belgium=== *[[Brabant killers]]: gang of serial killers who operated in the [[Brabant (province)|Brabant]] province from 1982 until 1985; murdered 28 people and injured 40.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://news.vice.com/article/police-are-running-out-of-time-to-catch-the-crazy-brabant-killers |title=Police Are Running Out of Time to Catch the 'Crazy Brabant Killers' |last=Dall'Armellina |first=Virgile |date=24 October 2014 |website=Vice.com |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *The [[Butcher of Mons]]: unidentified serial killer who committed five murders from January 1996 to July 1997 in [[Mons]]. Montenegrin murderer [[Smail Tulja]] is suspected of being the Butcher.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2012/01/08/magazine/hunt-for-a-serial-killer.html |title=On the Trail of an Intercontinental Killer |last=Schmidle |first=Nicholas |date=5 January 2012 |newspaper=The New York Times |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===Brazil=== *[[Paturis Park murders]]: also known as the "Rainbow Maniac"; series of thirteen gunshot murders of gay men between July 2007 and August 2008 in Paturis Park in [[Carapicuiba]].<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.abc.net.au/news/stories/2008/12/10/2442827.htm |title=Police hunt suspected serial killer in Brazil |last=Olle |first=Nick |authorlink=Nick Olle |date=10 December 2008 |website=[[ABC News (Australia)|ABC News]] |access-date=5 September 2017}}</ref>
===Canada=== *[[Highway of Tears murders|Highway of Tears]]: death and disappearance of around 40 young women in [[British Columbia]] since 1969.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.cbc.ca/archives/entry/bcs-infamous-highway-of-tears |title=BC's infamous 'Highway of Tears' |last=Lee |first=Miyoung |date=November 17, 2009 |website=CBC Digital Archives |publisher=[[Canadian Broadcasting Corporation]] |accessdate=10 December 2009}}</ref> *[[Toronto hospital baby deaths]]: deaths of at least eight babies at Toronto's Hospital for Sick Children in 1980 and 1981 were initially alleged to be [[digoxin]] poisonings, a theory which was cast into doubt by new evidence in 2010-2011.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.stcatharinesstandard.ca/2011/03/06/dead-babies-remain-a-mystery |title=Dead babies remain a mystery |agency=[[QMI Agency]] |date=March 6, 2011 |newspaper=[[St. Catharines Standard]] |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171225035344/http://www.stcatharinesstandard.ca/2011/03/06/dead-babies-remain-a-mystery |archive-date=2017-12-25}}</ref>
===Costa Rica=== *[[El Psicópata]]: killed nineteen people from 1986 to 1996 in [[Cartago, Costa Rica|Cartago]], [[Curridabat]] and [[Desamparados]]; suspected of other similar crimes.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.diarioextra.com/2001/febrero/13/sucesos03.html |title=De Jack el Destripador de Londres al Destripador de San José |trans-title=From Jack the Ripper of London to the Ripper of San José |last=Araya |first=Hugo |date=February 13, 2001 |newspaper=[[Diario Extra (Costa Rica)|Diario Extra]] |language=es |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20101121031159/http://www.diarioextra.com/2001/febrero/13/sucesos03.html |archive-date=2010-11-21}}</ref>
===Finland=== *[[Murder of Susanne Lindholm#Serial killer theory|Helsinki cellar killer]]: suspected of raping and strangling three women in Helsinki cellars between 1979 and 1981, including Susanne Lindholm; the validity of this theory has been disputed.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.is.fi/kotimaa/art-2000000964453.html|title=Who killed them? 'The old thing can be reopened'|last=|first=|date=July 20, 2015|website=Ilta-Sanomat|language=fi-FI|url-status=live|archive-url=|archive-date=|access-date=August 25, 2018}}</ref> *[[Hausjärvi Gravel Pit Murders|Järvenpää Serial Killer]]: responsible for the so-called "[[Hausjärvi]] [[Gravel Pit]] Murders"; killed a woman in 1991 and suspected in the disappearance of another in 1993; possibly responsible for other abductions and murders in the late 20th century.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://keski-uusimaa.fi/Uutiset/Arkisto/2008/07/15/Jarvenpaan-sarjamurhaaja-yrittanyt-ehka-uusia-tekonsa2 |title=Jarvenpaan sarjamurhaaja yrittanyt ehka uusia tekonsa |trans-title=Järvenpää's serial killer perhaps tried new things |first=Malin |last=Jarkko |date=15 July 2008 |newspaper=[[Uusimaa (newspaper)|Uusimaa]] |language=fi |accessdate=22 April 2014}}{{Dead link|date=July 2019 |bot=InternetArchiveBot |fix-attempted=yes}}</ref>
===Germany=== {{Main|List of German serial killers}}
===India=== *Beer Man: murdered seven people in south [[Mumbai]] between October 2006 and January 2007.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.hindustantimes.com/india/beer-man-acquitted-in-second-murder-case-too/story-yG21TyRav3e80e9SlETFlM.html |title='Beer Man' acquitted in second murder case too |last=Iyer |first=Vignesh |date=July 12, 2008 |newspaper=[[Hindustan Times]] |access-date=May 23, 2017}}</ref> *[[Stoneman]]: responsible for thirteen murders in [[Kolkata]] in 1989.<ref>{{Cite news |url=https://www.hindustantimes.com/india/the-elusive-stoneman-of-kolkata/story-BQBcCHfk87WvoLp2LSCKRN.html |title=The elusive stoneman of Kolkata |first=Ritujay |last=Ghosh |date=December 30, 2006 |newspaper=Hindustan Times |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===Italy=== *[[Monster of Florence]]: committed eight murders of couples in a series of sixteen between 1968 and 1985. Giancarlo Lotti and Mario Vanni were convicted of four of the murders, but this conviction has been widely criticized.<ref>{{Cite web |url=http://www.crimelibrary.com/serial_killers/predators/monster_florence/10.html |title=The Monster of Florence |first=David |last=Lohr |authorlink=David Lohr |website=[[Crime Library]] |page=10 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140403090508/http://www.crimelibrary.com/serial_killers/predators/monster_florence/10.html |archivedate=2014-04-03}}</ref> *[[Monster of Udine]]: killed at least four victims in the [[Province of Udine]], [[Italy]].<ref>{{cite news |url=http://messaggeroveneto.gelocal.it/udine/cronaca/2012/01/27/news/in-un-ventennio-14-omicidi-e-3-arresti-1.3113223 |title=In un ventennio 14 omicidi e 3 arresti |trans-title=In twenty years, 14 murders and 3 arrests |date=27 January 2012 |newspaper=[[Messaggero Veneto – Giornale del Friuli]] |language=it |accessdate=18 December 2014}}</ref>
===Japan=== *[[Paraquat murders]]: series of indiscriminate poisonings carried out in Japan in 1985 where twelve people were killed.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/1985/12/10/world/japanese-puzzle-the-vending-machine-murders.html |title=Japanese Puzzle: The Vending Machine Murders |last1=Haberman |first1=Clyde |date=December 10, 1985 |newspaper=The New York Times |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref> *[[Wednesday Strangler]]: killed 7 children and women in [[Saga Prefecture]] between 1975 and 1989, most of them on Wednesdays; a suspect was indicted for three of the murders, but later acquitted.<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20071011104304/http://www.nishinippon.co.jp/news/wordbox/display/4796/ Kitamachi consecutive female murder case (West Japan Newspaper WORDBOX)]</ref>
===Mexico=== *[[Female homicides in Ciudad Juárez]]: also known as "The dead women of Juárez"; the violent deaths of hundreds of women since 1993 in the northern Mexican city of [[Ciudad Juárez]].<ref>{{cite journal |title=Violencia Femicida : Violence Against Women and Mexico's Structural Crisis |last=Olivera |first=Mercedes |journal=[[Latin American Perspectives]] |date=March 1, 2006 |volume=33 |issue=104 |pages=104–114 |doi=10.1177/0094582X05286092|url=https://semanticscholar.org/paper/24615d971dc35c9dd58cfc0884cf7de0ea8f5029 }}</ref>
===Namibia=== *[[B1 Butcher]]: murdered at least five women between 2005 and 2007, with all murders related to the [[B1 road (Namibia)|National Road B1]].<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.namibian.com.na/40811/archive-read/B-1-Butcher-DNA-evidence-in-spotlight-REPORTS |title=B-1 Butcher: DNA evidence in spotlight |last=Menges |first=Werner |date=29 April 2008 |newspaper=[[The Namibian]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===Nicaragua=== *[[San Juan del Sur Psychopath]]: murdered between two and ten men in the coastal town of [[San Juan del Sur]], from 2000 to 2002; a German [[alien (law)|illegal alien]] residing in [[Managua]] was arrested on suspicion, but later cleared of the murders.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://www.laprensa.com.ni/2002/03/10/nacionales/829404-misterio-ronda-crmenes-de-san-juan-del-sur |title=Misterio ronda crímenes de San Juan del Sur |trans-title=Mystery around crimes of San Juan del Sur |first=Noelia |last=Sánchez |date=March 10, 2002 |newspaper=[[La Prensa (Managua)|La Prensa]] |language=es |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===Poland=== *[[Łódź Gay Murderer]]: murdered seven homosexual men from 1988 to 1993 in Łódź.<ref>{{Cite news |url=http://lodz.wyborcza.pl/lodz/1,35136,7956685,_Zdarzylo_sie_w_Lodzi___Mordowal_gejow_na_Fabrycznym.html |title="Zdarzyło się w Łodzi": Mordował gejów na Fabrycznym |trans-title="It happened in Łódź": He murdered gays on Fabryczny |first1=Marcin |last1=Masłowski |first2=Agnieszka |last2=Urazińska |first3=Jerzy |last3=Walczyk |lastauthoramp=yes |date=May 31, 2010 |newspaper=[[Gazeta Wyborcza]] |language=pl |accessdate=15 January 2016}}</ref>
===Portugal=== *[[Lisbon Ripper]]: murdered three women in [[Lisbon]] between 1992 and 1993.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://geocities.com/verbal_plainfield/coldcases/lisbon.html |title=Unsolved Serial Killings; Portugal, Lisbon |date=October 27, 2009 |website=Serial Killer A-Z |access-date=24 November 2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20091027121656/http://geocities.com/verbal_plainfield/coldcases/lisbon.html |archive-date=2009-10-27}}</ref>
===Russia=== {{Main|List of Russian serial killers}}
===South Africa=== *[[Sleepy Hollow Killer]]: thought to be responsible for the murders of at least thirteen women in the late 1990s, including three more in 2007, around [[Pietermaritzburg]] and the surrounding area.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.iol.co.za/news/south-africa/serial-killer-in-pietermaritzburg-report-387211 |title=Serial killer in Pietermaritzburg: report |date=28 January 2008 |website=[[Independent Online (South Africa)|Independent Online]] |access-date=24 November 2019}}</ref>
===United Kingdom=== *[[Bible John]]: thought to be responsible for the deaths of three women in [[Glasgow]], [[Scotland]], in the late 1960s.<ref>{{cite news |url=https://news.google.com/newspapers?id=v-NAAAAAIBAJ&sjid=3KYMAAAAIBAJ&pg=3021%2C2603615 |title=A Kiss Before Dying: 20 years on, the mystery of Bible John still haunts a city |last=Skelton |first=Douglas |date=10 February 1989 |newspaper=[[Evening Times]] |accessdate=22 May 2013}}</ref> *[[Jack the Ripper]]: murdered prostitutes in the East End of London in 1888.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.met.police.uk/history/ripper.htm |title=The Enduring Mystery of Jack the Ripper |website=[[Metropolitan Police]] |accessdate=31 January 2010 |url-status=dead |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20100204014147/http://www.met.police.uk/history/ripper.htm |archivedate=4 February 2010}}</ref> *[[Jack the Stripper]]: responsible for the London "[[Hammersmith]] nude murders" between 1964 and 1965.<ref>{{cite news |url=http://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/lifestyle/nostalgia/retro-mystery-jack-stripper-murders-5978691 |title=Retro: The mystery of the Jack the Stripper murders |first=James |last=Gates |date=12 March 2012 |work=[[Trinity Mirror|Get West London]] |accessdate=4 January 2017 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20150411025947/http://www.getwestlondon.co.uk/lifestyle/nostalgia/retro-mystery-jack-stripper-murders-5978691 |archive-date=April 11, 2015}}</ref> *[[Thames Torso Murders|Thames Torso Murderer]]: thought to be responsible for the murder and dismemberment of four women in London between 1887 and 1889.<ref>{{cite book |first=R. Michael |last=Gordon |title=The Thames Torso Murders of Victorian London |url=https://books.google.com/books?id=cbCzCgAAQBAJ&pg=PA1 |date=3 October 2015 |publisher=McFarland |location=London, UK |isbn=978-1-4766-1665-0}}</ref>
